story:
Thank you so much to everyone who took the time to support our campaign. Unfortunately, we simply didn't raise enough to reach our goal. If you did donate and have not yet received a refund, please feel free to drop us a line and we'll sort you right out. 

Lots of love, 

Gili & Liat 

 

                             

 

 

 

                                                     

Michal Cole, Mute Ululation, still from video 

//EXHIBITION and PUBLICATION 

Inspired by the poetry of renowned Israeli poet and political activist Dahlia Ravikovitch, The Roar of Waters presents six Israeli artists whose work speaks to the fragile and aggressive nature of their social and political identities. The exhibition, named after Ravikovitch’s 1964 poem of the same name, brings together artists whose work addresses the stoicism, disillusionment and hope in contemporary Israeli society. We will be sourcing a book of poems by writers worldwide in response to the exhibiting artworks, to be read and distributed throughout the exhibition. 

Dahlia Ravikovitch (1936 – 2005) was the first major female Hebrew poet of her generation and one of the most celebrated poets in Israeli history. Admired for her artistry, courage and peace activism, her prolific writings remain among the most preeminent of the Israeli literary canon. A love poet, mother, feminist and outspoken opposer of discrimination in Israel, Ravikovitch represented the duality of aggression versus fragility that permeates the Israeli psyche. The aim of this exhibition is to provide a visual component to Ravikovitch’s powerful poetry, and to depict the eternal clash between what a human ideal could be and what it actually is.                 

 

//ARTISTS

Exhibiting artists include the extraordinarily talented, wonderful and supportive Sheffy Bleier, Dvora Morag, Nelly Agassi, Inbal Hoffman, Michal Ohana-Cole and Karen Anavy.

Inbal Hoffman, Dark Matter, installation 

Sheffy Bleier, from the series Garden of Organs

Dvora Morag, Phantom 

//PHILOSOPHY

The Roar of Waters emphasises a creative language taking place outside of the conventional narrative. It advocates for freedom of artistic expression from within complex socio-political environments, by artists whose interpretations are wholly subjective, personal and conflicted in the reconciliation between their own truth and that of their governments. Rather than oppressing the voice of those seeking understanding, The Roar of Waters offers a platform to discuss the aesthetic, academic and emotional implications of a polarising region in the contemporary landscape. Initiated by two curators with Israeli heritage who have since left their home country, the exhibition program aims to highlight the influence of art and poetry in the political realm, both within and outside the country in question. 

Keren Anavy, paper cut installation 

//WHO

Gili Karev and Liat Chen, friends turned co-curators living between Tel Aviv (Liat) and London (Gili). We've been conceptualising, fundraising for and and promoting Roar of Waters for over a year over countless emails, phone calls, Skype sessions and late-night, post-work/flight meetings. 

//WHAT 

EXHIBITION featuring works by Sheffy Bleier, Dvora Morag, Nelly Agassi, Inbal Hoffman, Karen Anavy and Michal Ohana-Cole

PUBLICATION of poetry sourced worldwide that responds to the exhibited artworks 

PANEL DISCUSSIONS with academics, curators and artists on the influence of art on social and political structures 

 

//WE CAN DO THIS

We are so grateful to have received in-kind funding for our venue and some of our shipping costs thanks to the generosity of The Cello Factory, Zim Shipping and EBISS. We would not have gotten this far without their support. 

We still need to raise a minimum of £8,000 to get this programme off the ground. These costs cover everything from the transport of the artworks to the venue, the artist travel costs to create their installations and performance pieces in London, and the publication of the poetry book. All contributions to Roar of Waters will go directly towards these costs. 

This includes: 

£500 Artwork shipping

£500 “Freight Forwarding” services from Israel to London (packing and logistics of artwork between ports)

£200 Installation costs 

£4,000 Costs for Artist’s Travel and Artwork Production 

£2,000 Sourcing and printing 100 editions of the poetry book 

Anything we raise beyond £8,000 will go towards enriching our public programme with speakers, performance pieces and one-off events throughout the duration of the exhibition. 

 

//FOR YOU!


Original Dasmarca hat from www.dasmarca.co.uk

 

 

Original work by exhibiting artist Inbal Hoffman
Entitled Through the Proper Channel 
Ceramic and branches
£100 each, £300 for the set of four 

Original artwork by exhibiting artist Dvora Morag (Versions 1 and 2) 
Woodcut print, 1990 
20x30cm
Signed and numbered

Edition Artworks by Exhibiting artist Michal Cole (Versions 1, 2 and 3) 
Museum quality prints of original money works - edition of 100
size A4

 

        
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Light object by Naama Hofman in collaboration with Gidi Gilam AKA Signor Gi 
30x30 cm

(pictured: pre-collaboration) 

www.naamahofman.com

Original artwork by Gidi Gilam, aka SIGNOR G 
The Tempest 1 and The Tempest 2
Acrylic and ink on paper
80 x 60cm, framed with glass

 

 

Original artwork by Shani Nahmias
Myselves, 2008 
Gelatine Silver Print
50 x 50cm, signed edition 1/5

 

 

Original work by Nir Adoni 
2013
Metal laser cutting 
88x50cm 

 

 

Original work by Nelly Agassi 

2016

28x35.5cm 

Signed, Unframed 

 

Original artwork by exhibition artist Keren Anavy 
2009 
Paper cut
50 x 50cm, framed 

 

//WHEN and WHERE?

The exhibition private view will take place on April 20, 2017, and run for the public until April 30th. Talks, performance pieces, poetry readings and other special events will be announced closer to the date. 

The entire programme will take place within the beautiful Cello Factory Gallery in Waterloo, London. 

 

//THANK YOU!!

As independent curators, our challenges often revolve around raising enough money to realise our exhibition ideas. Roar of Waters is the most grassroots project either of us have ever done, and as a result has been the most challenging, stimulating and rewarding of all. We are so grateful for the support we have received from our exhibiting artists, friends and fellow arts professionals who believe in this project as much as we do. With their help we are confident that this exhibition can be as impactful and influential as we envisioned it - we just need your help to bring it to life!

We understand that not everyone has the means to support us financially. If you like our idea but don’t have any wiggle room to donate right now, we hope you’ll take the time to share our campaign with your friends and family who might be able to help.

story:
The wish to organize a real underground music festival, in the land of the Midnight Sun, has existed in the minds of several party crews in all of Scandinavia for decades.
However, to actually reach the region with the phenomena of Midnight Sun, you need to travel far away from the big cities and main regions of Scandinavian peninzula. 

The vision of a festival matured and suddenly a new group of friends was brought together, from Norway/Finland/Sweden. This group consisted of "normal working class hippies" with deep connections to the underground electronic music scene. 

The group had no funds or financial support when they started to manifest this vision. But after finding the correct location and make the first visits to Værøy, a very optimistic energy was rooted in the group.

Several thousands of working hours later, the first edition of Midnight Sun Festival was a fact. Sunlight 24/7 in one of the hottest summers of the century (in north norway). More then 100 underground artists performed during 6 days and participants from 30 nations enjoyed the raw energy of it. For a short while, a strong feeling of success was felt in the group. However, it didnt last for long. The financial aspect of the festival was not so bright. We had set the ticket prices to adapt accordingly to the original vision. The original vision was always about bringing people from all over the world, not only from Scandinavia. We had adjusted a price on the festival ticket, that was way below "norwegian standard". Even though we had a fantastic crew that spent countless of working-hours without getting paid, it is still the case that Norway is one of the most expencive countries in the world. In addition, the island of Værøy is extremely remote and the logistics is very expencive. Lesson was learned..

So what happened next? Well, the crew decided to try again! Since the festival location is so remote and the work behind is on such a large scale, it was decided that the second edition of Midnight Sun Festival was planned to happen in 2016. (meaning a 2 years break after the 2014 edition)

Everyone who participated the 2016 edition can witness about it's crazyness. 1500 participants from 50 nations experienced another week of dance, joy, laughter, arctic nature.... and a proper storm! Even though we had raised the ticket prices for the 2016 edition, the financial result still wasn't good. The 2016 edition ended with slightly better results then the 2014 edition, but still with a minus...
The total amount of remaining debt after 2 editions of the festival, is $150.000. Since $50.000 is investments from the funders/organizors, what remains as pure debt to creditors is $100.000. 

That means that $100.000 should be covered, before the next edition of the festival takes place. Midnight Sun Festival have 27.000 followers on Facebook. 

If each one of our followers would donate an average of only $4 per person, or if half of all followers would donate $8 per person, all of the festival's debts could be covered!

Again, your contribution DOES HELP. No donation is too small. Together we will make magic happen again :) Please help us to spread the message!

story:
Worum geht es?

 

Wir sind ein internationales Team von Handwerkern und Künstlern, die Fantasien aus Metall umsetzen. Für LARP, Fashion, Reenactment, als Accessoire oder Lingerie - in einem Detailgrad und personalisiert wie nie zuvor.

Insbesondere werden wir auch komplette Konzepte umsetzen, inklusive deiner maßgefertigten Wunsch-Arbeit aus Metall, einer passenden Location, Styling und einem professionellen Fotoshooting.

Unser Team besteht aus:

  • einem Schmied mit 13 Jahren Erfahrung in diesem Handwerk und der Unternehmensführung
  • einem Designer mit 6 Jahren Erfahrung
  • einem Supportteam mit riesiger Motivation, das unseren Artisanen den Rücken frei hält

Wir wollen dieses Team dauerhaft zusammenbringen und professionalisieren- und die Werkstatt ausbauen um ganz neue Techniken anbieten zu können. Mit diesem Kickstarter unterstützt ihr uns beim Projekt "Werkstattausbau" - dafür erhaltet ihr einzigartige Perks und Einblicke.

 

Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst

 

Wir brauchen rund 35.000 EUR für den Ausbau unserer bereits vorhandenen Werkstatt.

Wir schaffen es aber auch mit weniger - wir sind Improvisationstalente. Jeder Euro, den du uns zukommen lässt (abzüglich Steuern und Gebühren) fließt in den Aufbau unseres Traums, auch wenn wir das Ziel nicht erreichen.

Dafür erhältst du im Rahmen dieses Crowdfundings einzigartige Perks, die wir nie wieder in dieser Form und zu diesem Preis anbieten werden. Neugierig? Schau dir die Perks an! Bilder davon findest du hier in unserer Galerie.

 

Pilotprojekte

 

Um zu zeigen, was wir können, haben wir zwei Pilotprojekte gebaut.

Eher aus dem Bereich LARP/Rüstungsbau ist das Projekt "Armouring the Heavens". Eher im Bereich Fashion/Erotik zu verorten sind unsere "Dark Desires". Beide Projekte könnt ihr auf unserer Facebook-Seite (@MetalArtisan) bewundern.

  

 

Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann

 

Ihr findet unsere Arbeiten toll, habt aber schlicht kein Geld? Ihr könnt uns trotzdem unterstützen. Erzählt anderen von der Kampagne, besucht unsere Facebook-Seite, teilt unser Video.

Oder kontaktiert info@metal-artisans.de und werdet Teil unserer Community.

**********************

What's this all about?
 

We are an international team of craftsmen and artists creating fantasies in metal. For fashion, theater, larp and film, as accessoire or even lingerie - in great detail and personalized like never before.

We will be especially pleased to bring your personal concepts into life - beginning with a custom designed and tailored metal work and including a professional photoshooting in a fitting location with styling and retouching.

Our team consists of:

- An armourdesigner with 13 years experience in his craft and in leading his own company
- a designer/artist with 6 years experience
- a 3-person support team with awesome motivation and skill to keep our artisans free from unneccessary encumberment

We are striving to create a lasting partnership and ongoing professionalization - and to expand the workshop and buy equipment to offer new techniques.
In participating in this kickstarter you are directly supporting our workshop upgrade - and in turn you will receive unique perks and insights.

 

What do you get in return for your participation?
 

We will need approx 35.000 € to improve and expand the already existing workshop.

But we can do with less - we are great at improvising. Each Euro given by you (minus taxes and fees) helps us to reach our goal.

In return we offer unique perks, which will never be available in this form and at this price again. Curious? Check out our perks! You can find pictures of them in our gallery here on this site.

 


Pilot Projects
 

To demonstrate the range of our skills we finished two pilot projects.
"Armouring the heavens" is more from the armourers perspective, while "Dark Desires" is located on the other end of the spectrum - art and fashion.
Both of our projects can be marveled at on our facebook page (@MetalArtisan).

 

Other ways to help:
 

You like our products, but you're just out of money? You can still support us. Help spread the word of this campaign, visit and like our facebook-page, share our video.

Or contact info@metal-artisans.de and become part of our "Friends of Metal Artisans" community.

story:
Emerging Artist-in-Residence

Help Digital Artist Residency launch an Artist-in-Residence scheme for young and emerging artists. Artist will receive: 

  • Bursary for artists.
  • Exhibition at OVADA, Oxford.
  • Mentoring from industry professionals.
  • Assistance with technical development and marketing of their work.

This is a great chance to provide artists embarking on a new career with valuable professional experience.

What We Need & What You Get

The basics:

  • DAR is applying for Arts Council funding to make this possible, however it needs valuable funding upfront to make that application possible. Your funding will be absolutely essential to getting this project off the ground!
  • In return: get a limited edition Digital artwork and/or an invitation to the private view.
  • All funds go towards making the residency and exhibition possible. Thanks to you, young artists will get paid to develop their project; with the help of mentorship, publicity and technical expertise along the way.

In more detail: The Emerging Artist in Residence scheme will provide support and funding for upcoming artists (these could include students or recent graduates) to create and realise a new project with digital media. Artists will be selected through an ‘open call’ process based on the quality of the proposed project. The commissioned works will be exhibited online on DAR’s dedicated website which acts as a personal space for artists to create and develop the new works. DAR is a new initiative but has been producing ambitious digital projects for over 14 months.

The artists will also have a chance to develop these works further with an exhibition at OVADA. DAR will also provide support in the form of mentoring as well as promotional support to help the artist nurture a professional network. The grant will contribute towards staffing costs for managing the project and a stipend to help artists with materials and pay for their time.

The Impact

This could make a huge difference to the emerging artists involved. It would help give artists the necessary funds to make work. It will give them a chance to show case their work on an international stage with mentorship from professionals and publicity. DAR supported digital artists throughout its development and believes in fair and proper pay for artists.

Risks & Challenges

The Emerging Artist-in-Residence will require further Arts Council funding to make this possible and there is a chance it the project may not get funded if it doesn’t raise the required match-funding to qualify it for an ACE grant. Your donation will be absolutely essential to getting this project off the ground!

We have local support from OVADA and Oxford City Council already providing some cash and in-kind benefits.

Please help by sharing!

Please share this project on social media sites. Thank you

In return: get a limited edition Digital artwork and/or an invitation to the private view.
All funds go towards making the residency and exhibition possible. Thanks to you, young artists will get paid to develop their project; with the help of mentorship, publicity and technical expertise along the way.

In more detail: The Emerging Artist in Residence scheme will provide support and funding for upcoming artists (these could include students or recent graduates) to create and realise a new project with digital media. Artists will be selected through an ‘open call’ process based on the quality of the proposed project. The commissioned works will be exhibited online on DAR’s dedicated website which acts as a personal space for artists to create and develop the new works. DAR is a new initiative but has been producing ambitious digital projects for over 14 months.
The artists will also have a chance to develop these works further with an exhibition at OVADA. DAR will also provide support in the form of mentoring as well as promotional support to help the artist nurture a professional network. The grant will contribute towards staffing costs for managing the project and a stipend to help artists with materials and pay for their time.
The Impact
This could make a huge difference to the emerging artists involved. It would help give artists the necessary funds to make work. It will give them a chance to show case their work on an international stage with mentorship from professionals and publicity. DAR supported digital artists throughout its development and believes in fair and proper pay for artists.
Risks & Challenges
The Emerging Artist-in-Residence will require further Arts Council funding to make this possible and there is a chance it the project may not get funded if it doesn’t raise the required match-funding to qualify it for an ACE grant. Your donation will be absolutely essential to getting this project off the ground!
We have local support from OVADA and Oxford City Council already providing some cash and in-kind benefits.
Please help by sharing!
Please share this project on social media sites. Thank you

story:
Our goal

RESET is a team of architects from Peru researching and spreading the importance of livable and sustainable built environments for human dynamics, by providing learning experiences focused in design and innovative construction methods.

This time, our project is 'Reset#1', a skill development workshop that  targets the construction of an experimental pavilion which will be displayed at the AfrikaBurn festival from April 23rd to 29th 2018. 

The construction implies international collaboration with local communities in Cape Town and a learning opportunity about alternative construction methods.

-------------------

RESET es un grupo de arquitectos peruanos investigando y difundiendo la importancia de ambientes construidos habitables, afectivos y sostenibles, a través de experiencias de aprendizaje en base al diseño y construcción.

Esta vez, la experiencia es Reset#1, taller cuyo objetivo es la construcción un pabellón experimental que será exhibido y utilizado en el festival AfrikaBurn 2018 llevado a cabo en el desierto de Tankwa, en Sudáfrica, entre el 23 y 29 de abril del 2018.

El taller de construcción es una oportunidad de colaboración internacional con comunidades locales y de aprendizaje sobre métodos de construcción alternativos.

 

What We Need & What You Get

To achieve our goal, we need US$15,000. This amount will be to complete the budget designated for materials, space rental, equipment and tools, transport of the installation to Tankwa, and basic needs of the team during the working days.  

Check out our list of perks! 

--------------------------------------------------------------

Para alcanzar nuestra meta, necesitamos recaudar US$ 15,000. Esta cifra será utilizada para completar el presupuesto designado a materiales, alquiler de espacios de trabajo y herramientas, transporte del pabellón a la ciudad de Tankwa, y necesidades básicas del equipo durante los días de trabajo.

¡Mira nuestra lista de recompensas! 

 

About the artwork

From taking the relationship mind-body-environment to new limits, the theory of the oblique plane (Claude Parent), and the contextual considerations of Tankwa desert, RESET is the result of multiple deformations and operations over a rectangular plane, turning into an ‘undomesticated piece of land’, contrasting the planar topology of the desert, and open to interpretation as a surface to transit, shelter or stage. This surface shall challenge the automatization of the human body towards more conscious cognitive processes and the awareness of corporal movement.

The participants of AfrikaBurn are welcome to transit the pavilion and leave a sign of their path by weaving fluorescent thin rope through the installation according the sequence they follow. These ‘traces’ will constitute the ultimate skin and will be visible during the night as the rope will shine in the dark.

The pavilion is designed with the help of digital tools optimize the material and structural performance considering gravity and wind forces.  The pavilion is built out of plywood and fixed to the ground by heavy wooden bases. 

---------------------------------------

Partiendo de la relación mente y cuerpo llevada a nuevos límites, la teoría del plano oblicuo (Claude Parent), y las consideraciones contextuales sobre el desierto de Tankwa, Reset#1 es el resultado de múltiples operaciones y deformaciones sobre un plano rectangular que se convierte un terreno no domesticado contrastante con la topología del desierto. Reset#1 provee un ambiente poco común para retar a la automatización del cuerpo humano, buscando procesos cognitivos más conscientes y estar alerta sobre el movimiento corporal. Asimismo, el pabellón puede ser interpretado como un espacio de tránsito, descanso o escenario. 

Los participantes de AfrikaBurn, serán bienvenidos a transitar el pabellón mientras tejen un hilo fosforescente de acuerdo a su recorrido. Así, este "trazo" conformará la piel última del pabellón y será visible durante la noche cuando el tejido empiece a brillar.

El pabellón fue diseñado con la ayuda de herramientas digitales para optimizar el uso de materiales y comportamiento estructural considerando la gravedad y vientos. El pabellón será construido con triplay  y tendrá cimientos de anillos de madera. 

 

Our impact

This project seeks to destroy the idea of the impossible.  This is not merely a matter of artistic expression. RESET is a participative learning opportunity and an exploration tool. 

During the construction… Reset #1 is an opportunity for crossing borders and achieve a collaborative work among the Peruvian design team, fab-labs in Cape Town (SA), and local communities that can be benefited from learning about alternative construction methods and processes. The very basic idea of working with digital fabrication is that we assemble Reset#1 together like a giant 3D puzzle. With basic instructions, potentially anyone can participate in the assembling. Local designers, architecture students, carpenters, technical schools or any other individuals are welcome.

Once built… AfrikaBurn participant shall join to explore and perform. The pavilion is open to be transited carefully while weaving a rope along it; however, RESET can also be used as a stage or space for artistic performances during the festival.

 

Queremos destruir la idea de lo imposible. Esto no sólo se tratá de expresarnos en un lenguaje artístico. RESET ofrece una experiencia de aprendizaje y una oportunidad de colaboración.

Durante la construcción... Reset#1 es una oportunidad para cruzar fronteras y lograr la colaboración entre diseñadores peruanos, fab-labs en Ciudad del Cabo, y comunidades locales que puedan beneficiarse al aprender sobre métodos de construcción alternativos. La idea de trabajar con fabricación digital, es poder ensamblar el pabellón como un rompecabezas 3d gigante. Con instrucciones básicas todos pueden participar en la construcción. Bienvenidos son diseñadores locales, estudiantes, carpinteros, escuelas técnicas o cualquier individuo.

Ya construido... Los participantes de AfrikaBurn podrán unirse para explorar. El pabellón está abierto a ser transitado, con el respectivo cuidado, mientras se teje la soga según el recorrido, pero también esperando verlo siendo usado como un escenario.

 

Risks & Challenges

AfrikaBurn is a participation-based self-reliant event. Building Reset#1 will be no easy task considering the harsh climate conditions, ‘days can hit the high 40s, nights can be freezing, there are spectacular storms and galeforce winds can cause whiteouts.’ In addition, the road to Tankwa is hard going and becomes treacherously dangerous at high speeds.

Out team is considering such conditions and planning to detail every day from Perú to Cape Town to Tankwa. Our partnership with local teams and coordination months previous to the festival ensure that the building activities take place normally.

----------------------------------------

AfrikaBurn es un evento basado en la participación y autosuficiencia a la vez. Construir Reset#1 no será tarea fácil dadas las condiciones extremas: temperaturas de hasta 40°C durante el día, noches muy frías, tormentas, vientos que levantan arena. Además, la ruta a Tankwa es nada segura a altas velocidades. 

El equipo está considerando estas las condiciones y planeando día a día desde Perú a Ciudad del Cabo a Tankwa. La colaboración con equipos locales y meses de coordinación previos asegurará que la construcción sea factible.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please, share this campaign among your friends and let's bring Reset#1 to life. 

Ayúdanos a compartir esta campaña entre tus amigos y traigamos Reset#1 al mundo.

 

Donate materials: write us at a@hhbau.com. / Dona materiales en CdelC. ¡Escríbenos!

Volunteers for March and April: Reset #1 @AfrikaBurn2018 
Join our facebook group if you confirm volunteering for march and early april. | Si confirmas ser voluntario para la construcción en Sudáfrica, únete a facebook.

 

Follow us!

Reset at facebook and instagram can be found as reset.hhb

 

-------------
The Team

Ana Loayza | ALL - HumanBau Arquitectos | Architect and designer, social design led projects with rural communities, Architectural Design Professor at (UPC school of architecture) and Design Thinking (UPC Business and entrepreneurship school), offices and houses project design and construction, Ateliers Jean Nouvel Lima (2012)

Natalija Boljsakov | Architect, Master in Advanced Architecture & Digital Tectonics - IAAC, UPC Cataluña. Founder and director of _NBT Architecture Studio; architecture and design practice based in Lima, specialized in use of digital design and fabrication tools.

Diego Zambrano | Senior architecture student, four years background in structural engineering, computational designer, Ikemire Architects (2017).

story:
SINOPSIS

“Sucede que soy horrible” original del escritor venezolano Gustavo Ott cuenta la historia de una familia dónde la carrera política del padre es la columna vertebral de la obra. Llevan diez años en el poder, y a raíz de un hecho contundente la dinámica familiar cambia. Las circunstancias a las que se enfrentan se tornan protagonistas. Nos muestran distintas realidades a través de las decisiones que toman: vigentes, universales y humanas. “Sucede que soy horrible”, escrita y publicada en 1983 es estrenada mundialmente por primera vez en el marco del festival de jóvenes directores del Trasnocho Cultural en Caracas, Venezuela.

 

 ¿Por qué ésta obra?

Porque 34 años después de su publicación sigue vigente con respecto a lo que somos y vivimos los venezolanos, resulta una historia premonitoria políticamente hablando. Aunque lo realmente apasionante, y he aquí el tema central,  las relaciones humanas que se muestran a través de la familia Silva.

Gustavo Ott es uno de los dramaturgos paisanos más representados en la actualidad del teatro Venezolano y es un honor realizar en estreno la pieza “Sucede que soy horrible”.

 

BIO

Sareni Siplenko tiene 24 años. Ex campeona nacional en la disciplina deportiva de Tiro Olímpico con armas cortas. Apasionada del arte culinario y el cine. Actualmente  estudiante de comunicación social.

Inició su formación en el mundo de las artes con “El Teatro Profesional de Lara”. Es actriz egresada del “Gimnasio de Actores” dirigido por Matilda Corral (egresada del Actors Studio). Ha participado en talleres especializados  con la metodología de Sanford Meisner, Uta Hagen y Stella Adler.

En el marco del festival de jóvenes directores del 2018 en Caracas, Venezuela, presenta la pieza “Sucede que soy horrible” del venezolano Gustavo Ott, en su primera representación teatral.

 

 

 

 

 

 

SYNOPSIS

"It happens that I am horrible" original from the Venezuelan writer Gustavo Ott. It tells the story of a family which father's political career is the backbone of the work. They have been in power for ten years already, and as a result of a forceful event, family dynamics changes. The circumstances they face become protagonists. They show us different realities through the decisions they take: current, universal and human. "It happens that I am horrible", written and published in 1983, is premiered worldwide for the first time in the framework of the festival of young directors of Trasnocho Cultural in Caracas Venezuela.

 

WHY THIS WORK?

Because in regard to what Venezuelans currently are and live, it is still valid after 34 years of its publication. It is a politically premonitory story. Although the really exciting thing about it, and here is the central theme, is the human relationships that are shown through the Silva’s family.

Gustavo Ott is one of the country's most represented dramatists currently in the Venezuelan theater and it is an honor to premiere the piece "It happens that I am horrible"

 

BIO

Sareni Siplenko is 24 years old. Former national champion in the sports discipline of Olympic Shooting with handguns. Passionate about culinary art and cinema. Currently a Social Comunication student.

She began her training in the arts world with "Lara Professional Theater “. She is an actress graduated from the "Actors Gym" directed by Matilda Corral (graduated from the Actors Studio). She has participated in specialized workshops with the methodology of Sanford Meisner, Uta Hagen and Stella Adler.

She presents the piece "I happen that to be horrible" by the Venezuelan Gustavo Ott, in his first theatrical performance in the framework of the festival of young directors 2018 in Caracas, Venezuela.

story:
Hello everyone, my name is Emily Martian and I'm a small time artist who has been slowly but surely spreading my silly art into the world. 4 years ago I left a full time job that was sucking every last ounce of my creativity and haven't looked back since. With my new found free time I started making art again and rented a table at a local craft show with only a few items. I had no idea the response I would get and since then have had so many people love what I do so I keep doing it. I would like to expand my current magnet selection and knew I wanted to do a set. The plan was to only offer a set of 3 but naturally months went by with zero ideas of what to have them be, then one night it all came out and now there's 7!!! Holy cow. I wanted to slim it down but I just couldn't.

I hope you enjoy what I do and help me continue on for many moons to come.

Please support & share on all your social media outlets.

story:
¿De qué va el proyecto? What is the project About?

Spanish version:

Me llevó casi 10 años alcanzar el sueño de publicar Luces en el Mar. Fue un trabajo duro, a veces pensé que era un sueño imposible que solo unos pocos podían lograr. Pero nunca dejé de creer en esta historia y en 2018 finalmente se publicó la edición en español de Luces en el Mar. Desde entonces, la novela ha sido traducida a 5 idiomas y ahora está disponible en formato digital, papel y audio en todo el mundo.

Luces en el Mar ha obtenido excelentes críticas y no podría estar más agradecido por la cálida respuesta de lectores de todo el mundo. Uno de estos lectores resultó ser un agente de Hollywood. Ahora este agente me está representando para ayudar a alcanzar el sueño más ambicioso de todos: llevar Luces en el Mar a la gran pantalla.

Convencer a los ejecutivos de los estudios no será tarea fácil. Para ello tendé que presentarles un documento en que cuente la historia de Luces en el Mar de la forma más cinemátográfica y visual posible. Por esta razón, he empezado a desarrollar una serie de imágenes inspiradas en la historia y realizadas por un brillante artista conceptual que trabaja para Netflix. Con las ilustraciones montaré entonces el documento que presentaré a los ejecutivos de Hollywood y monataré un vídeo.  Sin presión, ¿verdad?

English version:

It took me almost 10 years to achieve the dream of publishing Lights on the Sea. It was hard work, sometimes I thought it was an impossible dream that only a few could achieve. But I never stopped believing in this story and in 2018 the Spanish edition of Lights on the Sea was finally published. Since then, the novel has been translated into 5 different languages and its now available in digital, print and audio formats all over the world.

Lights on the Sea has obtained great reviews from media, celebrity authors and most important from you, reader. I can't be more grateful for the warm response that readers around the world have shared with me after reading Lights on the Sea. One of these readers happened to be a movie agent working in Hollywood. He is now representing me to help achieve the most ambitious of my dreams: bringing Lights on the Sea into the silver screen.

And the first step to accomplish this dream is to sell the idea to a Hollywood studio and to convince their executives I need to tell the story of Lights on the Sea in the most cinematic and visual way possible. That's the reason I decided to contact an excellent Concept Artist that is now helping me to develop the visuals for the movie pitch that I'm preparing to present in the upcoming months in front of Hollywood executives. No pressure at all, right?

 

¿De qué va Luces en el Mar? What is Lights on the Sea About?

Spanish version:

«Fue un rayo el desencadenante de todo…». Así empieza Luces en el mar, una emocionante novela que cuenta la historia de Harold y Mary Rose Grapes, un matrimonio que, tras la trágica muerte de su hijo, dejó a un lado sus sueños de juventud y se resignó a vivir en una isla remota, alejados de todo.

Ahora, el destino les vuelve a poner a prueba y se ven forzados a abandonar su hogar de una manera que nunca habrían imaginado. Justo la noche antes de ser desahuciados, por un problema de delimitación de costas, mientras Harold y Rose duermen, se desata una fuerte tormenta y un rayo hace que la casa se desprenda del acantilado y caiga al mar con ellos dentro.

De la forma más inesperada, los Grapes se convierten en dos náufragos a la deriva sobre una casa flotante. Comienza así un extraordinario viaje en el que deberán luchar juntos frente a las adversidades si quieren sobrevivir. Olvidarse de los fantasmas y frustraciones del pasado es imprescindible.

English version:

On the highest point of an island, in a house clinging to the edge of a cliff, live Mary Rose and Harold Grapes, a retired couple still mourning the death of their son thirty-five years before. Weighed down by decades of grief and memories, the Grapes have never moved past the tragedy. Then, on the eve of eviction from the most beautiful and dangerously unstable perch in the area, they’re uprooted by a violent storm. The disbelieving Grapes and their home take a free-fall slide into the white-capped sea and float away.

As the past that once moored them recedes and disappears, Mary Rose and Harold are delivered from decades of sorrow by the ebb and flow of the waves. Ahead of them, a light shimmers on the horizon, guiding them toward a revelatory and cathartic new engagement with life, and all its wonder.

Wildly imaginative, deeply poignant, and entirely unexpected, Lights on the Sea sweeps readers away on a journey of fate, acceptance, redemption, and survival against the most rewarding of odds.

 

¿Qué dicen los lectores sobre Luces en el Mar? What do people say about Lights on the Sea?

Spanish version:

"Luces en el Mar de Miquel Reina es una novela absolutamente encantadora y hermosa con una calidad de fábula que atraerá a todos los lectores. A los fanáticos de La Vida de Pi les encantará esta novela ”. —Kristin Hannah, autora más vendida del New York Times de El Ruiseñor y Volverás a Alaska.

"Esta bella e inusual historia explora el poder curativo del amor y la magia que existe en nuestra vida cotidiana, incluso cuando no sabemos cómo encontrarlo". —Jill Santopolo, autora más vendida del New York Times de La Luz que Perdimos.

"Luces en el Mar es el nuevo El Alquimista" —Veronika Chaloupkova, editora de Argo Editorial.

"Un cuento de fantasía agradable y finamente escrito". —Kirkus Reviews

English version:

“Miquel Reina’s Lights on the Sea is an absolutely lovely, beautiful novel with a dreamy, fable-like quality that will appeal to readers. Fans of Life of Pi will love this novel.” —Kristin Hannah, New York Times bestselling author of The Nightingale and The Great Alone

“This beautiful, unusual tale explores the healing power of love and the magic that exists in our everyday lives, even when we don’t know how to find it.” —Jill Santopolo, New York Times bestselling author of The Light We Lost

“Lights on the Sea is the new The Alchemist ” —Veronika Chaloupkova, editor or Argo

“An enjoyable, finely written fantasy tale.” —Kirkus Reviews

 

¿Me ayudarás? Will you help me?

Spanish version:

Los gastos totales del proyecto son 14,500 CAD (dólares canadienses), alrededor de 10,000 €.

Pagaré los primeros 10,000 CAD pero necesito vuestra ayuda para lograr el objetivo de recaudar los 4,500 CAD que me faltan, unos 3,000 €.

 

English version:
The project total expenses are 14,500 CAD (Canadian Dollars), around 10,000 €.

I will pay the first 10,000 CAD but I need your help to achieve the goal of 14.500 CAD.

 

Risks and challenges

It's a remote possibility that production of the illustrations will take longer than we anticipate, but we're confident that we will be able to ship the Indigogo copies on April 1, 2020, barring unforeseen circumstances including but not limited to those listed above.
story_txt:
¿De qué va el proyecto? What is the project About?Spanish version:Me llevó casi 10 años alcanzar el sueño de publicar Luces en el Mar. Fue un trabajo duro, a veces pensé que era un sueño imposible que solo unos pocos podían lograr. Pero nunca dejé de creer en esta historia y en 2018 finalmente se publicó la edición en español de Luces en el Mar. Desde entonces, la novela ha sido traducida a 5 idiomas y ahora está disponible en formato digital, papel y audio en todo el mundo.Luces en el Mar ha obtenido excelentes críticas y no podría estar más agradecido por la cálida respuesta de lectores de todo el mundo. Uno de estos lectores resultó ser un agente de Hollywood. Ahora este agente me está representando para ayudar a alcanzar el sueño más ambicioso de todos: llevar Luces en el Mar a la gran pantalla.Convencer a los ejecutivos de los estudios no será tarea fácil. Para ello tendé que presentarles un documento en que cuente la historia de Luces en el Mar de la forma más cinemátográfica y visual posible. Por esta razón, he empezado a desarrollar una serie de imágenes inspiradas en la historia y realizadas por un brillante artista conceptual que trabaja para Netflix. Con las ilustraciones montaré entonces el documento que presentaré a los ejecutivos de Hollywood y monataré un vídeo.  Sin presión, ¿verdad?English version:It took me almost 10 years to achieve the dream of publishing Lights on the Sea. It was hard work, sometimes I thought it was an impossible dream that only a few could achieve. But I never stopped believing in this story and in 2018 the Spanish edition of Lights on the Sea was finally published. Since then, the novel has been translated into 5 different languages and its now available in digital, print and audio formats all over the world.Lights on the Sea has obtained great reviews from media, celebrity authors and most important from you, reader. I can't be more grateful for the warm response that readers around the world have shared with me after reading Lights on the Sea. One of these readers happened to be a movie agent working in Hollywood. He is now representing me to help achieve the most ambitious of my dreams: bringing Lights on the Sea into the silver screen.And the first step to accomplish this dream is to sell the idea to a Hollywood studio and to convince their executives I need to tell the story of Lights on the Sea in the most cinematic and visual way possible. That's the reason I decided to contact an excellent Concept Artist that is now helping me to develop the visuals for the movie pitch that I'm preparing to present in the upcoming months in front of Hollywood executives. No pressure at all, right?

story:
Who is Kilowatt?

If you've been to Kilowatt's brewery and tasting room in Kearny Mesa, you already know our creativity extends well beyond our tap list. 

At Kilowatt Brewing, we handcraft our beer in small three-barrel batches. Our passion for experimenting with unconventional ingredients and flavor profiles gives our customers the chance to sip on brews such as our Chocolate Macadamia Nut Stout, Passion Fruit Green Tea Ale, and our Hoptastic Voyage single hop IPA series, just to name a few. No matter how many times you go to our nanobrewery, each visit will feel different thanks to an ever-changing selection of 18–20 brews on tap, rotating galleries of local artwork, custom LED lights that regularly change the color and mood of the taproom, and food-pairing events with local chefs and food trucks.

Our Vision for Kilowatt Ocean Beach

We are super excited to be opening our second tasting room in Ocean Beach.  Ocean Beach was selected not only because two of our owners are OBecians, but also because the creativity and atmosphere of our brewery is a natural fit with the infamous Ocean Beach vibe.  

Our vision for this second location is to uniquely incorporate the creative energy of the Ocean Beach community into a one of a kind tasting room.  Collaborations with local artists already in design include a black light art installation, life size interactive Light Brite display, ocean beach art murals, and custom programmed LED lighting that will allow staff and customers to change the lighting color and mood in real-time.  We want Kilowatt Ocean Beach to be a creative space for the community to collaborate and gather (kid and dog friendly) and an iconic destination that will help contribute to the already thriving Ocean Beach economy.

How Can You Help?

We are a completely self-funded nano brewery and of course, all of this uniqueness comes with a price. But this is where you can help.  

We've put together a collection of awesome perks for your support, including:

  • Sweet Swag Options
  •  Get your Name on the Kilowatt OB Mural
  • 20 oz. Pours for the Price of 16 oz. FOREVER
  • 20% Off Growler Fills FOREVER, Brew Your Own Recipe
  • Tickets to the OB Soft Opening
  • Name Your Own Production Beer
  • Brew It With Us Sessions
  • Create It With Us Sessions

We have set up a flexible campaign, so every contribution will help us make Kilowatt Ocean Beach that much more special.

Risks & Challenges

We don't anticipate any challenges except for the typical hurdles involved in opening a second location.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you can't contribute, or want to do even more to help and we can certainly use as much help as you can give! Here are other things you can do to give us a hand:

  • Tell other beer and art lovers about this campaign.
  • Share this campaign opportunity on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram, and every other social median you have your disposal. Indiegogo has all the sharing tools one could dream of to make this easy.
  • If you have any blogging friends, or know any journalists or news personalities, please let them know about this, and ask them to reach out to beer@kilowatt.beer for more information or if they'd like to talk to one of us. 

We can't wait to open in Ocean Beach.

Thank you!

Team Kilowatt

story:
Overview

Per os is a research-based art project about the pharmaceutical companies' role in our society, psychiatry and healthcare. Using surveys I have conducted over the past three years and a large amount of anger at how wrong and corrupt the system is, I would like to interpret  this research artistically in order to develop material for an exhibition. The aim of this exhibition is to highlight the research content of the project and to raise awareness. In the exhibition there will be direct references to existing research, studies and articles as well as my own activist surveys over the past three years that you can read more about below.

I am currently in the process of fleshing out the project's contextual framework through studies at Uppsala University and I have just finished studies at Malmö University that are now supporting the project in terms of business development. In addition, the project has several researchers, psychiatrists and experts that aid the project with their expert knowledge in their fields.

 

 

 

How You Can Help & What I Can Offer 

To allow me to produce content for this exhibition, I am aiming to raise €6200 in funding. This amount would only go towards the material costs of creating the content (please see specification below). However much I raise during this crowdfunding campaign, I will do what I can with the funds raised and continue working on the project until I have enough content for an exhibition, hence the flexible funding target. So, every little helps and everything will go towards the exhibition.

If you, like I do, think this is important, I would be grateful if you could support this project either by spreading the word about this project, purchasing the merch or by making a donation.

You will receive the merchandise you purchase (see below) as well as updates on my project. You can also give yourself a pat on the back for helping me create art work that raises awareness about an important topic that people need to know about. 

 

The exhibition will include:
-3 large-scale objects................€3500
-1 light display.............................€1500
-Graphics/posters.....................€1000
-Indiegogo fees............................€200
Total:........................................€6200

 

 

'Lilly', Duloxetine/Cymbalta, acrylic plastic, enamel laquer, Ongoing since 2017  © Markus Sjöborg

 


About the Per os Project

For the past 3 years, as part of my artistic practice, I have been researching the connection between pharmaceutical companies and our society, healthcare and psychiatry, predominantly in the US, the UK and Sweden. As some of us already know, this is a big – and sometimes dirty – business that capitalizes on people's illnesses, where paramount importance is often given to making money rather than to patients’ health or actual recovery. 

When I read and studied existing research and carried out my own activist surveys, what I found out made me furious! For the past 3 years, I myself have been able to be prescribed antidepressants over the phone without even speaking to a doctor. I have not taken these but instead I use them in the object above, an ongoing process much like saving coins.

The majority of the information I found out during this work had me asking, "do people know about this?!" It also got me thinking “if they don’t know about it, they really need to know!”. People need to hear and see what is rarely talked about or made public. This is why all works in the exhibition will make direct reference to research articles, allowing the visitor to do their own investigations. I urge you not to believe what I say but to do your own research. 

The research has been conducted based on:
-Available research such as scientific articles, lectures and news articles
-Correspondence with numerous researchers and experts in predominantly Sweden, the US and the UK that aid the project with their expert knowledge in their fields. 
-Activist surveys
-Interviews

My aim is to make the art work and its research references as public as possible using different kinds of channels, methods and interventions. 

Much of the actual art work is being created at Konstnärernas Kollektivverkstad Monumental, a collective workshop/studio in Malmö (as seen in the trailer above). 

"Big Pharma" is impacting on us and our peers on a daily basis – whether we are aware of it or not – and as people we are the ones that can and will be able to change this injustice. Help me show people what is happening and give them choice in their lives again by highlighting this important topic and that a change of course is required.

For more information and references regarding the research articles please see the bottom of this page. I urge you to do your own surveys and research.

 

 




The Merch

To donate to this project, you can buy merchandise that has all been designed by me specifically for the project. The pill brooches (see photo below) are all individually handmade by me in lacquered ceramics and are available in a limited edition of four sets of 50 each. As they are handmade small variations in appearance may occur.

Iintend to ship the merch as quickly as possible. The pill brooches are already made and therefore can be sent fairly quickly. For merch purchases below €170 I will use standard shipping. For merch costing €170 and above I will use a trackable service.  

(You can change the currency at the bottom of this page)

 

 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you like me, think this is an important message and the public needs to know about it, I'd be very happy and grateful if you could spread the word about the project e.g. by using the Indiegogo tools on this site. You can also contribute by making a donation at the top of the page by clicking "Back it".



 


 

The Impact

Your contribution will make a difference! You will help me raise awareness through the artwork I will produce and exhibit.

In the past I have successfully used crowdfunding through Kickstarter to fund the 'KAMI' art project that I worked on for 4 years. This was presented at the largest photo festival in Scandinavia – Landskrona Foto – in 2018 and is now on permanent display exhibited at one of the most important art museums in Sweden, Ystad Konstmuseum. 


 



“It is simply no longer possible to believe much of the clinical research that is published, or to rely on the judgment of trusted physicians or authoritative medical guidelines. I take no pleasure in this conclusion, which I reached slowly and reluctantly over my two decades as an editor.

Marcia Angell (M.D), Harvard, New England Journal of Medicine


 

About 

Markus Sjöborg runs a multidisciplinary art practice based in Malmö, Sweden. His practice focuses on self-initiated work as well as commissioned work. Recurring themes in the self-initiated work revolve around topics such as social issues, health, copyright issues and others. Media given precedence are graphics, artist’s books and objects in various materials which  become vehicles through which Markus approaches, researches and expresses these recurring themes in addition to using non-verbal and intuitive approaches as well. You can find some of the work on Instagram. 

 


 

The survey

Overview of the topics

Below is a selection of the topics I've been looking into during my surveys - with an emphasis on the US, Sweden and the UK. Details of the actual scientific sources are shown further down on this page.

-The monoamine hypothesis - the hypothesis that depression is linked to a so called "chemical imbalance" and lack of serotonin (Schildkraut, 1965) -  and how this hypothesis was marketed and disseminated in the 1980s by PR campaigns and Pharmaceutical companies such as Lilly (then Eli Lilly) promoting their psychiatric drug, Prozac.

-The evaluation and testing of psychiatric drugs by national agencies and how these agencies are funded and operated (FDA in USA and its equivalent in Sweden; Läkemedelsverket).

-Pharmaceutical companies' lobbying power and the politics of their link to our society/governments/authorities as well as healthcare and psychiatry in the USA, the UK and Sweden.

- The discontinuation/withdrawal of psychiatric drugs – specifically anti-depressants – and what information and help is provided or not provided by pharmaceutical companies, healthcare and psychiatry about this and the disconnect with the patient/peer perspective, what is and what is not recognized.

-Statistics on and the increase in diagnoses such as ADHD and depression and the related increase in the prescription of psychiatric drugs.

-Research/statistics on the side effects of psychiatric drugs such as (but not limited to): and the link between their use and suicide as well as out-of-character violence such as homicide.

 

“The truth is that the chemical imbalance story of mental illness was always a kind of a urban myth. It was never a theory seriously propounded by well-informed psychiatrists.

Ronald W. Pies (MD), American Psychiatric Association, Psychiatric Times 2019​



Stickers, merch




Details of the research articles

Below you can find some of the research that Per os is based on in addition to activist surveys. Most of these articles you can find on research databases such as Pubmed.


Scientific articles

-Selective Publication of Antidepressant Trials and Its Influence on Apparent Efficacy, Erick H. Turner, M.D., Annette M. Matthews, M.D., Eftihia Linardatos, B.S., Robert A. Tell, L.C.S.W., and Robert Rosenthal, Ph.D. New England Journal of Medicine
https://www.nejm.org/doi/full/10.1056/NEJMsa065779
-Industry-sponsored clinical research: a broken system. M. Angell (MD), Harvard
https://jamanetwork.com/journals/jama/article-abstract/182478
-Prescription Drugs Associated with Reports of Violence Towards Others
Thomas J. Moore1, Joseph Glenmullen, Curt D. Furberg, Institute for Safe Medication Practices, Alexandria, Virginia, United States of America, Department of Psychiatry-Cambridge Hospital, Harvard Medical School
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3002271/
-Selective Serotonin Reuptake Inhibitors and Violent Crime: A Cohort Study.
Molero, Lichtenstein, Zetterqvist, Gumpert, Fazel, Center for Psychiatry Research, Department of Clinical Neuroscience, Karolinska Institutet, Stockholm, Sweden. Department of Psychiatry, Warneford Hospital, University of Oxford, Oxford, United Kingdom.
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/26372359
-Pharmaceuticals, Political Money, and Public Policy: A Theoretical and Empirical Agenda, Paul D Jorgensen, The Journal of Law Medicine & Ethics
-Why Most Published Research Findings Are False, John P. A. Ioannidis, Stanford University School of Medicine
-Antidepressants and suicide risk, National Health Service, UK
https://www.nhs.uk/news/mental-health/antidepre...
-Against the stream: Antidepressants are not antidepressants – an alternative approach to drug action and implications for the use of antidepressants, Joanna Moncrieff, University College London, and an honorary Consultant Psychiatrist at North East London Foundation Trust
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC60...
-A systematic review into the incidence, severity and duration of  antidepressant withdrawal effects: Are guidelines evidence based? James Davies, John Read, University of Roehampton, University of East London, 
http://prescribeddrug.org/wp-content/uploads/20...
-Is Exercise a Viable Treatment for Depression?
James A. Blumenthal, Ph.D., Patrick J. Smith, Ph.D., and Benson M. Hoffman, Ph.D., Duke University Medical Center Department of Psychiatry and Behavioral Sciences
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC36...
-Initial severity and antidepressant benefits: a meta-analysis of data submitted to the Food and Drug Administration , Kirsch I1, Deacon BJ, Huedo-Medina TB, Scoboria A, Moore TJ, Johnson BT. Department of Psychology, University of Hull, Hull, United Kingdom
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/18303940
-Prescription Drugs Associated with Reports of Violence Towards Others
Thomas J. Moore , Joseph Glenmullen, Curt D. Furberg, Institute for Safe Medication Practices, Alexandria, Virginia, United States of America
https://journals.plos.org/plosone/article/autho...
-On the brain disease model of mental disorders.
Deacon, B. J., & Lickel, J. J. (2009). On the brain disease model of mental disorders. the Behavior Therapist
https://psycnet.apa.org/record/2009-18088-001
-Brain Zaps: An Underappreciated Symptom of Antidepressant Discontinuation.
Papp A, Onton JA, Department of Psychiatry, University of California, San Diego, 9500 Gilman Dr, La Jolla, CA 92093
-The Inverse Benefit Law: How Drug Marketing Undermines Patient Safety and Public Health, Howard Brody, MD, PhD corresponding author & Donald W. Light, PhD, US National Library of Medicine National Institutes of Health
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC30...
-Schildkraut JJ (1965) The catecholamine hypothesis of affective disorders: A review of supporting evidence. Am J Psychiatry 122: 509–522
-Jeffrey L Lacasse ”Serotonin and Depression: A Disconnect between the Advertisements and the Scientific Literature”
-David Healy. ”The structure of psychopharmacological revolutions” 
-Moncrieff, J. & Cohen, D. (2005). Rethinking models of psychotropic drug action. Psychotherapy and psychosomatics, 74(3), 145–153.

Peter Breggin (MD), Talking Back To Prozac

 



 

 

Risks & Challenges

Art, movies, documentaries etc. are platforms that can and does have a powerful impact on society. My work on this topic is fuelled by powerful emotions at the many ways this is a corrupt and dysfunctional system. I'm prepared to face the resistance and challenges such a powerful project can evoke. 

There seems to be a huge resistance and fear to bringing this to light. Oftentimes I hear things like "conspiracy theory". I've been asked by psychiatrists if I'm a member of the Scientology Church when I've addressed and talked about my project during the past year. I'm not. I would be more sceptical of the Pharmaceutical companies and psychiatrists than of those criticizing them.
story_txt:
Overview
Per os is a research-based art project about the pharmaceutical companies' role in our society, psychiatry and healthcare. Using surveys I have conducted over the past three years and a large amount of anger at how wrong and corrupt the system is, I would like to interpret  this research artistically in order to develop material for an exhibition. The aim of this exhibition is to highlight the research content of the project and to raise awareness. In the exhibition there will be direct references to existing research, studies and articles as well as my own activist surveys over the past three years that you can read more about below.
I am currently in the process of fleshing out the project's contextual framework through studies at Uppsala University and I have just finished studies at Malmö University that are now supporting the project in terms of business development. In addition, the project has several researchers, psychiatrists and experts that aid the project with their expert knowledge in their fields.
 

 
 
How You Can Help & What I Can Offer 

To allow me to produce content for this exhibition, I am aiming to raise €6200 in funding. This amount would only go towards the material costs of creating the content (please see specification below). However much I raise during this crowdfunding campaign, I will do what I can with the funds raised and continue working on the project until I have enough content for an exhibition, hence the flexible funding target. So, every little helps and everything will go towards the exhibition.
If you, like I do, think this is important, I would be grateful if you could support this project either by spreading the word about this project, purchasing the merch or by making a donation.
You will receive the merchandise you purchase (see below) as well as updates on my project. You can also give yourself a pat on the back for helping me create art work that raises awareness about an important topic that people need to know about. 
 
The exhibition will include:-3 large-scale objects................€3500-1 light display.............................€1500-Graphics/posters.....................€1000-Indiegogo fees............................€200Total:........................................€6200
 
 


'Lilly', Duloxetine/Cymbalta, acrylic plastic, enamel laquer, Ongoing since 2017  © Markus Sjöborg
 

About the Per os Project

For the past 3 years, as part of my artistic practice, I have been researching the connection between pharmaceutical companies and our society, healthcare and psychiatry, predominantly in the US, the UK and Sweden. As some of us already know, this is a big – and sometimes dirty – business that capitalizes on people's illnesses, where paramount importance is often given to making money rather than to patients’ health or actual recovery. When I read and studied existing research and carried out my own activist surveys, what I found out made me furious! For the past 3 years, I myself have been able to be prescribed antidepressants over the phone without even speaking to a doctor. I have not taken these but instead I use them in the object above, an ongoing process much like saving coins.The majority of the information I found out during this work had me asking, "do people know about this?!" It also got me thinking “if they don’t know about it, they really need to know!”. People need to hear and see what is rarely talked about or made public. This is why all works in the exhibition will make direct reference to research articles, allowing the visitor to do their own investigations. I urge you not to believe what I say but to do your own research. The research has been conducted based on:-Available research such as scientific articles, lectures and news articles-Correspondence with numerous researchers and experts in predominantly Sweden, the US and the UK that aid the project with their expert knowledge in their fields. -Activist surveys-InterviewsMy aim is to make the art work and its research references as public as possible using different kinds of channels, methods and interventions. Much of the actual art work is being created at Konstnärernas Kollektivverkstad Monumental, a collective workshop/studio in Malmö (as seen in the trailer above). 
"Big Pharma" is impacting on us and our peers on a daily basis – whether we are aware of it or not – and as people we are the ones that can and will be able to change this injustice. Help me show people what is happening and give them choice in their lives again by highlighting this important topic and that a change of course is required.For more information and references regarding the research articles please see the bottom of this page. I urge you to do your own surveys and research.
 
 

The Merch

To donate to this project, you can buy merchandise that has all been designed by me specifically for the project. The pill brooches (see photo below) are all individually handmade by me in lacquered ceramics and are available in a limited edition of four sets of 50 each. As they are handmade small variations in appearance may occur.Iintend to ship the merch as quickly as possible. The pill brooches are already made and therefore can be sent fairly quickly. For merch purchases below €170 I will use standard shipping. For merch costing €170 and above I will use a trackable service.  (You can change the currency at the bottom of this page)
 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like me, think this is an important message and the public needs to know about it, I'd be very happy and grateful if you could spread the word about the project e.g. by using the Indiegogo tools on this site. You can also contribute by making a donation at the top of the page by clicking "Back it".
 
 

The Impact
Your contribution will make a difference! You will help me raise awareness through the artwork I will produce and exhibit.
In the past I have successfully used crowdfunding through Kickstarter to fund the 'KAMI' art project that I worked on for 4 years. This was presented at the largest photo festival in Scandinavia – Landskrona Foto – in 2018 and is now on permanent display exhibited at one of the most important art museums in Sweden, Ystad Konstmuseum. 
 


“It is simply no longer possible to believe much of the clinical research that is published, or to rely on the judgment of trusted physicians or authoritative medical guidelines. I take no pleasure in this conclusion, which I reached slowly and reluctantly over my two decades as an editor.

Marcia Angell (M.D), Harvard, New England Journal of Medicine
 
About 
Markus Sjöborg runs a multidisciplinary art practice based in Malmö, Sweden. His practice focuses on self-initiated work as well as commissioned work. Recurring themes in the self-initiated work revolve around topics such as social issues, health, copyright issues and others. Media given precedence are graphics, artist’s books and objects in various materials which  become vehicles through which Markus approaches, researches and expresses these recurring themes in addition to using non-verbal and intuitive approaches as well. You can find some of the work on Instagram. 
 

 
The survey
Overview of the topics
Below is a selection of the topics I've been looking into during my surveys - with an emphasis on the US, Sweden and the UK. Details of the actual scientific sources are shown further down on this page.
-The monoamine hypothesis - the hypothesis that depression is linked to a so called "chemical imbalance" and lack of serotonin (Schildkraut, 1965) -  and how this hypothesis was marketed and disseminated in the 1980s by PR campaigns and Pharmaceutical companies such as Lilly (then Eli Lilly) promoting their psychiatric drug, Prozac.
-The evaluation and testing of psychiatric drugs by national agencies and how these agencies are funded and operated (FDA in USA and its equivalent in Sweden; Läkemedelsverket).
-Pharmaceutical companies' lobbying power and the politics of their link to our society/governments/authorities as well as healthcare and psychiatry in the USA, the UK and Sweden.
- The discontinuation/withdrawal of psychiatric drugs – specifically anti-depressants – and what information and help is provided or not provided by pharmaceutical companies, healthcare and psychiatry about this and the disconnect with the patient/peer perspective, what is and what is not recognized.
-Statistics on and the increase in diagnoses such as ADHD and depression and the related increase in the prescription of psychiatric drugs.
-Research/statistics on the side effects of psychiatric drugs such as (but not limited to): and the link between their use and suicide as well as out-of-character violence such as homicide.
 
“The truth is that the chemical imbalance story of mental illness was always a kind of a urban myth. It was never a theory seriously propounded by well-informed psychiatrists.
Ronald W. Pies (MD), American Psychiatric Association, Psychiatric Times 2019​Stickers, merch

Details of the research articles
Below you can find some of the research that Per os is based on in addition to activist surveys. Most of these articles you can find on research databases such as Pubmed.

story:
I've been sketching a bunch of anime toons for over 8 years and finally decided to ship out laminated versions of my work to interested parties. If you really like anime as a genre, I trust you'd love the illustrations i'll send when you choose a reward funding.

    IN STOCK FOR ANIME LOVERS​

    Ranging from Naruto shippuden to Fairy tale, you get to receive a customized drawing of totally any character on demand based on type tiers paid for. Promises of high quality images done in little under 2 days

    WHERE DOES YOUR MONEY GO  

    Start off a new brand with fast worldwide shipping of my work. Necessary tools and materials for completion of characters and lamination works. Part of funds solicited from here will also go into production of an upcoming comic book.

story:
Short Summary

Moore Vision Entertainment is a new leading full service entertainment company and producer of live entertainment based in Houston, Texas.

From concept through activation we focus on delivering professional and high quality entertainment experiences. Whether it be live Broadway style productions, dance, live music, concert events, galas, weddings, birthday parties, fundraising events, drag shows, dinner theatre, or any special event; our extensive network of both talent and entertainment resources allows us to deliver a complete solution for theatrical shows, interactive exhibits and experiential events that are highly engaging entertainment experiences for fans of all ages.

Our overall mission is to offer high quality event/theatrical productions; community outreach and educational programs; and to support local artists and enhance the lives of the members of our community through the arts.

What We Need

We will relaunch in the Fall of 2020 and need your help!  As creative artists, we have a passion to bring you only the best theatrical productions and events. But we understand that this is also a business that must raise money in order to produce the art. We would like to relaunch MVE and kick off our 2020 Fall Season on the right foot and need to raise the remaider of $1500 to cover our fall season startup fees for our first two events (royalties/deposits/venues) .Your donation will help fund the necessary cost to do so & provide us a great financial position going into the 2020-2021 seas on

Please consider donating what your heart is compelled too.  We will always be eternally grateful for those who have supported and continue to support.  Our sound promise is to use your gift towards the building of amazing products and experiences for our community.

We invite you to visit our website at www.moorevisionentertainment. com.  As we secure funds and rights/royalties for our fall shows we will update.  

Thank You, 
Roe Moore & The Creative Artist of Moore Vision Entertainment

story:
Hello my fine friends! I'm Izzy, creatrix of the Heroine's Journey Oracle! I'm so excited to share this deck with you, and so grateful for your help to bring her into the world. 

Oracles thread through what I think of as my feral fairy girlhood growing up in Guerneville California; from dreaming in the crevice of a redwood, listening to the current of the Russian River, reading patterns in snail trails, and playing with my imaginary friend Foxy in the clover.

The Heroine’s Journey cards both draw from and take me to these kinds of secret places, into hidden terrain. The cards are from a deep well inside, a well found in the quiet fall forest, in the misty in between time.

For me, they're a natural, mystical way through the dark sparkling waters of the forgotten and the unhealed in the quest for wholeness. 

Join me on the journey!

 

The Heroine’s Journey Oracle is a 45 card deck, created to guide you on your journey. The cards serve as a mirror, companion and guide for healing and self-discovery. 

This deck can be used with only the guidebook. Excerpts from my fable "Kamaal's Journey" these cards originate from accompany each interpretation in the guidebook, and the cards channel recognizable archetypal imagery drawn from the collective unconscious. 

They are stunningly beautiful, with original art by my dear friends Tayah Blanck, David Tenorio, and Nahkoura Mahnassi that just blow my mind. Both the deck and the book are beautifully designed. The cards are perfection, illustrated with meticulous attention to my story and design for them.  I’m so over the moon happy with each of them!

The Heroine’s Journey cards provide deeper understanding and analysis of ourselves and the universe around us. Through divination, we engage the forces of synchronicity, sacred wisdom, ritual, and symbol to understand the universal and personal archetypes reflecting our place on our path, and what we're living at the time of drawing the cards.

The Heroine's/my/our story has shown me how to help myself and others on this path.

 

This project was created from my heart, from my tenderness to describe the dark path of abuse, loss, addiction, assault, and mental illness, and to guide me in my own Journey, for the integration of the unhealed, hidden parts of myself.

Kamaal’s story is woven from dreams, real-life experiences, fantasies and visualizations. I have found her Journey within myself, my friends, and the amazing folx I’ve been blessed to work in my psychotherapy practice. It is with immense gratitude that I offer you the culmination of this tapestry in the form of this Oracle deck, in the hopes that it serves others.

The material in the Heroine’s Journey describes the path we traverse to find restoration or what is at its root unbroken. Traveling through the darkness, with awareness, we find clarity and compassion that helps us to integrate shadow parts of ourselves that need to be freed, or loved, or heard in order that we may transform.

My deepest wishes are twofold:

That this project will help folx feel accompanied as they walk their road. I want the Heroine’s Journey cards to help users find the psychic power and health they seek. I want them to increase choicefulness and to help self-compassion become integrated, reflexive, and instinctual.

Eventually, I'd like to use the cards to lead retreats, and to workshop in psychotherapeutic group settings, using the cards, guidebook and full story to work with unconscious material and find ourselves in the Heroine’s Journey.
 

My campaign goal is to make available the high quality decks in custom tuckboxes, with beautifully constructed guidebooks.

If you need any help with using this platform, I'm here for you so please just let me know. I believe I can do it for you from the back end--I know it's complicated and confusing to many--It is to me too!! 

 

Risks & Challenges

This campaign involves making the Oracle cards, Guidebook, and perhaps eventually a therapeutic journal and publishing the fully edited and formatted finished novel. 

The largest challenge is making this deck available to whoever might need it. 

As of this launch, the Kickstarter campaign was met 569% over its funding goal. I will continue to update and answer questions as you need!

In setting the shipping date for September 2021 at the time of this writing, a broad window helps to accommodate any shipping and production delays, especially during prolonged shipping times due to the Covid-19 virus. In the event of any unexpected delays, which are somewhat hard to predict during these shifting times, I’ll be entirely transparent in sharing about this in the campaign.
