story:
Si prefieres leer esto en español da da clic en este link: http://jpenggoon.blogspot.mx/2015/06/letters-to...

"Send a letter is an excellent way to move elsewhere without moving anything except the heart." - Petronio

"What you wanna do?"

 I'm Juan Pablo Eng Goon, I'm from Guadalajara, Jalisco, México, I'm 18 years old and I want to change the world. I know it sounds a little bit crazy, but let me explain you. Last year I finished High School, and the actual society says that you need to choose some career, so I was there, choosing something that I didn't want to choose, so I did paperwork to the international business career, but at the end I didn't do the exam, cause I realize that it wasn't my passion. I don't think do something that I don't want to do, so I thought: What would make me happy? So I imagined me, traveling; meeting new places, new culture, maybe new language, but the most important: new people. Everybody has a story to tell, so with letters and photographs I want to be a storyteller. 

So this is the plan: take an airplane to cross the atlantic ocean, doesn't matter to much the destiny, the most important is the people that you are about to meet. So start living, don't have a plan cause I think that the best things in life are the ones that we don't plan. At the end of the day write a letter about that day and send it to unknown people. 

But why handwritten letters? 

Probably you think that is unnecessary, cause we live in a technology era, where we can send a message instantly with all the social networks that actually exist, but I believe in the magic of handwritten letters cause when you write them, you put a part of your soul on it. There is something beautiful in the imperfection of your letter, in the time where you have to wait, because in that time you learn to appreciate. We live in a world where everything is so fast, but sometimes you need to slow down, and contemplate, learn to value. 

So I don't only want to write letters for traveling, I really want to go back to the good old times, I want to go back to that old beautiful way of communication.

"So why you need my money?"

I made a budget of $3500. 

  • Airplane ticket to somewhere in Europe: $2000 (round trip) I'm going to take the flight in the U.S, cause is cheaper.
  • Photography supplies: $1000 (film, paper, chemicals)
  • Basic needs: $500 (somewhere to stay, food, that's all. So I want to stay between two and three months, so it's like seven dollars per day.)
Maybe you think that is too little. Seven dollars is not too much, but the idea is to keep as austere as possible.

I thought in really good awards:

  • Handcrafted true black & white prints made by me with an enlarger and chemicals in a darkroom.
  • Handwritten letters that are going to be unique pieces cause it will be only one per day. You can choose between spanish or english and it will be sent in the city where was written. 
  • Also instant photographs made with a fuji instax mini, that will be sent in the same envelope with the letter.
  • At the end it will be a thank video for all the people who supported.

"So yeah you are going to travel, so funny, and what else?"

So with this project I just don't only want to raise the money to travel, that is not my purpose. My goal is to promote the beautiful art of handwritten letters. So when you collaborate you make a compromise of sending a letter to a person; maybe an old friend, your mom, your dad, your son, whoever. 

How long ago you don't send a letter? 

Or maybe you are of my generation that didn't experience that. If so, I can tell that is something beautiful, is something that you have to live.

Also with film photography

Is pure magic. If you like photography you really need to live that experience, shoot with film is a rewarding, you have to wait, is everything slow; you learn to admire.  

You can be part of this big change, to go back and bring that beautiful costume. More funds, more film, more photographs, more letters, more stories to tell.

"It's is too risky, you shouldn't do it"

Maybe you think that is something crazy, because I don't have a plan, because I don't know what I'm gonna do, what is gonna happen, and that, that is a reason to do it. I am aware of the danger, but it would be more dangerous don't do it, cause we only live once, and if I have the chance to do it, why don't do it?

"I only have one dollar, how else I can help in your dream?"

So one dollar is good enough. I believe that is not only the money, is everything that you do to help. If you know someone who may be interested tell him, you can be part of this big dream.

Thank you!

story:
What is NekoCreations:

My alias is Feeby Neko and NC is everything I do. I like to draw things that make people smile and bring a little light to the darkness that can build up in our daily lives. Drawing, illustration, design- I do it all and want to do more.

Our primary goal:

Being able to buy professionally printed laser cut acrylic charms is going to be a huge step for us. It will allow us to make necklaces, keychains, cell phone charms and a plethora of other cool inexpensive items.

When will you receive your perks:

About a month after funding ends. Some items (like prints and tees) ship separately and custom art may take a few days to make. Add an additional week or two for international sponsors if you live outside the US.

What the money will be used for:

In a nutshell, three main things; covering the cost of our charms, officially registering our business with the state of Michigan (forming our LLC) and pursuing higher quality products for our store.

What exactly the money will be used for:

Professional acrylic charms- $70, registering our business- $50-$100, purchasing our own shirts to sell locally (instead of dropshipping)- $100, more ram for our computers to handle large design files- $100, finally paying John- priceless.

Anything left will keep one more artist from starving... or her cats from eating her body...

story:
Our Background

Drama Experience Studio is founded by 3 girls who deeply love the art of Drama. Our team members are from different background, an  optimistic academic director, an outgoing dramatic literature teacher and  a  beautiful young designer.

What Are We Doing?

Drama Experience Studio is working on to develop new-way drama experience courses so that everyone can enjoy and learn form it. Curriculums consist of the classical scene shows, improvisational performance(ad-libbing),  firsthand experience and so on. It will provide  many opportunities for participants to gain and amazing drama performing experience directly, to release the pressure  coming from work and life, even to make friends through our platform.

What We Need?

We need $2816. The found  will be used as follows:
Firstly, we need  invite a qualified university professors as our consultant, helping us design and developing many significant experience courses. In addition, we are going to employ some lecturers to give speeches about the professional knowledge of drama. Thirdly, we also want to rent an activity studio, purchase  some reference books and improve  our courses. Last but not least, students who cannot afford to our classes are eligible to take part in all activities free.

The Impact

The development of drama experience course program will open another door for traditional drama. Nowadays, with the development of movies, the influence of drama becomes more and more weak. Therefore, how to let people learn and pay more attention to the drama is an urge question which keeps bothering us. At last, our team members reach an agreement and we decide develop drama experience studio aiming to  let participants involve in drama physically and emotionally, experience the pleasure during  the course of performing drama, learn theatrical knowledge and combine the experiential learning methods with the skills of drama, only in this way, can we develop dramas happily.

For Your Contribution

We want to thanks the people that support us with following perks:

Why We Need Your Support?

We used our own funds to develop the experiential drama learning course and held a dramatic event once. According to feedback from participants, our course and event indeed give each one a wonderful experiencing and totally different viewpoint for the art of drama. However, without funding and space, it is difficult for us to keep going on this meaningful program. Therefore, we are looking forward for your considerate support and help!

story:
My name is Chantal King. I am a local artist of the Mississippi Gulf Coast. I moved to Mississippi when I was five and have ...been a resident of the MS Gulf Coast ever since. "This is home."

Ever since I was little girl, I always had an interest for art, music, animals, and marine life. My first interest was Marine Biology until I took my first art studio class at MGCCC from then on I knew I wanted a career being an artist. I graduated with cum laude from WCU earning a B.F.A. in Ceramics.

I received fist place and best in show at the Senior Art Exhibition in 2008.

Artist Statement:
I have always been a passionate expressive person. My love for music and marine biology are most often my subject matter for my paintings. As for my pottery, I enjoy the fulfillment and connection I get from working with clay. The ocean is full of life that is mysterious, wondrous, and exciting to me. I am very expressive with texture and find it very pleasing to the eye to embody such textures, shapes, and colors found in marine animals and plants. I believe that it is these three things that give my work a sense of movement and life of its own.

May My Southern Art Bring You Warmth in Every Season!

Please help me raise money for much needed pottery equipment. My goal is to have a studio of my own, so I don't have to take it somewhere for making and firing pottery. The money will help me to purchase: a pottery wheel, kiln, slab roller, and possible materials like: bats, kiln shelves, stilts, glazes, and clay. Owning my own studio will help me to bring costs down and help me to produce pottery in a timely manner that is acceptable as a business, and the possibility of having pottery classes!

Artist Statement:  I have always been a passionate expressive person. My love for music and marine biology are most often my subject matter for my paintings. As for my pottery, I enjoy the fulfillment and connection I get from working with clay. The ocean is full of life that is mysterious, wondrous, and exciting to me. I am very expressive with texture and find it very pleasing to the eye to embody such textures, shapes, and colors found in marine animals and plants. I believe that it is these three things that give my work a sense of movement and life of its own.  May My Southern Art Bring You Warmth in Every Season! 
Please help me raise money for much needed pottery equipment. My goal is to have a studio of my own, so I don't have to take it somewhere for making and firing pottery. The money will help me to purchase: a pottery wheel, kiln, slab roller, and possible materials like: bats, kiln shelves, stilts, glazes, and clay. Owning my own studio will help me to bring costs down and help me to produce pottery in a timely manner that is acceptable as a business, and the possibility of having pottery classes!

story:
Piyêsiwak Ôyôhtâwît (Nic Keeper) is a citizen of Turtle Island. 
He is also a painter, filmmaker, and broadcaster, with multiple projects in development. 
Most of all, he is committed to making work that highlights and UPLIFTS all NDNs, as well as working in solidarity with other people of color so that we can all get FREE.
**
AND HE NEEDS OUR HELP.
**
He and his family will lose their housing within DAYS.
Let's show Piyêsiwak how grateful we are for all the ways that he blesses us with his existence and resistance. 
In exchange for some contributions, you can receive a one-of-a-kind artwork, created by Piyêsiwak himself! 
(See 'Select A Perk' on the right.)

ANY AND ALL CONTRIBUTIONS ARE APPRECIATED!

story:
My Story

           Hi I'm Jenna Anderson and thank you so much for your interest in my project.  I've been dreaming of making this idea a reality for a while now and I'm so excited to finally jump in! For nine years I've been focusing on commissions and teaching to support myself, family and business while working at becoming a better painter. I feel blessed to be able to be an artist and I've just learned so much over the years through working on commissions and teaching- that it's been the most enjoyable time of my life.  With that being said, I also feel I haven't had the invaluable time needed to be able to focus fully on evolving my own visions/feelings in my work and I'm ready now more than ever.  I’ve invested in myself, applied to grants and I'm always looking for opportunities that may help me achieve this goal-they have lead me here.  So, I'm ready to let go of the reins and stop looking at other art, quiet the voices of the outside world and truly tap into my own.  This break from these distractions will allow me the opportunity to build a powerful body of work that I can pour myself into fully, heart and soul.  Work that I can carry into the future, pursuing gallery representation, having solo exhibitions and other opportunities that will open many more doors to explore.  


The Funds & Perks

I’ll need 9,000 to cover and complete this project. 

To create the new paintings there are some supplies I will need.  They have come out to $4650.  They are as follows: Paint, Substrates, stretcher bars, studio and application tools, brushes, updated lighting, mediums, varnish and frames.

Other Expenses have come out to $4350: Studio/gallery yearly rent (I've had a public gallery space at LibertyTown Arts in Fredericksburg Va since 2009 that I LOVE and cannot afford to stay, and am trying to keep it for another year-as it's been very helpful exposure), Living expenses, New Website yearly fee, shipping costs of my work to different galleries in the USA, and Perk fulfillment. 

Here is the link to LibertyTown Arts!: http://www.libertytownarts.com/site/

And, here is me in my studio/gallery space through out the years there!: 


So...Perks! The fun part! 

I'm so excited about sharing these with you. I'm offering original charcoal drawings and oil paintings for lower prices, email critiques, wildcards, VIP invitations to see the Solo Show work first, art discounts and other surprises.   I'm also putting together some rad handwritten thank you cards because I appreciate you all so much.  

Below are photos of the pieces you are purchasing when you make a donation. They are listed in order to match up with the perks on the main page.  For more details or questions, feel free to message me here: jennaanderson2016@gmail.com  (Scroll down to the bottom of the story to view the images)


The Impact

               This campaign is just the beginning of the path I wish to be on, moving forward towards my goals.  My overall goal as a painter is to paint what I love.  And, I've been working hard for nine years now during which I've been eagerly gathering the reference material for these "love" paintings, and they've been patiently waiting for me to bring them to life.  I think..Honestly,their patience is running low... but that's a whole other story.  But, my point being, I've wanted nothing more in my life than the chance to paint them and it's Time.  At the end of this journey of a year I will hold a Solo Exhibition, unveiling this new library of paintings all together as a series.  The difference you will be making in my life will be more profound than I can possibly express, both mentally and spiritually.   With your help I can grow and evolve as an artist, building upon the foundation I’ve started- towards something even more amazing and authentically me.  And, I'll be able to keep my studio/gallery space that I love at LibertyTown Arts which will help me even further and keep me going strong on my journey! Now is your opportunity to give a little bit that will help me for a lifetime.   

I hope to share with you this new work and new energy it brings out.  I’ve never had a campaign or done anything like this, but I don't give up and would love the chance to prove myself to you.  Because, I’m obsessed with creating art, with painting and if I don’t get this chance I may go a little crazy.  And, I'm looking forward to sharing this journey with you as I keep you updated on my progress throughout the year. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute there is another way you can help!:

You can get the word out and make some noise about my campaign- I will be so grateful.  Indiegogo has some great share tools available to help make it easy! I thank you so much for your time and helping me make this happen! 

Want a quick way to peek in on my progress? You can Follow me on Instagram! 

https://instagram.com/jennaandersonfineart/

Or facebook!

https://www.facebook.com/jenna.anderson.3766

$500                                        Wildflower Painting
This painting was done from wildflowers I handpicked in a field and brought back to the studio <3


Progression of Wildflower Study, oil on panel. For this piece I explored a starting method I felt suited my subject most. I went from the parts to the whole. Selecting a small part of my subject, finishing it, selecting the adjoining part, finishing that and so on until all is whole. This approach allows you to explore all the elements in the subject at once, having fun with the subsequent stages of the painting.

                                                                  (Studio shot) 

                                                                               *

$725                                       Painting Dove Pendant

14 x 18 oil on panel (unframed)

This poor dove flew into the glass of my front door.  I came home to find him on the welcome mat and immediately set up a still life in his honor.  I always wanted to paint a dead bird and one literally showed up on my door step!!

                                                                               *

My first full face-intense study of myself.  I experimented with charcoal and acetone on mylar.

$650                                         Charcoal Drawing Dan
16 x 20 charcoal and acetone on quality bristol paper (Framed)


                                                                               *
$725                                       Painting Dove Pendant
14 x 18 oil on panel (unframed)
This poor dove flew into the glass of my front door.  I came home to find him on the welcome mat and immediately set up a still life in his honor.  I always wanted to paint a dead bird and one literally showed up on my door step!!

                                                                               *

$800                                     Self-Portrait in Charcoal      
My first full face-intense study of myself.  I experimented with charcoal and acetone on mylar. 


$800                         "Me" 13 x 18  Charcoal on mylar (Framed)


                                                                        (Detail)

                                                                              *                  
$825                                         Painting Evanescent
14 x 18 oil on panel (unframed)



                                                                   *
$2,000                                       Painting Insomnia 

                                                 24 x 24 oil on panel (unframed)
                                                                              *
     
$3,000                             Painting In Love Self-Portrait
36 x 48 oil on canvas (gallery wrapped)

                                                    and you are awesome.                                                #whoisjennaanderson

story:
On Saturday, August 1, over a hundred artists from around Seattle will join Tashiro Kaplan Artist Lofts (TK) tenants as we open our doors and take over the street for a day long, indoor and outdoor arts festival. The TK occupies an entire city block in the Pioneer Square neighborhood, and provides affordable housing to 50 artists and their families, plus nearly 30 commercial arts spaces. In honor of our 10th anniversary last year, we had a crazy idea that we could convince the City and Metro to enact major traffic revisions so we could spill out into the street in celebration. Our idea was not so crazy after all.

A New, Annual Arts Festival for Seattle


The singular TK, with its openness and concentration of creative energy, proved the perfect vehicle to host a new arts festival in Seattle, and to help continue the cultural heritage of Pioneer Square, home to the first monthly artwalk in the US.  The inaugural Art of the City festival was so successful that audiences, neighborhood partners, vendors, and artists alike requested that we make it an annual event. We are happily immersed in planning for our second year.

A Range of Cultural Experiences

Galaanza II performance

Art of the City will feature live music from folk to jazz to hip hop; staged and impromptu performances in a variety of categories; live painting and interactive installation; and 6 floors of open lofts, studios, galleries, and special exhibitions. Visitors also enjoy food and beverages from on site restaurants, food trucks, our catered Roof Deck Saloon, and a range of fun activities coordinated by local arts organizations and businesses. The spirit of the festival is one of welcoming and conviviality, helping to break down the barriers between creator and audience.

Celebrating Seattle Artists


Art of the City 2015 will take place coinciding with the new Seattle Art Fair, which will draw art collectors and art fans from around the world. Our intention is to present the most engaging and topical work by independent artists in a variety of forms, from experimental to more traditional, providing these out of town guests with a strong survey of the local art scene.

How You Can Help

Jonathan Wakuda Fischer

We’re seeking funding to support our participating artists, and to facilitate the presentation of their work. Your contributions will go towards art supplies, construction materials, equipment, staging, lighting, sound tech, labor, and ...talent! For example, included in our funding goal is the wood and hardware for an artist's new sculpture; the walls for our live painters; lighting for art exhibitions inside the building; and stage platforms and lights for our musicians and performers. This funding also allows us to reserve affordable booth space for 3 local non-profit arts organizations.

Who We Are

2015 organizing team, L-R: Lynn Schirmer, Jay Mason, Jenny Ku, Rachael Huffman, Sheri Brown, Dave Wilson, Melany Bell

Art of the City is produced by the Tashiro Kaplan Tenants Association (TKTA), with the support of the Alliance for Pioneer Square and is fiscally sponsored by Allied Arts Foundation. The festival is directed by a small but dedicated team of tenant volunteers. We’re absolutely committed to promoting meaningful and engaging artworks, and to the preservation of the cultural heritage of our wonderful, yet ever changing neighborhood.

Get to know us though our perks, each offered by an artist or business here at the TK. We hope you’ll join us in celebrating local artists, and the arts in Pioneer Square by supporting this new and growing festival. 

Thank you so much!

story:
What's this crowd fund all about?

Hi for those of you who don't know me, my name is Alice Black (sometimes known as Malice which is just Alice with an mmmm).  I am mother to two young sons, Morris Fox (11) & Dexter Wolf (7).  Mo as he likes to be known has dreamed about becoming a professional artist for quite some time now (he started out wanting to be an archaeologist and part time secret agent).  Mo's excellent nanny was his patron for many years and helped pay for Art classes that Mo attended after school.  Since I suffer from a number of chronic health conditions and have been off work since September last year (and Mo's nanny has now retired) I am hoping to find some helpful peeps who can contribute to Mo's art fund in order for him to get back into Art classes (as these have been on hold so far this year).

I am unable to provide the $ necessary for Mo to attend these very important lessons and I fear his dreams of making Art a profession will be lost without this extra tuition. 

Can you help contribute a little to the fund so Mo can return to art class and pay for some art materials too?  Just a few dollars from everyone would help us reach this goal and speed Mo on the way to becoming the next big thing in the Art world!  I am hoping when Mo makes it you will be able to tell people you had a hand at helping him before he was famous!

What we need and what you'll get

We're looking at trying to fund Mo's art classes for terms 3 & 4 and a few extra $ to go towards art supplies.  Mo has suggested he can send a drawing to those who contribute $25 & up (if you supply your postal address), so we're also putting some $ towards postal costs.  
Being able to go back to Art class will be a massive help for Mo and I hope will mean that he can continue to pursue his love of Art and work towards this as his career.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand, like us, many people are struggling financially and may not be able to contribute any cash but we would love it if you could share this campaign far and wide in the hope that those who can afford to donate, will.

Thanks for reading and hopefully sharing

story:
My Idea

I am a dedicated artist. I have a background in film, crafts, graphic design, and I have done everything from digital painting to pottery to re-furbishing an antique chair. My passion is creating worlds. Let me help you bring yours to life with as many action figures as you want. 

This project started with the toy you see on the left. I have been very busy working on this project so she is not complete, but she started it all. Sailor Moon was a passion of mine as a child, and Saturn is a character who was never made in this line of toys, which I love. I somehow ended up with some "extra" toys of other characters and since the body parts on the toys are interchangeable: Saturn was born! (The box was made by me, as was Jack's box. I bought the toys, Saturn was a re-paint, and Jack was custom ordered from the only other people who make things similar to Toys like Saturn.) 

On the Right side is Jack, one of my original characters, from a screenplay I am currently finishing up called Blood. I found a service that made him, and I really thought it was awesome when I found out I could have him made for me in this style! Wow! 

What I Need, and What You'll Get

What I would like from you, please: I have gotten to the stage where I own and have learned to use a 3D printer to make 3D printed objects, but now what I really need is to get the right kind of Filament, and so that I can make every toy perfect. Filament is expensive and I am working hard to find the perfect material in which to fabricate your toys, as I have yet to find it. This is where you can help the most. I may at some point need to make my own filament, and the price on filament makers is dropping, but is still expensive. Also new types of filaments are becoming available all the time. However, the price of filament is not dropping. To buy one spool of filament I have to sell 2 toys. The toys are small, so I am hoping the filament price will remain at it's current level and that I can buy what I need for not too great of a front-end investment, but I still really need your help buying materials.  

What you will get in return: Awesome Toys of course! But for those who pre-order and help make these a reality I am also going to offer inexpensive model drawings of your characters, a discount heal-your-mesh for 3D printing service, and limited edition toys of very few Anime characters. Pre-Order those Limited Editions now, I am only offering 20 of them. After that they will go exclusively to Etsy and will be much more expensive.  

The Impact

I want to help encourage all people, but especially children, to engage in real play and to expand their imaginations. I want to get them off of the video games for a little while and get them creating. I believe imaginative play as a child is one of the most important aspects of growing up to be a well rounded and thoughtful adult. Also sitting around all day and staring at computer and television screens can lead to serious health problems.

I think we deserve to give our children a chance to expand their play beyond the oridinary and give them real tools to spread their stories out into the world and I think that giving them toys of their own creation will help them in all aspects of their growth. I remember spending hours playing with my toys and creating stories of my own. I have been very sad to see actual children come into the Microsoft Store... I started hanging out there to check out a 3D printer they had, and made good friends with the staff... so I go there every week and kids come in and I'll ask them what they like to read or play with and none of them have even heard or have any interest in what I loved, and still love as an adult. More than one has actually said they have no interest in fantasy at all. It makes me actively sad.    

I think adults can benefit from this project as well. Use these toys as a tool to promote your special ideas, give an awesome gift. Surprise your friends with a toy of them, or of you!

Get on the floor with your kids, and play with them! Use your imagination, and see yourself come to life as a super hero, a magician, a princess, a pirate, or whatever you want to be. Help give me get the tools to make you or someone you love something totally awesome by Christmas time, or sooner!

My secondary goal is to help save Wildlife. So for every toy you buy I will donate $2 to this campaign: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/air-shepherd.... 

I believe in helping our world, not just human children, but if I raise more money than I need from this campaign it will go directly to funding the WWF. I truly believe in their mission, and I hope you do as well. Biodiversity is one of the most important things we can leave for our children, but we must act quickly before species like Elephants, Rhinos, and Big Cats, disappear forever.  

Risks & Challenges

So far my greatest challenges have been getting the right products for my project, and learning to use them properly. What you will help me to do is to get the right filament I need for these toys, as they require a special type of plastic I hope to re-create as accurately as possible so that your toys will not only be beautiful, but will be almost unbreakable.  

 Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot give money, you can always help by spreading the word. The more people know about this the more likely it will reach people who want to contribute. 

Thank you. 

(BTW I have flyers you can print if you would like them. Simply go to my website, contact me, and I will send you flyers you can print and pass out to your friends, family, enemies, random strangers, etc...)

story:
Showcase of Perks.  Don't leave until you've seen our page gallery for pictures of all perks. All our prints are limited edition, signed and numbered by the artists, and come with a certificate of authenticity. They come on Giclee Canvas printed and scanned on top of the line equipment then coated with a special coating which is baked on by UV light making your artwork water and scratch resistant

We are selling our artwork at well below market value. The reason for this is to thank our backers who are willing to support our venture early on.  The 9"x12" Giclee Prints up for $35 often retail for $60 or more. The 16"x20" Inner peace would usually go for upwards around $120. This is a steal, especially considering our prices will go up after the Indiegogo fundraising. That way you know that your artwork will be appreciating in value. Again, thank you backers for everything!

We are looking for funding to widen our selection of prints that we can provide. We are also trying to raise money to attend a handful of the artshows that happen here in Boise. Things like the Hyde Park Street fair, Boise Art in the Park and even some of the Saturday markets around town. Please help us out.  Below is a chart of all our perks for you to choose from. We hope you enjoy them and want to contribute to help us toward success!



The Big Picture


We are a small partnership from Boise, Idaho. We call ourselves Save an Artist. The name comes from our mission in business. Our big picture goal is to create jobs for talented but lesser known artists and to help them gain attention and grow their name in the art community. We want to eventually be able to pay our artists enough to live on and more if their work takes off.

Your funding will get the ball rolling on our business. Once these two artists have some of their work selling we will use all the money we get to reinvest in more talented artists and create jobs. Your funding is key in helping us to creating more jobs for our economy

The Small Picture

Currently we have scanned many of the smaller paintings. We are here seeking funds to scan the larger more expensive images like 'Go With The Flow' which is the size of a small person and costs 240 dollars to scan. If we can get 2500 dollars it will allow us to scan many of Travis' large/multi-canvas paintings like this one which has 4 separate canvases each one 18" x 24" ($80 each x 4 paintings= $240)


The other major goal we have for our campaign is to fund our attendance to the Hyde Park Street Fair. Its a local arts fair in Boise that would be an Ideal venue to showcase our prints and get our business' name out there. There are tons of festivals and art fairs like that out there and with additional funding we could attend even more.



Our Team

I'm the creator and founder who handles the business side of things. I'm also the voice behind our campaign.

Carter Weyrauch

These are our founding artists, Travis Seibolt (left) and Alexander Williamson (right).

      

      Travis Seibolt                                    Alexander Williamson

Alexander Williamson is currently earning money working as an artist and has a proven record of selling his artwork.  He also works at Trader Joe's to supplement his income.  People just like Alex find themselves on the brink of earning a good living by just doing art. Our dream is to help artists grow and get over that tipping point.

 Travis is an incredibly talented artist who most recently worked at a car dealership here in Boise, Idaho. He is no longer with the dealership and we want to save him (and hopefully others) from unemployment and dead end jobs.

These two like a ton of other artists out there would rather focus on the art than the business. That is where I come in. Things I draw or paint are barely recognizable, I do however have an entrepreneurial drive and the education to back it up.

 I'm a graduate from Boise State University's Entrepreneurship program and I'm dying to finally fulfill the need for entrepreneurship that I've been experiencing since I was young. I, just like many people, worked at low paying jobs through school and wasn't able to take an internship. I've found through my job hunting after graduation, that great jobs with great companies are really difficult to come by these days. That led me to believing launching my own business was the best way to go. Not only can I help myself get a job, I can help very talented artists as well.  I'm currently working as a phone banker which doesn't suit my entrepreneurial mind very well. I noticed that many artists will never realize what they could really accomplish with their artwork. I want to help artists that we see having a lot of promise to become better known and actually get paid for doing what they love to do. 

We help our artists by paying them a much higher royalty then ordinary businesses pay. With the success of this campaign we can turn our idea into a business that can save myself and others from jobs that sap out our desire to do art and bring inspiring beautiful things to the world. That is why we call ourselves Save an Artist. In my wildest dreams about this idea I see myself meeting passionate artists and being able to make their dream career a reality.

For more info on Carter Weyrauch or either of our artists and to see other works not featured here visit our official website.  Althought at the moment perks will be cheaper to get then paintings on our website http://www.saveanartist.com
 

Our Goal

Our goal of $2500 is enough for us to fulfill all of our perks, enough to help grow the business after our campaign (like attending art fairs), and get our high quality scans for each image listed in our perks. The more we can raise the more pieces of artwork we will be able to scan and have available in our online store very soon after the campaign ends!

Now you might ask yourself..."Self, why should I donate to these youngsters?"

Great question!

Why You Should Donate 

Donating will:

  • Make your walls happy by decorating them with our ultra high quality prints of beautiful artwork on scratch and water resistant Giclée Canvas. It can and will last you and your family lifetimes!
  • Help Create Meaningful Jobs for artists and other people in the economy! We pay more than double the industry standard rate to our artists to help make the work they do more meaningful and hopefully support their living completely at some point.
  • Help us scan and print inspiring limited edition copies of our artwork, with a lot of hard work and a little bit of luck, our artwork will appreciate for you in value as our artist's gain popularity!
  • Make you feel great about helping a good cause. I hope!

With any luck this campaign will lead to employment for tens if not hundreds of talented artists and qualified business people. Its been a dream of mine to start a business since I was young and learning what I've learned about the economy, now more then ever we need more new jobs for qualified people. Imagine a great artist among your friends and family. We want to give that person and all other artists out there a chance to have a career doing what they love to do!

Think you have what it takes to join our team? We are looking for artists with their own unique style that inspires artwork in others. If you think you fit the job, submit your artwork for consideration on our website. If we can get enough funding we will be taking on at least two more artists in late April or early May!

Our Biggest Challenges


We are new
  1. We are new to the world of internet and social media marketing. This makes it difficult to attract support
  2. This is our first business so odds are there will be unknowns that we will have to tackle.

Our Solutions

  1. We have learned a ton! This is our second try at crowdfunding after a failed experience with Kickstarter. We learned a lot about the demographics between Indiegogo and Kickstarter and Indiegogo fits our demographics much better then Kickstarter did. We are also prepared to outsource things like PR needs since this is not our area of expertise.
  2. We have found the perfect business to work with to create our prints.  With decades of experience, Canvas Fine Arts (formerly Perfection Image Studio) and the wonderful people there are kind enough to help us as we learn the ropes.
  3. We are not going to let just any artists in. We look for potential to grow an artist and create their own brand. Our quality will be one strength we maintain to help our artists gain the attention they deserve. We will only take on artists that meet a very high standard so that people know when that when they come to our site they will only see the best work of the best artists we can find.
  4. Choosing the right partners means we can focus on setting up a network that will let us sell and distribute artwork for Travis and many other artists to come.
  5. We politely request your help! Please help us out by using Indiegogo's awesome sharing tools. Use your very own organic sharing tool (your mouth) to tell people about our campaign. OR! best of all, donate to help us out!

While we are somewhat new at this business. I am proud to say that I have crunched all the numbers, I know exactly how much it will take scan, produce, and ship perks to our goal and well beyond it. We have the connections established already and this project is ready to launch and deliver some awesome artwork to you!

My entire college education was centered around learning what it takes to start up and build a successful business.  I absolutely love all the work I have done here and fully believe in what we are doing. It's always been a dream of mine to start a business. In school we are taught to examine what our network gives us and to work with that. When I looked at what was in my network I saw a LOT of very talented artists. Since I realized this, I've been reading up on everything I can get my hands on to learn about creating and selling artwork and building a business. I'm a highly adaptable person eager to drink up all the knowledge the internet and the world have to give.  Basically what I'm saying is that even with the challenges, I am excited and ready to deliver on this campaign and I'm confident you can find something you like in our artwork.

Pictures of perks are available in the image gallery


Important Info Below


All of these image except for: Kill Me Alive, Taming Medusa's Mane, Inner Peace, Heart and Soul, have all been taken by a camera on a phone.  They are not the high quality images that will be printed for your perks!  Kill Me Alive is the test scan that I did to make sure I had found the right partner, so that one is showing the quality of image we will produce (Quality was slightly lowered in online pictures for copyright security)

Kill Me Alive, Taming Medusa's Mane, Inner Peace, Heart and Soul are examples of the super high quality scans we do to produce your perks.

The quality of our re-creations is of utmost importance to us.  We will not be producing products with images that been with taken with a phone camera and printed out at home. Our Giclee prints are museum quality reproductions. Our scan and print shop uses an Epson 9900 printer with the industry's top-of-the-line UltraChrome K3 archival ink to re-create our artwork with cool coloration, superb saturation, and archival preservation for up to 200 years. The scanner used to get our images is top of the line and images are touched up to get rid of any marks or ripples from the original canvas. This quality means you and your family can continue to enjoy the artwork for generations.
story_txt:
Showcase of Perks.  Don't leave until you've seen our page gallery for pictures of all perks. All our prints are limited edition, signed and numbered by the artists, and come with a certificate of authenticity. They come on Giclee Canvas printed and scanned on top of the line equipment then coated with a special coating which is baked on by UV light making your artwork water and scratch resistantWe are selling our artwork at well below market value. The reason for this is to thank our backers who are willing to support our venture early on.  The 9"x12" Giclee Prints up for $35 often retail for $60 or more. The 16"x20" Inner peace would usually go for upwards around $120. This is a steal, especially considering our prices will go up after the Indiegogo fundraising. That way you know that your artwork will be appreciating in value. Again, thank you backers for everything!We are looking for funding to widen our selection of prints that we can provide. We are also trying to raise money to attend a handful of the artshows that happen here in Boise. Things like the Hyde Park Street fair, Boise Art in the Park and even some of the Saturday markets around town. Please help us out.  Below is a chart of all our perks for you to choose from. We hope you enjoy them and want to contribute to help us toward success!The Big Picture
We are a small partnership from Boise, Idaho. We call ourselves Save an Artist. The name comes from our mission in business. Our big picture goal is to create jobs for talented but lesser known artists and to help them gain attention and grow their name in the art community. We want to eventually be able to pay our artists enough to live on and more if their work takes off.
Your funding will get the ball rolling on our business. Once these two artists have some of their work selling we will use all the money we get to reinvest in more talented artists and create jobs. Your funding is key in helping us to creating more jobs for our economyThe Small Picture 

Currently we have scanned many of the smaller paintings. We are here seeking funds to scan the larger more expensive images like 'Go With The Flow' which is the size of a small person and costs 240 dollars to scan. If we can get 2500 dollars it will allow us to scan many of Travis' large/multi-canvas paintings like this one which has 4 separate canvases each one 18" x 24" ($80 each x 4 paintings= $240)


The other major goal we have for our campaign is to fund our attendance to the Hyde Park Street Fair. Its a local arts fair in Boise that would be an Ideal venue to showcase our prints and get our business' name out there. There are tons of festivals and art fairs like that out there and with additional funding we could attend even more.



 Our Team I'm the creator and founder who handles the business side of things. I'm also the voice behind our campaign. 

Carter Weyrauch 
These are our founding artists, Travis Seibolt (left) and Alexander Williamson (right).

       
     
Travis Seibolt                                    Alexander Williamson
Alexander Williamson is currently earning money working as an artist and
 has a proven record of selling his artwork.  He also works at Trader 
Joe's to supplement his income.  People just like Alex find themselves 
on the brink of earning a good living by just doing art. Our dream is to
 help artists grow and get over that tipping point.
 Travis is an incredibly talented artist who most recently worked at a car dealership here in Boise, Idaho. He is no longer with the dealership and we want to save him (and hopefully others) from unemployment and dead end jobs. 
These two like a ton of other artists out there would rather focus on the art than the business.  That is where I come in. Things I draw or paint are barely recognizable, I do however have an entrepreneurial drive and the education to back it up.
 I'm a graduate from Boise State University's Entrepreneurship program and I'm dying to finally fulfill the need for entrepreneurship that I've been experiencing since I was young. I, just like many people, worked at low paying jobs through school and wasn't able to take an internship. I've found through my job hunting after graduation, that great jobs with great companies are really difficult to come by these days. That led me to believing launching my own business was the best way to go. Not only can I help myself get a job, I can help very talented artists as well.  I'm currently working as a phone banker which doesn't suit my entrepreneurial mind very well. I noticed that many artists will never realize what they could really accomplish with their artwork. I want to help artists that we see having a lot of promise to become better known and actually get paid for doing what they love to do.  
We help our artists by paying them a much higher royalty then ordinary businesses pay. With the success of this campaign we can turn our idea into a business that can save myself and others from jobs that sap out our desire to do art and bring inspiring beautiful things to the world. That is why we call ourselves Save an Artist. In my wildest dreams about this idea I see myself meeting passionate 
artists and being able to make their dream career a reality.For more info on Carter Weyrauch or either of our artists and to see other works not featured here visit our official website.  Althought at the moment perks will be cheaper to get then paintings on our website http://www.saveanartist.com 

 

Our GoalOur
goal of $2500 is enough for us to fulfill all of our perks, enough to help grow the business after our campaign (like attending art fairs), and get our high quality scans for each image 
listed in our perks. The more we can raise the more pieces of artwork we
 will be able to scan and have available in our online store very soon 
after the campaign ends!
Now you might ask yourself..."Self, why should I donate to these youngsters?"
Great question!
 
 
Why You Should Donate  

Donating will:



Make your walls happy by decorating them with our ultra high quality prints of beautiful artwork on scratch and water resistant Giclée Canvas. It can and will last you and your family lifetimes!


Help Create Meaningful Jobs for artists and other people in the economy! We pay more than 
double the industry standard rate to our artists to help make the work 
they do more meaningful and hopefully support their living completely at
 some point.

Help us scan and print inspiring limited edition copies of 
our artwork, with a lot of hard work and a little bit of luck, our artwork will
appreciate for you in value as our artist's gain popularity!


Make you feel great about helping a good cause. I hope!
  With any luck this campaign will lead to 
employment for tens if not hundreds of talented artists and qualified 
business people. Its been a dream of mine to start a business since I 
was young and learning what I've learned about the economy, now more 
then ever we need more new jobs for qualified people. Imagine a great 
artist among your friends and family. We want to give that person and 
all other artists out there a chance to have a career doing what they 
love to do!Think you have what it takes to join our team? We are
 looking for artists with their own unique style that inspires artwork in others. If you think you fit 
the job, submit your artwork for consideration on our website. If we can get enough funding we will be taking on at least two more artists in late April or early May!
Our Biggest Challenges
We are new
We are new to the world of internet and social media marketing. This makes it difficult to attract support

This is our first business so odds are there will be unknowns that we will have to tackle. 



  Our Solutions


We have learned a ton! This is our second try at crowdfunding after a failed experience with Kickstarter. We learned a lot about the demographics between Indiegogo and Kickstarter and Indiegogo fits our demographics much better then Kickstarter did. We are also prepared to outsource things like PR needs since this is not our area of expertise.

We have found the perfect business to work with to create our prints.  With decades of experience, Canvas Fine Arts (formerly Perfection Image Studio) and the wonderful people there are kind enough to help us as we learn the ropes. 

We are not going to let just any artists in. We look for potential to grow an artist and create their own brand. Our quality will be one strength we maintain to help our artists gain the attention they deserve. We will only take on artists that meet a very high standard so that people know when that when they come to our site they will only see the best work of the best artists we can find.

Choosing the right partners means we can focus on setting up a network that will let us sell and distribute artwork for Travis and many other artists to come.

in my network I saw a LOT of very talented artists. Since I realized this, I've

story:
Back By Popular Demand! 

I'm making a new calendar of my watercolor portraits for next year. Next, next year.

My 2012 calendar was a big hit and I'm excited to kick off 2015 with a 2016 calendar. if that makes sense. Here's what the last one looked like.

As a portrait artist, I'm in the storytelling business. They're not my stories to tell, necessarily, but somehow through the miracle of the interwebs, or by word of mouth, or just plain luck, people find me and ask me to tell them in their stead. Through art.

These stories range from the joyous (wedding portraits!) to the heartbreaking (a lost pet) and everything in between.

I make people cry.

A lot.

In this calendar, and through these images, I'll be sharing the stories of clients who have supported me as an artist, as well as those that are just finding me.

I hope to do your stories justice.

Your funding will: - Pay for printing and production costs of the calendar - Include shipping for your reward, if selected*

Portfolio: http://www.rachaelrossman.com/gallery Press:http://www.rachaelrossman.com/events Blog: http://www.rachaelrossman.com/the-blog

*Portrait images are subject to artist approval

What I Need & What You Get

  • I need $300 to print a small amount of calendars. The rest of the funds will go to supplies and shipping out perks.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • If the project does not reach its entire funding goal, you will still receive your original artwork (see perks.)
  • If the project does not reach its entire funding goal and you have signed up for a calendar-only perk, you can apply that amount toward ordering original artwork from me (4x5s start at $60) or notecards.
Risks & Challenges

My main challenge with any time-sensitive project is receiving the photos from backers in a timely fashion. I will need to have all photos by about August in order to paint the portraits, design the calendar and have it printing for November delivery.

About Me

I am a self-taught watercolor artist, working primarily on Yupo paper which is what gives my work its unique organic texture. I work out of my home studio with the assistance of copious amounts of coffee, loud music and Netflix. You may have seen my work on ThePioneerWoman.com, Dooce.com, MarthaStewart.com, TheBloggess.com, Neil Gaiman's twitter feed, or at the 2010 MTV Movie Award celebrity gift lounge.

I live in Salem, Oregon.

story:
Discovering the Fountain Of Imagination

Where it all started

I started teaching to a class of Grade 5 students in July 2014 as a Teach For India Fellow. The resources available to me were a whiteboard, a marker and a class filled with 31 uber enthusiastic kids who were full of energy and eagerness to learn. The onus was on me to deliver them the quality education that they deserve with the available resources at hand.
I have always believed that a quality education should not be just about building academic skills in the students within a narrow school environment. Rather, it should be about mirroring a set of experiences and achievements that a kid deserves later in his life. Hence, I called my class - 31 creators and set out to teach them the joy and experience of creating things.
31 Creators Ink was born out of my class' need to become self-reliant where the kids use their skills to fund their classroom resources instead of depending on philanthropic donations. It has fuelled my kids with a sense of unparalleled pride and has uncovered the fountain of imagination within my kids' minds.

What Do They DO:

And How They Do It


A bunch of kidpreneurs at 31Creators Ink explaining the meaning behind a business card they designed

Kids at 31 Creators Ink contact individuals and organisations to meet the need of an innovative and customized B-card design. They collect information that the business card needs to carry like name, designation, tagline, logo etc. along with the information about the work that the individual or the organisation does (also the likes and dislikes of the individual).
Then the most interesting part of the process begins where the kids ideate, draw and brainstorm over the design of the business card, the placement of different elements, the primary colours and the borders to be used on the card etc. They discuss their opinions and filter their ideas before coming up with a version of business card they think accurately reflects the work of the company and the individual. I then help them convert their drawings into computer images on my computer. The kids have designed several business cards so far.

You can see more of their work at https://www.facebook.com/31creatorsinc

Taking the next step

And How You Can Help

The next step at 31Creators Ink is to equip these kids with proper technology and skills like using graphic tablets to draw, training them on the use of computers and graphics software. We also need to continuously engage these kids and build further the entrepreneurial and design ability in these kids. The goal is to make 31Creators Ink sustainable by placing adequate infrastructure for these kids so that they can continuously engage and build further the entrepreneurial and design abilities in themselves independently.
As such, you can help in following ways:
  • Give Invest in this kidpreneurial venture and feel proud to be an investor of a remarkable and unique startup at 31 Creators Ink
  • Order your business cards or logo design from 31Creators Ink and watch the magic of a child's imagination at work.
  • Spread the word around and make some noise about this campaign.
All the money raised through the campaign will be utilised in the following manner:
  • Buying 5 desktop computers ($2000), 1 All-in-one printer($150), 5 graphics tablets -($700) (like Wacom Tablets).
  • Renting a small space outside the school where kids can work on their orders after school hours ($1200 per year).

Impact

The Difference You Will Make

You will be helping the kids realize the power to dream beyond what is naturally given to them. The entire project will ingrain in these kids a sense of self-belief, the power of purpose and the ability to contribute actively to the society. 

The venture will also make the child and his community re-think their own limits and the power they have to overcome the obstacle they face in their lives.

Risks and Challenges

Gauging The Mountains and Climbing Over It

The biggest challenge is to break the mindset of a conventional education system that the school and the child's community has restricted itself to. It is also challenging to find time to undertake the venture in addition to building academic rigour in the kids.

Both these problems have been attempted to tackle in the following ways:

  • Integrating the school academics with the kidpreneurial project. For example : Teaching them ratios (in academics) and how rectangles with golden ratio between their dimensions look more attractive (in design) - can cover both the worlds.
  • Renting a separate space outside school premises where kids can drop-in any time after school to work on their orders.
  • Engaging volunteers with a shared vision of exploring the fountain of imagination in a kids' mind and training the kids in the use of computers and graphics software.

Other ways you can help

The best gifts come from the heart

Don't worry if you cannot help us money-wise. There are still other ways in which you can help the campaign.

  • Share our campaign story with your friends and relatives by sharing the link http://igg.me/at/31creatorsink on facebook and twitter.
  • Help us with your ideas and suggestions on how we can make this better.
  • Write a word of encouragement for my kids and send it to 31creatorsinc@gmail.com

story:
Summary

Bolanos Drum Co. is located in Glendale Heights, IL about 30 miles west from the great city of Chicago. Chicago is known as the birth ground for many of the famous and innovated drum companies in the world. For example: Ludwig, Slingerland, Camco, and Trick drums. Also, Chicago has one of the biggest drum store in the nation which is Vic's Drum Shop. Bolanos Drum Co is adding to that trend of innovation and integrity. How are we adding to that trend of innovation? The way that we are innovating is by using variety of woods to build drums. We use maple, birch, beach, mahogany, oak walnut and bubinga in our line up. Every drum that is build from different wood has a different tonality, resonance and character. Many companies use only maple and birch and maybe they use some other woods in there line up. That's why we are different from the majority of small drum companies and we stand out from the small custom drum builders. Other custom drum builders are able to build an amazing looking drums but the problem is that 70% to 80% of those custom drum builders are buying their shells only from the same manufacturer. So in reality there is not much difference in sound from drum builder to drum builder. We have partner with other drum shells manufacturer that are able to provide shells with our own specifications. No other drum company in the market has been able to provide drummers with so much variety of wood shells and shell sizes. We are putting our selfs in market where no one has gone before. We are covering as much of the sound spectrum as possible.

We want to rise $4,000 and with these funds we want to expand our brand to the Classic Series and Retrolite Series snare drum and later expand it full drum sets. Also, with these funds we be able to buy more machinery so that we can do more in - house work rather than outsourcing it and that way will help reduce cost of production and bring the price down for customers and that will lead to more competitive prices.

What We Need 

We want to rise $4,000 and with these funds we want to expand our brand to the Classic Series and Retrolite Series snare drum and later expand it full drum sets. Also, with these funds we be able to buy more machinery so that we can do more in - house work rather than outsourcing it and that way will help reduce cost of production and bring the price down for customers and that will lead to more competitive prices.

Risks & Challenges

The problem is that there is a lot of competitor out on drum making market. The only way to compete with other custom drum companies is to have a good advertising. The way this is going to happen is to put an advertising on three of the biggest drum magazines and these are: Modern Drummer Magazine, Drum Magazine and Rhythm Magazine. These three major magazines are distributed all over the world. Show casing our product on different drum shows, for example, the Chicago Drum Show in St. Charles IL and the NAMM Show in Anaheim California and many others. Also, going to different drum stores like Vic's Drum Shop, Chicago Music Exchange etc.. and present our products so they can have our product on sales floor. With these two execution along with the website (which is already running), it will help in two ways. First, it will increase sales. And second, we will get notice and recognized in the drum community as a drum company that does things bit different. The bottom line is to expose the brand as much as possible and tell customers why Bolanos Drum Co. is right choice and that we are here to help every drummer achieve their own sound by providing a variety of wood shells. Let customer understand that we are here to customize each drummer sound, expressions and style of playing and meet their individual needs.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some of you won't be able to contribute, but that doesn't mean that you can't help. Here are the few ways that you can help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • You can use  the Indiegogo share tools!

Also, Chicago has one of the biggest drum store in the nation which is Vic's Drum Shop. Bolanos Drum Co is adding to that trend of innovation and integrity. How are we adding to that trend of innovation? The way that we are innovating is by using variety of woods to build drums. We use maple, birch, beach, mahogany, oak walnut and bubinga in our line up. Every drum that is build from different wood has a different tonality, resonance and character. Many companies use only maple and birch and maybe they use some other woods in there line up. That's why we are different from the majority of small drum companies and we stand out from the small custom drum builders. Other custom drum builders are able to build an amazing looking drums but the problem is that 70% to 80% of those custom drum builders are buying their shells only from the same manufacturer. So in reality there is not much difference in sound from drum builder to drum builder. We have partner with other drum shells manufacturer that are able to provide shells with our own specifications. No other drum company in the market has been able to provide drummers with so much variety of wood shells and shell sizes. We are putting our selfs in market where no one has gone before. We are covering as much of the sound spectrum as possible.
We want to rise $4,000 and with these funds we want to expand our brand to the Classic Series and Retrolite Series snare drum and later expand it full drum sets. Also, with these funds we be able to buy more machinery so that we can do more in - house work rather than outsourcing it and that way will help reduce cost of production and bring the price down for customers and that will lead to more competitive prices.   What We Need  We want to rise $4,000 and with these funds we want to expand our brand to the Classic Series and Retrolite Series snare drum and later expand it full drum sets. Also, with these funds we be able to buy more machinery so that we can do more in - house work rather than outsourcing it and that way will help reduce cost of production and bring the price down for customers and that will lead to more competitive prices.

    Risks & Challenges The problem is that there is a lot of competitor out on drum making market. The only way to compete with other custom drum companies is to have a good advertising. The way this is going to happen is to put an advertising on three of the biggest drum magazines and these are: Modern Drummer Magazine, Drum Magazine and Rhythm Magazine. These three major magazines are distributed all over the world. Show casing our product on different drum shows, for example, the Chicago Drum Show in St. Charles IL and the NAMM Show in Anaheim California and many others. Also, going to different drum stores like Vic's Drum Shop, Chicago Music Exchange etc.. and present our products so they can have our product on sales floor. With these two execution along with the website (which is already running), it will help in two ways. First, it will increase sales. And second, we will get notice and recognized in the drum community as a drum company that does things bit different. The bottom line is to expose the brand as much as possible and tell customers why Bolanos Drum Co. is right choice and that we are here to help every drummer achieve their own sound by providing a variety of wood shells. Let customer understand that we are here to customize each drummer sound, expressions and style of playing and meet their individual needs.



Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that some of you won't be able to contribute, but that doesn't mean that you can't help. Here are the few ways that you can help:

Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
You can use  the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
About me and my Fundraiser

Hello! My name is Liz Robb. I am an artist working sculpturally to create textured surfaces and forms with natural materials such as cotton, wool, beeswax, and indigo. If you are interested in seeing my artwork, you can find my website here. 

I have been accepted to attend the Icelandic Textile Center residency program for September and October 2015. I am raising money to fund my flight, residency, and travel expenses from San Francisco to Blönduós, Iceland.

Payment for two months at the residency is 1100 Euros, or about $1250. Currently a flight from San Francisco to Reykjavik is about $1100. I'm estimating food for the entire stay to be about $1000. I'd appreciate the opportunity to exchange art for funding to help make this residency more manageable to attend. I currently work full time in my studio in the Dogpatch neighborhood of San Francisco as well as doing part-time work delivering delicious gourmet food. All of the money will go directly towards purchasing my flight, paying the residency fees, and providing me with money to live while staying in Iceland. Any money that goes over the goal amount will go towards materials I will use to create new art!

During my residency at the Icelandic Textile Centre, I’d like to pursue three larger-than-life moveable sculptures, created on and off the loom, using materials I source from the land and surrounding areas such as wool and plant material.  The sculptures will interact with space both outside in the wilderness and inside the gallery, installed in multiple configurations, allowing for multiple vantage points for the viewer to engage with two or three structural planes. They will come alive with the energy and bricolage aspect of foraging my materials around the Textile Centre. These large sculptural weavings will be supported by smaller, notebook sized, daily responses, embroidered, woven, knitted, or drawn, that reflect my learning and experience.  Colors that reflect the Icelandic landscape will be integrated into my work by collecting plants and pigments to naturally dye materials, similar to the indigo dyeing I currently implement in my work.  I would like to research and dissect traditional Icelandic patterns and their meanings to develop and create my own structural compositions, developing a patterned language and imprint of my time spent there.



What's in it for you?

With your support in helping me continue my artistic explorations in Iceland, I'd like to give one of a kind pieces of art that reflect my current studio practice.  My perks include everything from hand-wrapped tassels to indigo dipped paintings to large works created during my residency in Iceland.

Other Ways to Help

  • Spread the word!  If you know anyone who may be interested in my art or looking to develop a commissioned piece, I'd be grateful to work with them.
  • You can easily share my Fundraiser with the below Indiegogo tools.

If you have any questions please feel free to email me or contact me through my website.  I appreciate your time and consideration and I thank you in advance for donating and spreading the word of my campaign!

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Melaina Todd, and I am an artist from Kamloops BC who was recently accepted into a research residency Geophilia with Ayatana Artist Research Program in Gatineau, Quebec. 
  • The goal of my campaign is to raise money to cover travel and residency costs.

    • I will meet specialists in Geology, explore Laflèche Caves, visit the Museum of Nature's mineral collections, fire raku pottery, hang out in Carleton University's microanalysis laboratory and collect fossils to name a few activities. Then using all this knowledge, I will be creating a new body of work combining geology and art.

  • By supporting my campaign, you are supporting my art career and education.
  • All contributors will receive a hand drawn, 1/1, pencil and ink drawing of your pet! Send me photos, ideas etc. and I will gladly make you a one of a kind drawing of your precious fur baby.

What I Need & What You Get

  • The residency will cost $1500, and travel will cost at least $800. 
  • You get an original pencil and ink drawing of your pet! They come in three sizes, $50 for a small,$110 for a large and $220 for an X Large portrait.

The Impact

  • As an emerging artist, it is vital for my practice to do residencies and learn through cross-disciplinary programs like Art Ayatana Artist Research Program.
  • I am being challenged to make new work and sharing ideas with artists and specialists.
  • I am exposed to a greater audience of patrons, artists, educators and galleries.
  • I will have created a body of work of all the pet portraits that I have done!

Risks & Challenges

It will be difficult to reach this deadline by May 7, 2015, which is in under two months, so please share this campaign with your friends, coworkers and families. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with anyone who loves their pets, supporting emerging artists and affordable  original artwork. Thanks!

story:
Summary

Join Matthew Cicanese on a unique sensory expedition into the natural world of macro. Travel across time and experience personal journey, the progression of exploration, and witness the beauty of Earth’s biodiversity through documentary storytelling.  The Evolution of Wonder invites you to experience the natural world in ways you’ve never seen it before. 

This project represents the culmination of Matthew's degree in Duke University's Master of Fine Arts in Experimental & Documentary Arts program (MFA|EDA). 

Your support will enable Matthew to cover the costs of this exhibition, and potentially tour this body of work at venues around the world! Matthew's initial goal is $2,500, but more funding would enable Matthew to potentially travel with his work on a tour around the U.S. and locations across the globe. 


About Matthew

Matthew was born and raised in Dade City, Florida (USA). He is a conservationist, explorer, and award-winning documentary artist who expresses the beauty of the Earth's biodiversity through documentary media production. In addition to photography, Matthew is also a budding filmmaker and radio storyteller. At 23 years old he has already held four professional internships, and gained experience with world-renown organizations including the National Geographic Society. Following his graduation from Duke University's MFA–EDA program (Master of Fine Arts in Experimental & Documentary Arts), he plans to produce exploration-based conservation media full-time as an independent documentarian. 

Mother and Son / 1992 – Matthew's and his mom at the hospital during his survival of meningitis at 9 months old. 

Father and Son on the Summit / 2007  – Matthew and his dad on a summit in Philmont Scout Ranch during their 75 mile backpacking trek. 


On the Steps of National Geographic / 2013  – Matthew, an intern of the Nat. Geo. Big Cats Initiative, visiting headquarters in Washington, D.C.


Funding Details

Funds provided will offset the cost of producing these initial prints for the premiere of my work at the Duke MFA exhibition. I paid for these prints out of pocket and it would be amazing to mitigate those costs. The materials used are gallery-quality and will last for years to come. Additional funding will enable me to print more works like those in the upcoming gallery, and your help will contribute to building a collection of large-format prints that I would like to exhibit at galleries across the world in the immediate future. 

"I would ideally like to raise enough to travel with my gallery as a performance artist, and showcase this work across the US (as well as select global locations). Though the details of that endeavor haven't been determined yet, I will be updating you throughout the campaign on the progression of this."  —Matthew


Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word with your family and friends! This is my very first crowd sourcing campaign, and I'm really looking forward to it being a success. Sharing on social media or emailing this to a friend can go a long way (please see the share tools at the top of this page). 


Thank you!

Thank you so much for your support for my endeavors. I'm truly excited to share my work with you, and showcase it to the world! 
If you have any questions, please feel free to reach out to me at my website: www.matthewcicanese.com


All my very best,

Matthew Cicanese
Explorer | Conservationist | Documentarian
Duke University MFA–EDA Class of 2015
