story:
Who is Most Wanted Fine Art?

Most Wanted Fine Art is a Pittsburgh based community center disguised as an art gallery. Open since 2004, owners Jason and Nina Sauer host 14 resident artists, provide job training for individuals recently released from prison, and create yearly art cars.

MWFA has been invited to present the Pittsburgh Art Car at the prestigious Downtown LA Artwalk and the Bay Area Maker Faire in May. Since the car must be driven cross-country MWFA plans on taking seven artists total on the adventure. 

Most Wanted themed art piece grows throughout the Art Car Tour and is towed behind a van throughout the trip as mobile sculpture. The team takes mugshots of people in each city and wheat pastes them directly on to the car as well as uploading the images to social media. This allows the participant to be part of the trip and follow the adventures. The artists  will be creating art live and participating in artist talks and discussions in different cities along the route. Once the car returns home it will move on to its next stage The Demolition Derby where it will be smashed over the Labor Day Weekend in the name of performance art.

Once a year since 1995, Jason Sauer has chosen a car, painted it artistically, and then participated in an American folk art performance of Demolition Derby at the Great Stoneboro Fair. This event sells out each year with over 6,000 people in attendance. He doesn’t always win, but cars always get smashed and sometimes the family comes home with a trophy.

The wrecked car will then be transformed one more time in the name of art. Jason Sauer will use a torch and cut out pieces of the car and create art out of the scraps. These limited pieces can be obtained by backers in their natural state or with the elevation of real Diamond Dust.

What we need and What you get

Here are the details:

  • This is a huge opportunity for the seven participating artists to build community with other public artists around the country and we can’t do it with out your support. 
  • Participating artists include: Sam Thorp, Darrell Kinsel, Dante Lombardi, Kai Devenitch, Rich Jackley, and Nina and Jason Sauer. All of these artists give countless hours of service to the Pittsburgh community. http://mostwantedfineart.com/resident-artist-bios/
  • Four artists will be traveling in the car and three of the artists who couldn't take 20 days off work, will be flying into Los Angeles and then driving with us to San Francisco. The tour schedule is leave Pittsburgh PA MAY 5, Chattanooga TN MAY 6, Longview TX MAY 7, Houston TX MAY 8-9, Amarillo TX MAY 9-10, Grand Canyon AZ  MAY 10-11, Los Angeles CA MAY 13-14, San Francisco CA MAY 15-18, Reno NV MAY 19, Salt Lake City UT MAY 20, Denver CO MAY 21, Omaha NE MAY 22, Chicago IL MAY 23-24, return to Pittsburgh May 25.
  • In return for your contribution to the art process you get art in return! Each participating artist will be creating a travel log using letters and graphic images that they will personalize for donors to the crowdfund. Pieces art will be created from the actual tour car, as well as a hand screen printed coloring book for all ages. Pledges start at $1.00 in keeping with the gallery’s commitment to make art accessible to everyone. 

  • The goal of the campaign is $7,000 all of which will be used to cover expenses associated with transporting seven artists cross-country.

    This includes:

    Gas for 6370 miles = $3663

    Hotels 15 nights =$1245

    Air Fare for three artists who can’t make the full drive and will meet us along the way= $1050

    Fees= $1042

    GRAND TOTAL= $7000

    Other expenses like food, tolls, car trailer will be covered out of our pockets.

    If we exceed our goal the funds will be used to further the Resident Artist program, which includes a June trip to Cleveland for the Waterloo Arts Fest, and 14 projects that benefit  Garfield in Pittsburgh.

    If we don’t make our goal we will sadly trim some cities from the tour list to save gas as well as some of the hotel stays. We are willing to camp to make our travel dream come true.

You are making a difference!

Sometimes its hard to create career opportunities on an artist's budget. You would be giving back to seven people who give to the Pittsburgh community everyday. 

  • Change lives, be part of an evolving art project and get a piece of it in return! Its so many wins!
  • We crowd funded $3000 for a tour in 2012 where Nina, Jason, and baby Rowdy Sauer took the art car to St Louis, Houston, Jacksonville, Myrtle Beach, and other great cities. http://pittsburghartcar.com/2012-tour/
  • In 2013 MWFA paid for the trip  and went to Philadelphia, Baltimore, and NYC for The World's Maker Faire. In 2014 MWFA paid for 5 artists to travel with the car and attended the World's Maker Faire. http://pittsburghartcar.com/2014-tour/
  • This year we need your help! This is the most artists we have ever traveled with and the farthest we have ever taken the car, plus as you know gas is very expensive. 

Sometimes It's a Bumpy Road

With any long distance drive there are pot holes and wrong turns. We know there is a chance for a break down, flat tire, or other road side hazard that could delay us in our trip. 

  • Jason Sauer grew up in a family of mechanics and has enough knowledge to fix most things. For the things he can't we have made contact with shops along the way so we have emergency plans for break downs. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes help is worth more than money:

  • We need you to share this campaign and help tell our story with your social media, email contacts, and face to face with friends. 
  • We need places to stay in all the cities we visit! Do you or a friend have a nice comfy floor? These are the tentative cities and dates. 

    Pittsburgh PA MAY 5, Chattanooga TN MAY 6, Longview TX MAY 7, Houston TX MAY 8-9, Amarillo TX MAY 9-10, Grand Canyon AZ  MAY 10-11, Los Angeles CA MAY 13-14, San Francisco CA MAY 15-18, Reno NV MAY 19, Salt Lake City UT MAY 20, Denver CO MAY 21, Omaha NE MAY 22, Chicago IL MAY 23-24

story:
Alors que la saison des pluies se termine au Népal – c’est maintenant que démarre réellement la reconstruction suite aux séismes dévastateurs du printemps dernier.

« Dessiner pour le Népal » c’est aller à la rencontre des survivants du séisme en leur permettant de partager leurs idées et leurs visions sur leur architecture en reconstruction – en proposant des améliorations.

« Dessiner pour le Népal » c’est un projet dessin collaboratif avec la population népalaise et les architectes locaux.

En collaboration avec des architectes népalais et des architectes canadiens, les dessins présenteront des améliorations peu coûteuses et efficaces pour la reconstruction en cours.

Les dessins seront ensuite vendus et l’argent amassé sera versé à l’organisme Caritas Népal – directement impliqué dans la reconstruction du pays.

Voici à quoi ressembleront les œuvres :

À quoi serviront vos dons ?

·  À soutenir la réalisation des dessins « en co-création » avec les survivants du séisme et avec des architectes locaux travaillant à la reconstruction.

·  À amasser des fonds pour la reconstruction. Les dessins seront exposés au Québec puis vendus lors d’un encan - L’argent amassé par la vente sera versé à l’organisme Caritas Népal (http://www.caritasnepal.org/) – directement impliqué dans la reconstruction du pays.

·  À créer des liens entre les architectes népalais et les architectes canadiens.

·  À faire de l’art un baume dans ce contexte difficile.

Les dessins seront réalisés dans les trois régions suivantes :

Patan :

Bhaktapur:

Kathmandu:


L’idée derrière les dessins…

1. Amasser des fonds pour la reconstruction

·  Après avoir été exposées au Québec, les dessins seront vendues lors d’un encan. L’argent amassé sera versé à l’organisme Caritas Népal – directement impliqué dans la reconstruction du pays.

·  Lors de l’exposition, les dessins seront combiner à une installation sonore. Des extraits de témoignages de survivants - mélangés à l’environnement sonore naturel de la reconstruction accompagneront les dessins.

·  Le public sera ainsi transporté dans un univers multisensoriel ancré dans la réalité de ce long processus de reconstruction. Cela permettra de faire prendre conscience de l’ampleur du processus en réactualisant ces évènements.

2. Créer des liens entre les architectes népalais et les architectes canadiens

·  Une dizaine d’architectes canadiens se joignent au projet comme conseillers techniques lors de la réalisation des dessins.

·  Les architectes proposeront des techniques et méthodes inspirantes en matière de reconstruction. Ils contribueront à ce que le projet puisse apporter aux architectes népalais des idées peu coûteuses et efficaces provenant d’autres régions du monde.

3. Par l’art, amener un peu de rêves et de soulagement aux communautés éprouvées


Qui sommes nous ?

L’artiste Mathieu Gagnon dessine depuis de nombreuses années. Il élabore des œuvres relevant d’une fiction architecturale. Sa pratique est proche de la photographie puisque le rendu en est réaliste. M.Gagnon s’intéresse particulièrement à la conservation du patrimoine bâti et la reconstruction durable. Son travail a été présenté dans des expositions et foires au Québec, à Toronto et New York. Il travaille également comme photographe au Centre canadien d'architecture (CCA) depuis 2013.

La chercheure Mathilde Forest Rivière se joint au projet pour aider à la conduite des entrevue et à la recherche sur les pratiques inspirantes en architecture de reconstruction. M. Forest Rivière sera notamment responsable de collecter des témoignages relatant le quotidien des Népalais et Népalaises. M. Forest Rivière est co-fondatrice de la firme de recherche Bem & co. et cumule plusieurs années d’expérience comme journaliste. Elle a mené plusieurs projets de recherche et reportages en Asie, tout particulièrement au Népal. M. Forest Rivière aborde principalement les thématiques de la rencontre interculturelle, le parcours des réfugiés ainsi que la préservation de la culture immatérielle.

story:
cssJPG. La rue, notre atelier.

Le projet artistique collectif et participatif cssJPG investit l’espace public en proposant un nouveau regard sur la nature.

Chaque oeuvre, appelée «CSS», est composée par un ensemble de photos prises en milieu naturel (les textures) et assemblées en mosaïque pour créer un tableau pixélisé.

Ces illusions éphémères s’inscrivent en milieu urbain pour être données à la vue et à la portée des passants, les questionner, ou simplement provoquer leurs réactions spontanées.

Ce projet tend à valoriser l’environnement naturel et invite chacun à se questionner sur la nature, la cité et les interactions entre ses habitants. Inscrire une «CSS» dans la rue, c’est créer un espace d’expression.

Le public est ensuite libre de l’interpréter et de lui donner une identité.

Le site web cssJPG encourage les commentaires et favorise la libre expression.

Portrait par DR - Plan des Consuls - Adissan - France - Collection 2014


#SÉRIE12, c'est quoi ?

Acquérir une oeuvre et l'exposer chez soi est une façon d'exprimer sa personnalité. L'esthétique, le concept et les valeurs défendues par une création sont autant de façons de se révéler.

Les oeuvres urbaines installés par cssJPG sont éphémères, c'est pourquoi nous avons imaginé des Collections qui recensent annuellement les images documentants chaque fresque.

Avec la #SÉRIE12, nous souhaitons rendre ces Collections accessibles pour que chacun puisse facilement les emporter et les représenter dans son cercle intime.

#SÉRIE12 c'est :

  • Une sélection de 12 images par année issues des collections cssJPG
  • Un tirage de ces 12 images limité à 250 exemplaires. Chaque images sont titrées, numérotées, gaufrées et signées.
  • Toutes les images ont le même format (21cm x 30cm), pour une impression en quadrichromie sur un papier recyclé à fort grammage.
Chacune des images est une pièce de puzzle que le collectionneur peut combiner librement pour composer selon son humeur et son mur intérieur.
Le mode de tirage en grande série permet de multiplier le nombre de combinaisons possibles. Le collectionneur est invité à exprimer sa propre sensibilité, tant dans le choix des tirages, leur répétition ou encore l'ordre de leur présentation.

Allée Delos - Montpellier - France - Collection 2012

Boulevard de la Victoire - Strasbourg - France - Collection 2012

Plan Cabane - Montpellier - France - Collection 2013

Projet E.A.I. - Montpellier -France - Collection 2013

Rue de l'économie - Marolles - Bruxelles - Collection 2014

Carrer Nous Sant Francesc - Barcelona - Espagne

Comment les images sont-elles sélectionnées ?

Nous avons la volonté d'inspirer la créativité et d'inviter le public à s'approprier nos oeuvres. Pour cela, nous souhaitons inviter tous ceux qui le souhaitent à participer à la sélection des images :

  • 5 images choisies par la participation du public ; nous imprimerons les images du site cssJPG.org les plus diffuser sur les réseaux sociaux (avec le Hashtag #SÉRIE12), les mieux notées (Les étoiles sur le navigateur d'images du site)  et les plus commentées (La bulle sur le navigateur d'image du site). Le jeu prend fin le 15 Avril et les résultats seront diffusées la semaine suivante. 10 personnes seront sélectionnées aléatoirement et recevront l'image de leur choix parmi les #SÉRIE12
  • 5 images de la collection en cours choisis par le collectif,
  • 2 images choisies par 2 collectionneurs privilégiés.

Rua do Bonjardim - Porto - Portugual - Collection 2013

A quoi servira la collecte ?

Une accumulation de petites choses peut avoir de grands effets : quel qu'elle soit, votre contribution est énorme pour le projet cssJPG.

Grâce à vous, nous souhaitons éditer la #SÉRIE12 : des tirages limitées auquel chacun peut facilement accéder.

Les fonds récoltées serviront entièrement à financer les coûts de fabrication et l’achats de matières premières. Si nous dépassons les objectifs, nous pourrons développer d'autres projets : amélioration du site web (pour le rendre réellement participatif, y intégrer un outil de reconnaissance de plantes et de composition numérique...), fresques urbaines, expositions... Nous débordons déjà d'idées!

Dans le cas ou nous n'attendrions pas la totalité des objectifs fixées, nous éditerons uniquement le nombres d'images possible (1, 2 ... 10, 12). En commençant par celles choisies par la participation du public (c'est à vous de jouer).

Donnez-nous les moyens de développer ce projet ; nous avons besoin de vous pour poursuivre cette aventure!


Une dernière chose : faite tourner l'info !

Que vous puissiez ou non contribuer financièrement à ce projet, nous vous serions infiniment reconnaissant d'en faire la pub.

Pour cela, vous pouvez par exemple :

  • Utiliser les outils de partage Indiegogo,
  • Mettre un lien vers cette page ou vers le site cssJPG.org dans le statut de vos réseaux sociaux,
  • Passer le mot à tous ceux que vous connaissez ou rencontrez,
  • Faire de la publicité autour du projet dans la presse, la radio, la télévision...(Si vous êtes journaliste ou que vous en connaissez, c'est le moment d'activer le réseaux),
  • Participer à la sélection des images en les partageants sur les réseaux sociaux
  • ...

story:
Hidden Heroes

This coming November it will be two years since I was on a hilltop in the north of Jordan saying goodbye to five Syrian engineers as they returned home as part of a humanitarian assistance project trying to restore basic services to communities ravaged by years of constant warfare. Each of them was leaving behind the safe haven of a refugee camp to take up the cause of helping those in more dire circumstances. As we stood on that cold hilltop in the middle of the night I watched the horizon bloom with the light from artillery attacks accompanied by an almost constant rumbling sound as rounds impacted in civilian communities and military camps alike. I wondered if any of these brave and caring men had ever imagined they would find themselves in this situation. I don't know the answer but I do know that like many, they answered the call when it mattered most. 

As an international aid worker I've had a rare privilege of seeing up close the passion and commitment of scores of aid workers who dedicate themselves to helping others. They are mostly unseen but universally dedicated, knowledgeable and caring. Despite diverse backgrounds, political and religious views and countries of origin, they come together to serve others in desperate need of help. They are the nameless people behind the headlines. They face deprivation, personal danger, separation from loved ones and professional insecurity - all as part of their normal working conditions. You might ask why they do this work. The answers are as varied as the people themselves. 

I want to tell their story and I need your help

  • I plan to travel to places most of us would prefer to avoid, including Northern Jordan to visit aid workers assisting the large refugee population, Northern Iraq where aid workers are shipping lifesaving food and medicine across two conflict zones to reach people in Syria. I also plan to travel to Afghanistan, Myanmar (Burma) and Cambodia where aid workers are helping in numerous ways to help people achieve self-sufficiency.
  • Along the way I'll record the stories of both local and international aid workers along with photographs of them at work and in leisure moments.
  • As a U.S. citizen temporarily living in Qatar, my travel costs are much lower (but still considerable) than they would be if I were based in the United States.

The end product will be a beautifully printed and bound photo book celebrating these extraordinary individuals. While it's only possible to meet a few people, I hope this book will convey meaning for all aid workers wherever they may be. I hope to make the books available to you, the contributor, but also to aid workers themselves and to the great organizations they represent. 

This is Where You Can Help

  • To cover travel and publishing costs I need $25, 900. 
  • I will provide the camera and computer equipment. 
  • As I mentioned I am employed aid worker so I don't need to cover normal living expenses. 
  • Some of the places I plan to visit are not completely safe. Don't worry - I've been doing this for a while and know how to control most of the risks. I'll ask for help from various humanitarian organizations along the way to make sure I don't end up in the wrong place at the wrong time.
  • The one extravagance I'll ask you help fund is a dedicated car and driver at each stop. It is much safer to use a dedicated driver recommended by someone I trust than using public transportation. In many of the locations I'll visit public transportation is not even available. This will go a long way toward staying safe.

It's possible we won't raise enough money to make the book feasible. Hopefully this won’t happen, but if it does all contributions will be donated to various relief funds supporting critical work around the world. The same applies if we recieve more funding than we need - everything we don't use will go to great charities.

This book won't change the world

But it will help all of us celebrate these quiet heros. 

  • I believe that when we know more about the people doing this work it  inspires us to get involved. Maybe someone will see the book and choose to join the Red Cross, collect gently used clothes to send to people in need or help in a million other ways.
  • For me personally, this is an opportunity to return to some of the places I've been (and some new ones) and to express myself through photography - my other passion.
  • There will never be a sitcom or reality series about these people, but in this small way we can shine the light on them, even if only for a moment.

It's not all about me...

But you might want to know a little bit more anyway

  • I'm a former military officer. As a pilot I saw the world from a distance that offered wide vistas but little opportunity to understand how conflict and poverty affect people in their daily lives. After leaving the armed forces I wanted to find a way to satisfy my yen for adventure but in a way that served a larger purpose. International assistance and development provided that opportunity - kind of. 
  • The nature of my work keeps me in the office, whether it's in Washington D.C., Sana’a Yemen or a hilltop on the Border between Jordan and Syria. I am not a field worker so I don't fall into the category of people who are the subject of this book. 
  • I've spent a large part of my adult life living and working in challenging places. 
  • I'm an avid photographer and I've invested a lot of my savings in camera equipment. I really want the put this equipment to a good use.  

Not everyone who reads this will want to contribute

And that's okay. You can help in other ways.

  • Recommend this project to someone you know who might want to support the effort.
  • When you next think about our courageous and dedicated armed forces, take a moment to also think about all of the aid workers around the world. If you're like me, you'll appreciate the vital contribution and sacrifice willingly offered by both. If you do, you might be inspired to get involved the next time you hear a news story about human suffering.

     of. 
The nature of my work keeps me
     in the office, whether it's in Washington D.C., Sana’a Yemen or a hilltop
     on the Border between Jordan and Syria. I am not a field worker so I don't
     fall into the category of people who are the subject of this book. 
I've spent a large part of my
     adult life living and working in challenging places. 
I'm an avid photographer and
     I've invested a lot of my savings in camera equipment. I really want the
     put this equipment to a good use.  

Not everyone who reads this will want to
contribute
And that's okay. You can help in other ways.

Recommend this project to
     someone you know who might want to support the effort.
When you next think about our
     courageous and dedicated armed forces, take a moment to also think about
     all of the aid workers around the world. If you're like me, you'll appreciate
     the vital contribution and sacrifice willingly offered by both. If you do,
     you might be inspired to get involved the next time you hear a news story
     about human suffering.

story:
Hi there! My name is Ariana. I am a community organizer and (aspiring) artist currently developing this project, photovoice. By using photography and captions, people participating in a photovoice are able to portray their community through words and images. I am well on my way to doing this project with the Warsaw Jewish community.

What is the purpose of this project?

This project aims to  (1) empower members of the Jewish community through self- expression and (2) educate people outside of the Jewish community of Warsaw who wish to learn about it on its own terms. My hope is that through doing this project, the participants will gain greater self-knowledge and in doing so improve their quality of life. Additionally, because this project is one that empowers communities to represent themselves, the photos produced during the photovoice will be used to help individuals outside the Jewish community gain a better understanding of Warsaw Jews’ lived experiences. The photos will be exhibited in a gallery and later used as educational materials on contemporary Jewish Polish identity at POLIN Museum for the History of Polish Jews.

Wow! I really want to help! What can I do?!

In order to do this community arts project that is so dear to my heart, I need your help in the most basic step – getting myself to Warsaw. Your donations will cover my 12-hour trip across the world to my favorite city. I am under some time pressure to buy the ticket, as I want to be back in October to begin the joy that is learning Polish, perhaps the hardest language known to the human race… If I do not reach my goal of $1500, then you will know that you helped me make this plane ticket just a little less damaging to my bank account, but it will still go towards my ticket.

If you are not able to contribute to this campaign financially, but are sympathetic to artists in the early stages of their careers, please post to whatever social media you can. If you can help financially, I will be forever grateful as you will be -- even if in the smallest of ways -- helping me jumpstart the kind of career in art that I want to have -- one that binds people ever closer together through building empathy between them.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Spencer Rogers. I am an abstract artist living in Chicago. I have spent many years making art that I love and developing a new concept of art that I call Modern Abstractions. (Will touch more on that later.) I went to art school in Florence, Italy and I have honed in my craft and ready to move it into the next stage.

What I Am Doing:

I am launching this Indiegogo campaign to raise funds to set up the S.Rog Gallery —an independent art gallery.  I have a huge collection ready to show and the space to show it but in order to open my work space into a working gallery I need some extra help. My family has patiently waited for my last two series to be completed and my wife with a degree from Art Center College of Design is ready to help me get my work out there. We have had members from Columbia College and Art Institute of Chicago come and see the finished work and after hearing their advice to open this space into it's own art gallery we were sold. We put all we had into it and had one angel donor to get the walls and lighting done but we are still short.


What We Need & What You Get

I still  need to raise $20,000 to purchase the rest of the supplies, and materials needed to set up a fully functioning art gallery. The money will go towards permits, banner for front of building, work station for intern and office manager, phone/security, framing of some of the original pieces, and samples of Modern Abstractions printed and mounted.

If I do not reach the goal, I will work with what is raised, and fund the remaining needs as I go--after the gallery is up and running. I plan to have the gallery set up and ready to go by June of this year.

What You Get:

Note cards with envelopes. Message card from Spencer


PRINTS! and ORIGINAL ART!

You will have your choice of a selection of metallic prints or images printed on metal from my modern abstraction line. 


The Modern Abstraction line: I combine my large format abstract painting with macro photography in order to create a series entitled "Modern Abstractions". The resulting images focus on some of the finest details found within the abstract paintings that are worth spotlighting, and will be available in a variety of sizes either on face mounted acrylic or printed on metal. Only 100 limited editions of each image will be sold.


PLUS original paintings on wood!! 7 original oil on wood paintings, ranging in sizes 23x42-32x44  Here are the ones available now.


PLUS XL original paintings on wood!! We will sell 8 ranging in sizes 36x45-40x60  Here are the ones available.






NEW JUST ADDED!  XL square original paintings: Oil on wood 48x48. Choose from 2 paintings. Will come framed and ready to hang.

JUST ADDED:
We have FIVE 5x7 Oil on wood that will be framed in your choice of black or brown frame.  Each $600 , if you buy all 5 it's $2,000



We have FIVE 8x10 Oil on canvas that will be framed in your choice of black or brown frame.  Each $700 , if you buy all 5 it's $2,375



(certificate of authenticity included with all paintings and Mods printed on Metal)


Other Ways You Can Help

Of course, I realize that not everybody has a lot of disposable income in these tough economic times, but every contribution helps, even a small one.

And you can help out in other ways too. 

  • Share this campaign on your social media networks.
  • Email 10 of your friends about the project, and encourage them to contribute.

 Sincerely,

Spencer Rogers and the S.Rog Gallery

story:
Do you ever happen to see a statue, and try to imagine it as something alive? 

Do you ever wonder what is behind that heavy layer of marble?

The marble surface is cold to the touch, but also smooth with a perfect shine. It is that inhuman skin that preserves the secrets of those classical masterpieces by Michelangelo, Canova, and Bernini. They were created to tell us of the heroes and myths of old, the tales of the gods. Is it any wonder that they chose marble for this?

But then what if those heroes, frozen in marble, were also given a soul?

Intra Marmore is an artistic project that aims to give soul to those sculptures lost in time, trying to not just look at the surface, but discover what is hidden beneath.

“Inside the marble” is a metaphor, a search for depth.

Because human beings, just as those classical sculptures, often raise walls of defense to protect themselves, walls of solid marble in order not to let people scratch our souls. Sometimes we turn into beautiful statues and we bury our feelings where no one can find or hurt them, beneath a cold and frozen exterior. We show ourselves as hard as marble, strong as Michelangelo’s David, hiding our insecurities because we are afraid that someone could take possession of our soul and steal it away.

That is the way I look at those classical sculptures, as human beings trapped in a cold and static body, immortals, with an empty stare that looks towards the horizon.  But if it is true that the eyes are the mirror to the soul, then this is what I want to give them: a soul, as if this mission was about myself, about each of us.

Intra Marmore is an artistic project initially born as personal research to give a message to the people who observe it. It is a hidden and encrypted message that only the people who can actually observe can understand. We should always truly look at the world around us, to see things that people usually miss, beneath the skin and beyond prejudice and appearance.


Hello! 

My name is Alessandra Pagliuca; I am a 27 year old artist and I live and work in Italy, in the province of Turin.   My work is mainly based on oil painting; I have a collection of personal paintings that I exhibit around the world and often I work on commissioned portraits. I have a small art studio in the north of Italy, and I spend my days painting surrounded by oil colours and turpentine. It is not an easy life, but is better than I could ever have desired :)


I chose to examine five classical statues; the collection will include five artworks painted in black and white with details in color to show the marble transformation into a living and organic material. I will add to all the statue the eyes, and in some circumstances I will paint with colors the contact points as well.

These are the works I chose to examine:

1. Apollo and Daphne (Bernini)

2. The three Graces (Canova)

3. Adonis and Venus (Canova)

4. Cupid and Psyche (Canova) 

5. David (Michelangelo)

The second phase of the project consists of the creation of paper sketches; which permits a far more detailed study. The sketches were realised in black and white, with details in colour as to create a guide line to realise afterwardsthe entire series painted on oil. (Cupid and Psyche is still a work in progress sketch)

The last, and final phase of the project is this: the sketches will become hyperrealistic paintings on medium-sized canvas. These will become an integral part of my portfolio, that will be exhibited across the world. 


What I am asking for, is your help to complete my project.  Intra Marmore requires time, materials and dedication. Without your help, it will not be possible to complete it.  The main objective of the campaign is to raise enough funds to create and distribute the series. In addition to oil paintings, postcards and high-definition posters will be created as well so as to spread the message. The benefactors that will believe in this project and will help complete it will directly be inserted as part of it; therefore, their names will appear in my website and publications.

We are asking for $5000 in order to cover all the costs of this idea.  

Here's a breakdown:

·  Fees from IndieGogo (9% if we don't meet our goal, 4% if we do), Paypal (3%) and Credit Cards (3%) 

·  Cost of fulfilling perks (prints, stickers, shipping, packaging, etc. costs are a large portion of the amount we are asking)

·  The costs of the materials that will be used, which will be canvas, colours, paint brushes, thinners, paper material and also the time that the realisation of this collection requires.


Every person that makes the decision to contribute to this project will be featured on my official website and expressly mentioned regarding the creation of this collection. In addition to this, varying according to donation size, you will be able to receive your own piece of the collection.

I have tried to offer a wide variety of incentives, to suit all tastes; whether it is something small and simple you are after, or much larger and perhaps even totally exclusive.

All the perks include the dispatch in every part of the world :)


Set of two indoor round stickers with printed sketches – 5 cm diameter


                               

SET 1 - INTRA MARMORE Postcard Pack
4"x6" (10x15cm) glossy postcards of the four sketches --  All postcards  are 4"x6" with about a 1/8" white border.


SET 2 - BLACK AND RED ILLUSTRATIONS Postcard Pack

4"x6" (10x15cm) glossy postcards of some of my personal drawings --  All postcards  are 4"x6" with about a 1/8" white border.



SET 3 - WATERCOLORS Postcard Pack - A4 format (21x30cm) glossy postcards of some of my personal watercolor drawings 


Choosing Postcard Sets:  You can either email me (info@alessandrapagliuca.com) with which postcard set you would like, message me on here, or wait for me to contact you after the campaign is over! 


CHOICE 1 - the official catalogue of the series, hard cover and signed with the description of each work, the benefactors names and a personal thanks

CHOICE 2 - Printed High Definition poster cm 35x50


An original sketch of “Intra Marmore” series (A4 format, 4 pieces available)

Original sketch of Intra Marmore’s series: as there are just four of them available and they are all different, if you decide to buy one of them please write to me in private as soon as you can so that we can stop that sketch’s sale.


A custom individual pencil portrait (A4 format, 10 pieces available)

Custom Portrait specifics:

·   After the campaign is over, I will send out emails and such asking for your photo and name preferences. 

You can choose just one figure; I can draw anybody you desire, your girl/boyfriend, your mum, daughter or son, and your grandparents. I can also draw your pet!

Photo Specifics

·  It is EXTREMELY hard to draw a portrait based on a tiny, dark, or blurry photo. Please try to only send me images that are over 500px wide/tall, clear and with decent lighting. 

·  Please make sure the photo is mostly focused on the face/upper body. I do much better work with faces than I do with full body portraits. :) 

·  The best portraits are based on photos that aren't heavily edited or overexposed.

·  I'd love to have multiple photos that I can use, if you can--just let me know which one you would prefer I base it mostly on.


with one of the original paintings of the series "Intra marmore", scale 1:1

(You will choose the painting that you prefer)

5 pieces available



You'll get an original oil painting on canvas from the “Intra Marmore” series 

(1 piece available). You will choose the one that you prefer :)

Dimensions will be around 100x100 cm and delivery is included in this perk.


For further informations you can mail me: info@alessandrapagliuca.com or visit my official website www.alessandrapagliuca.com ;)


The sketches are ready to be transposed on to canvas. The major risk is the investment  of time in a new project and its spread. No one in the art world has proposed a similar idea yet and I am certain that the galleries and the collectors will recognise it. The problem however, lies in the starting point; in the investment of all those materials, and also in the investment of money to show my collection to the world. Your help will allow me to dedicate myself entirely to it.

No matter what: you will get your perks even if we don't hit our campaign goal (although if we do, it will be a lot easier to fulfill perks). :)

I will keep everyone updated throughout the whole project, every single step of the way.

One thing to bear in mind is that for some of the perks, time will be required. For example, a personalised portrait, or original art work. Following the completion of the campaign, all required printing will take place promptly, and sent out as soon as possible. There are no hidden shipping fees to worry about; these have already been factored in.


If you can't contribute right now, I would really appreciate any and all shares on social media.  Getting the word out about this is half the battle!  I would be so grateful for any help in that regard!  Tell your friends/followers/mom--whoever you feel might be interested in some of the perks, or who would just wanna help out :D

At the top of this page you can find Indiegogo's share tools and use them to share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, etc.!  Here is the link to this campaign if you just want to copy and paste it from here: 

http://igg.me/p/intra-marmore/x/10124689


Thank you!! :)

story:
What is SPOON Magazine?

SPOON™ is a fine-Art and slow fashion photography magazine originally created in 1996, first on the Internet and then printed for the first time the same year. After 7 issues, We left the company when the commercial protocol started to conflict with our creative goals... We recently owned back the SPOON magazine trademark and right away, issue 01 of the new edition was born in early 2014.

SPOON New edition | 03

Help Us to keep this magazine ad-free and really independent


SPOON | 03  will be kept completely ad-free, because we feel this is today the best way to keep our publication independent.

No limitations, No Status Quo ! 

As we give freedom to our contributors, we give you the freedom to reflect and get inspired with no advertising interference.


What We Need & What You Get

We already have the brand new content for SPOON | 03, and we cannot wait to present it to you! To get the magazine launched for end of may 2015, we just need a little bit of help to fund the final phase : the printing and shipping of the magazines.

Ready to roll!

3,500€ is our goal. Every bit of money donated will be going towards the intended cause. Any excess of our goal will go directly into funding our next issue content so that we can raise the production value of our contents and pay for our contributors expenses appropriately. 

Please, check out this fantastic line-up of artists curated from around the world for this issue : Noah Becker, Lars Botten, Marcel Boudan, Thomas Brun, Bruno Fournier, Patrice Fuma Courtis, Peter Christian, Emmanuel Gimeno, Steve Hiett, Hugh Holland, Olga Itygilova, Joe Laï, Andrew Lyman, Jean-François Lepage, Ollie Ma', Stephen Rose,  Alice Schillaci. Or visit our site for previous contents


SPOON in your country, city, galery, shop...

SPOON new edition is not using the common distribution networks. Why?
We are not dispatching the magazine through usual magazines distributor for many reasons, and the main one is that, working with a distributor would force us to print out an outstanding amount of magazines, from which approximatively 60% would surely go to waste. Nowadays that is economically, ecologically a complete nonsense. We refuse to do that!

The one copy we print is the one for you!

We have chosen to print digitally this magazine, that means we print only the number of issues we need to print, that way we are sure there is no waste of printed copies : and no trees are beeing cut  for nothing! Only this technology allows us to continue to publish printed magazines with an ethical behavior.
You can order easily from anywhere in world from our site

Break free from the advertising pollution and feel happier

Because of our ad-free policy we just need copies for our readers, and fans  : no fuss, no fluff, no waste at all! That is part of what we call "slow fashion".
If you wish to distribute SPOON in your country, city, galery, shop...feel free to contact us and we will happily find a solution with you.

Pre-order, funding, deals!

Making a magazine is always for us an act of love and dependance upon of the support of others. Our aim with SPOON magazine is to make something you will want to own and keep, a collector's item you'll cherish.
However, we're not just appealing to your charitable side, but to your self-interest, too. By contributing to this campaign, you're supporting the printing of SPOON by pre-ordering your copy without shipping fees or choosing to do a little, or much more by buying one of the fantastic offers we gathered for this campaign.

Our offers

6 Euros 
Show your love to SPOON!
You will get a public thank you on our facebook page

15 Euros 
pre order SPOON | 03
You'll be one of the first people to hold SPOON in your hands, even before it hits the shelves of the bookstores, shipping costs included.

30 Euros
will get you SPOON | 03 + SPOON | 02
shipping costs included.

50 Euros
will get you  SPOON | 01 +SPOON |02 + SPOON | 03
shipping costs included

70 Euros
will get you 
1 SPOON | 03
+  1 T-Shirt  (shipped separately) shipping costs included


90 Euros
will get you 

1 SPOON | 01 + 1 SPOON |02 + 1 SPOON | 03
+  1 T-Shirt  (shipped separately) shipping costs included


100 Euros
will get you  SPOON | 01 +SPOON |02 + SPOON | 03
+  1  Vintage SPOON VOL 7 - 2000 (shipped separately) shipping costs included


Make sure to check all our other offers

For this issue some of our contributors offer you to acquire at very reasonable prices exclusive prints of their work. don't forget to come back once a while to discover offers that will be updated all along our campaign.


Now treat yourself with a print 

start your own art collection!




Steve Hiett print "Rainbow warrior" 799€

vintage unique work print from an editorial of SPOON VOL 7 - 2000
a signed analog print 30X40 cm on glossy fujiflex color paper. (*) (**)

* : You can either chose to be delivered or, if in Paris, meet  the photographer at his studio. Prints are sold not framed

** :  plus one copy of SPOON | 03

Steve Hiett print "Rainbow warrior/girl in grass" 799€
vintage unique work print from an editorial of SPOON VOL 7 - 2000
a signed analog print 30X40 cm on glossy fujiflex color paper. (*) (**)

* : You can either chose to be delivered or, if in Paris, meet  the photographer at his studio. Prints are sold not framed

** :  plus one copy of SPOON | 03

Thomas Brun print "Try to know no more" 249€

 Print from an editorial of SPOON VOL 2 - 1997
a signed archival print 30X30 cm on glossy  color paper. (*) (**)

* : You can either chose to be delivered or, if in Oslo, meet  the photographer at his studio. Prints are sold not framed

** :  plus one copy of SPOON | 03

Emmanuel Gimeno "Flying hair" diptych 99 - 139€
2 Prints from SPOON New edition | 02 - 2014
Galery print 13X18 cm X 2 -  Framed  or not framed
 3 signed copies available

Bruno Fournier "body & Soul" 149€
Print from SPOON New edition | 02  - 2014
Galery print  30X40 cm (*) (**)

* : You can either chose to be delivered or, if in Paris, meet  the photographer at his studio. Prints are sold not framed

** :  plus one copy of SPOON | 03



Make sure to come back in a few days

More  prints will be available very soon...


Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word about our campaign! The key to the success of this project is in those who are enthusiastic about SPOON. Don't be shy : we are open to any idea you would want to share with us so email us : info@spoon-publishing with any questions or comments or proposals.


We'll make sure we go into production as soon as possible. However, if deadlines are not met, we will still produce the magazine, and some perks will be shipped later than expected.


Again, thank you very much

Karine Chane Yin + Patrice Fuma Courtis
Founders of SPOON™ Magazine
story_txt:
What is SPOON Magazine?

SPOON™ is a fine-Art and slow fashion photography magazine originally created in 1996, first on the Internet and then printed for the first time the same year. After 7 issues, We left the company when the commercial protocol started to conflict with our creative goals... We recently owned back the SPOON magazine trademark and right away, issue 01 of the new edition was born in early 2014.

SPOON New edition | 03
Help Us to keep this magazine ad-free and really independent








SPOON | 03  will be kept completely ad-free, because we feel this is today the best way to keep our publication independent. 

No limitations, No Status Quo !  

As we give freedom to our contributors, we give you the freedom to reflect and get inspired with no advertising interference.




What We Need & What You Get

story:
Short Summary

We are looking to start a business that focuses on strengthening the mind-body-spirit connection through various arts and healing modalities. This seed will require much nurturing and support. Once we obtain the funding, we will be offering classes including various forms of yoga, martial arts, dance, and pilates. Additionally, we will be offering sessions for reiki, massage therapy, life-coaching, and esoteric readings. Our center will be attached to a smoothie bar serving in-season and organic fruits and vegetables as well as a shop and a community garden. You can purchase essential oils, healing crystals, seeds and other merchandise (which will also be available online) in the shop.

We will also have an online presence with blogs posted regularly on topics such as yoga, spiritual insights, positive body image, relationships, astrology, entrepreneurship and more. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our initial goal is to raise $10,000, although that would be a very small portion of the amount we hope to raise before opening up our first location. The funding would be going towards our inventory for the shop and smoothie bar, rent and utilities for the center, paying employees, teachers and masters, starting the website and various functions we would need to perform in order to get started.

As a contributor, there will be several perks available to you. Check out the different rewards we offer to see what you could qualify for!

The Impact

We appreciate any and all donations. If you are unable to donate, you can help us by spreading the word about our cause and sharing our website, or social media accounts. You can use the Indiegogo share tools to share our campaign. Feel free to contact us with any questions.

Risks & Challenges

As this idea needs much nurturing and support, we are prepared to see some challenges in our future. We may have some trouble obtaining the proper funding, and once we do, we may not receive the amount of customers that we hoped for.

Because of these potential challenges, we have decided to first start up our online campaign, blogs, and an online shop to help get the ball rolling. We are prepared to make this dream a reality, no matter how long it takes.

story:
My story

Hello,

my name is Radka. I live in Brno, Czech Republic. My father died in a car accident when I was 2 years old. My mom was critically injured and had to go through many surgeries before she could come home from the hospital. We instantly became a single-parent family. 

About 7 years ago my mother got ill. After a long hospitalization she was diagnosed with periodic depressive disorder and is spending her life in and out of the hospital. Despite various medications and being treated by many different doctors, she isn't doing any better. It has gotten to the point that she has had to be placed in a long-term treatment facility with medical care available 24 hours a day. Everyone who has someone close to suffering from a mental disorder knows how difficult it is to see the beloved person in this condition. My mom doesn't really care about anything. Before she became sick, she loved to paint on silk. Her current condition doesn't allow her to do it alone, so I tried to paint with her and fell in love with it.

Painting makes it possible to awaken her interest in some of her past activities and helps her to express her feelings by talking during the creative process and about the final picture. It also allows us to spend a nice time together while visiting with my husband, who is very supportive and helpful during every step of the way.

The cost of living in my mom's current facility is very high. It includes the doctor costs, social workers' fees, medications, meals, as well as the transportation to and from the hospital if needed. It's very hard to keep up with paying all the bills. 

What I really love to do with your help

  • make my mom feel better as much as I can and one way is doing something that she really loves with her
  • to be able to pay for everything she needs 
  • to do something that makes me feel good and happy
  • make something unique and special for you, people :)

What we need to start

  • $2 600   renting place for painting
  • $    500   silk
  • $    400   colours
  • $ 1 800   wood, framing
  • $    800   furniture ( tables, chairs, lighting, shelves ) 
  • $     100   paintbrushes, rubber gloves, plastic cover for the table, plastic cups


What you get


Impact

We would most sincerely appreciate any amount that you are able to donate towards the cost. Your donation will make possible for us to continue in our effort to keep my mom busy doing something she loves, and giving you a piece of art in return.
Thank you in advance for any help you can give us!

story:
ЦЕЛТА НИ…

„Мулен Руж” е проект, който ще представи на българската публика едно грандиозно представление в жанра мюзикъл. През 2016г. музиката от едноименния филм ще зазвучи под купола на цирк „Балкански” и ще обиколи България,  достигайки публиката на най-големите градове, сред които София, Пловдив, Стара Загора, Варна, Бургас, Русе, Велико Търново и други.

Амбицирани сме да поднесем един нов, иновативен за българската сцена продукт, който ще пренесе зрителя до магията на Бродуей. Мащабите на проекта включват трупа от 70 души, които представят спектакъла в най-голямото пътуващо цирково шапито на Балканския полуостров. Представлението ще бъде изиграно хоризонтално и вертикално и в директен контакт със заобикалящата го публика в стила на американското кабаре. Съставът  на мюзикъла е от участници, подбрани с национален кастинг, на който се явиха стотици талантливи кандидати. Високото качество на отделните елементи на проекта е подсигурено от опитни хореографи, режисьори, сценографи, вокални педагози, оркестър, каскади и професионална звукова и светлинна техника от най-добрите специалисти в страната. Всичко това с крайната цел да създадем културен продукт на световно ниво.

ОТ КАКВО СЕ НУЖДАЕМ…

Бюджетът на проекта е 150 000 лв. След приспадане на очакваните приходи от билети остава нужда от 30 000 лв., за покриване на част от капиталовите разходи: костюми, декори, наеми на зали за репетиции и др.

Обръщаме се към всички любители на изкуството за подкрепа. Ние вярваме, че ще успеем да Ви заразим с неповторимата емоция на жанра мюзикъл и да Ви пренесем в магията на “Мулен Руж”.  

КАК ДА ПОМОГНЕШ…

1.  Musical Enthusiast/Мюзикъл ентусиаст - $10 (~17.50 лв.)

Искаш проекта да се случи, а ние ще се радваме да те забавляваме.

2.  Moulin Rouge Addict/Пристрастен към Мулен Руж - $30 (~52.50 лв.)

Обожаваш мюзикъла и искаш да допринесеш. Оценяваме подкрепата и ще ти подготвим специален плакат подписан от актьорите, както и специална Мулен Руж тениска.

3.  Can’t wait for the Show!/Очаквам с нетърпение! - $30 (~52.50 лв.)

Билет. Подкрепи ни и в замяна ще получиш сигурно място за представление по твой избор.

4.  First to Watch!/Първи на премиера! - $40 (~70.00 лв.)

Билет за премиерата. Подкрепи ни и в замяна ще получиш сигурно място за премиерата ни през април 2016 г. в гр. София.

5.  VIP Ticket/ВИП билет - $50 (~87.50 лв.)

Ще получиш сигурно ВИП място за представление по твой избор, както и алкохолна напитка за пълна наслада по време на шоуто.

6.  Red Carpet!/Червен килим! - $75 (~131.25 лв.)

ВИП билет за премиерата! Ще получиш сигурно ВИП място за премиерата ни през април 2016 г., както и алкохолна напитка за пълна наслада по време на шоуто. Усмихни се на екипа и ще получиш специален плакат, подписан от Сатин.

7.  I Reside in the Cabaret!/Живея в кабаре! - $100 (~175.00 лв.)

Достъп зад кулисите. Ще получиш сигурно ВИП място за представление по твой избор, както и алкохолна напитка за пълна наслада по време на шоуто. Пакета включва и ексклузивен достъп зад кулисите, където ще можеш да се запознаеш с актьорите.

8.  Spectacular, Spectacular!/Грандиозно изживяване! - $150 (~262.50 лв.)

Достъп зад кулисите и афтърпарти. Ще получиш сигурно ВИП място за представление по твой избор, както и алкохолна напитка за пълна наслада по време на шоуто. Пакета включва и ексклузивен достъп зад кулисите и покана за афтърпарти, където ще можеш да се запознаеш с актьорите.

9.  The Duke!/Херцогът! $200 (~350.00 лв.)

Ол инклузив билет. Ще имаш достъп до всички привилегии…..и повече!

КОИ СМЕ НИЕ…

Главните организатори на проекта са бивши възпитаници на Американския университет в България (АУБ), участвали активно в поставянето на мюзикъли от 2008г. насам. През 2010 година мюзикълът на АУБ  „Лак за Коса“ (Hairspray) се превърна в първия мащабен студентски спетакъл, който обиколи България и въодушеви публиката. През следващата 2011-та, на сцена беше представен „Мулен Руж“, който посети шест от най-големите градове в страната. Представлението получи многобройни комплименти и адмирации не само от многохилядната публика, но и от представители на артистичната гилдия и медиите. Сега, 5 години по-късно, сме готови да разгърнем целия потенциал на проекта и да Ви пренесем отново в магията на Мулен Руж - по мащабен, по-вълнуващ и по-завладяващ от всякога. 

OUR GOAL…

“Moulin Rouge” is a spectacular musical performance that will be presented to the Bulgarian audience in 2016. The stage version of the popular movie will come to life in Circus “Balkanski” and will tour Bulgaria reaching the spectators in all major cities including Sofia, Plovdiv, Varna, Bourgas, Rouse, Veliko Tarnovo, and more.

We are determined to present a new and innovative product for the Bulgarian artistic environment by providing a true Broadway-like experience. The project features a cast of 70 people who will perform in the biggest travelling circus on the Balkans. The show will be presented in the style of the American cabaret and performed in direct contact with the audience. The cast members are selected through a nation-wide audition, which attracted hundreds of talented candidates. Experienced choreographers, directors, set designers, vocal directors, orchestra and stunts, as well as professional sound and light equipment, will all contribute to the high quality of the project. Our ultimate goal is to create an outstanding cultural product.

WHAT WE NEED…

The project’s budget is 150 000 BGN (~ $86 000). After deducting the estimated ticket sales revenue, the show requires additional 30 000 BGN (~ $17 200) to cover part of the capital cost, i.e. costumes, set, rehearsal halls rental, etc.

We turn to all art lovers for support. We are determined to provide you with a unique musical experience by introducing you to the magic of the “Moulin Rouge”!

HOW YOU CAN HELP…

Support our project and we will return the favor by providing you with exclusive perks:

1. Musical Enthusiast - $10 (~17.50 BGN)

You would love to see the project happen and we would love to entertain you!

2. Moulin Rouge Addict - $30 (~52.50 BGN)

You love the musical and are willing to contribute. We appreciate it and in exchange will prepare for you a poster of the musical signed by the cast members and a special branded T-shirt.

3. Can’t wait for the Show - $30 (~52.50 BGN)

Ticket. Contribute and grant yourself a reserved seating for a performance of your choice.

4. First to Watch - $40 (~70.00 BGN)

Ticket for the premiere. Contribute and grant yourself a reserved seating for the very premiere in April 2016 in Sofia.

5. VIP Ticket - $50 (~87.50 BGN)

You will have a guaranteed VIP reserved seating for a performance of your choice. It also includes an alcoholic beverage.

6. Red Carpet! - $75 (~131.25 BGN)

VIP ticket for the premiere! You will have a guaranteed VIP reserved seating for the premiere in the Spring of 2016 in Sofia and an alcoholic beverage will await you in your VIP box. If you smile at the crew, you also get a poster signed by Satine!

7. I Reside in the Cabaret! - $100 (~175.00 BGN)

Backstage pass. You will have a guaranteed VIP reserved seating for a performance of your choice. It also includes an alcoholic beverage and a backstage pass where you can meet the cast and crew.

8. Spectacular, Spectacular!- $150 (~262.50 BGN)

Backstage pass & afterparty. You will have a guaranteed VIP reserved seating for a performance of your choice. It also includes an alcoholic beverage, a backstage pass and an invitation for the afterparty, where you can meet the cast and crew.

9.The Duke! - $200 (~350.00 BGN)

All Inclusive pass. You own the place! And will have the right to all privileges listed above. And more.

WHO WE ARE…

The main organizers of the project are alumni of the American University in Bulgaria (AUBG) who have been active participants in the staging of musicals since 2008. In 2010, the AUBG musical “Hairspray” became the first large-scale student production to tour Bulgaria and excite the audience. In 2011, a new production “Moulin Rouge” visited six of the largest cities in the country. The show received numerous compliments and admirations not only from the thousands of spectators, but also from representatives of the artistic circles and the media. Now, 5 years later, we are ready to realize the full potential of the project and to once again make you a part of the magic that is Moulin Rouge – more spectacular, more exciting and more compelling than ever!
story_txt:
ЦЕЛТА НИ…
„Мулен
Руж” е проект, който ще представи на българската публика едно грандиозно
представление в жанра мюзикъл. През 2016г. музиката от едноименния филм ще
зазвучи под купола на цирк „Балкански” и ще обиколи България,  достигайки
публиката на най-големите градове, сред които София, Пловдив, Стара Загора,
Варна, Бургас, Русе, Велико Търново и други.
Амбицирани сме да поднесем един нов, иновативен за българската
сцена продукт, който ще пренесе зрителя до магията на Бродуей. Мащабите на
проекта включват трупа от 70 души, които представят спектакъла в най-голямото
пътуващо цирково шапито на Балканския полуостров. Представлението ще бъде
изиграно хоризонтално и вертикално и в директен контакт със заобикалящата го
публика в стила на американското кабаре. Съставът  на мюзикъла е от
участници, подбрани с национален кастинг, на който се явиха стотици талантливи
кандидати. Високото качество на отделните елементи на проекта е подсигурено от
опитни хореографи, режисьори, сценографи, вокални педагози, оркестър, каскади и
професионална звукова и светлинна техника от най-добрите специалисти в
страната. Всичко това с крайната цел да създадем културен продукт на световно
ниво.
ОТ
КАКВО СЕ НУЖДАЕМ… 
Бюджетът на проекта е 150 000 лв. След приспадане на очакваните
приходи от билети остава нужда от 30 000 лв., за покриване на част от
капиталовите разходи: костюми, декори, наеми на зали за репетиции и др. 
Обръщаме се към всички любители на изкуството за подкрепа. Ние вярваме,
че ще успеем да Ви заразим с неповторимата емоция на жанра мюзикъл и да Ви
пренесем в магията на “Мулен Руж”.  
КАК
ДА ПОМОГНЕШ… 

1. 
Musical Enthusiast/Мюзикъл ентусиаст - $10
(~17.50 лв.)
Искаш
проекта да се случи, а ние ще се радваме да те забавляваме.
2. 
Moulin Rouge Addict/Пристрастен към Мулен Руж -
$30 (~52.50 лв.)
Обожаваш
мюзикъла и искаш да допринесеш. Оценяваме подкрепата и ще ти подготвим
специален плакат подписан от актьорите, както и специална Мулен Руж тениска.
3. 
Can’t wait for the Show!/Очаквам с нетърпение! -
$30 (~52.50 лв.)
Билет.
Подкрепи ни и в замяна ще получиш сигурно място за представление по твой избор.

4. 
First to Watch!/Първи на премиера! - $40 (~70.00
лв.)
Билет
за премиерата. Подкрепи ни и в замяна ще получиш сигурно място за премиерата ни
през април 2016 г. в гр. София. 
5. 
VIP Ticket/ВИП билет - $50 (~87.50 лв.)
Ще
получиш сигурно ВИП място за представление по твой избор, както и алкохолна
напитка за пълна наслада по време на шоуто.
6. 
Red Carpet!/Червен килим! - $75 (~131.25 лв.)
ВИП
билет за премиерата! Ще получиш сигурно ВИП място за премиерата ни през април
2016 г., както и алкохолна напитка за пълна наслада по време на шоуто. Усмихни
се на екипа и ще получиш специален плакат, подписан от Сатин.
7. 
I Reside in the Cabaret!/Живея в кабаре! - $100
(~175.00 лв.)
Достъп
зад кулисите. Ще получиш сигурно ВИП място за представление по твой избор,
както и алкохолна напитка за пълна наслада по време на шоуто. Пакета включва и
ексклузивен достъп зад кулисите, където ще можеш да се запознаеш с актьорите.
8. 
Spectacular, Spectacular!/Грандиозно изживяване!
- $150 (~262.50 лв.)
Достъп
зад кулисите и афтърпарти. Ще получиш сигурно ВИП място за представление по
твой избор, както и алкохолна напитка за пълна наслада по време на шоуто.
Пакета включва и ексклузивен достъп зад кулисите и покана за афтърпарти, където
ще можеш да се запознаеш с актьорите.
9. 
The Duke!/Херцогът! $200 (~350.00 лв.)
Ол
инклузив билет. Ще имаш достъп до всички привилегии…..и повече!
КОИ СМЕ
НИЕ… 
Главните организатори на проекта са бивши възпитаници на
Американския университет в България (АУБ), участвали активно в поставянето на
мюзикъли от 2008г. насам. През 2010 година мюзикълът на АУБ  „Лак за Коса“
(Hairspray) се превърна в първия мащабен студентски спетакъл, който обиколи
България и въодушеви публиката. През следващата 2011-та, на сцена беше представен
„Мулен Руж“, който посети шест от най-големите градове в страната.
Представлението получи многобройни комплименти и адмирации не само от
многохилядната публика, но и от представители на артистичната гилдия и медиите.
Сега, 5 години по-късно, сме готови да разгърнем целия потенциал на проекта и
да Ви пренесем отново в магията на Мулен Руж - по мащабен, по-вълнуващ и
по-завладяващ от всякога. 
OUR GOAL…
“Moulin Rouge”
is a spectacular musical performance that will be presented to the Bulgarian
audience in 2016. The stage version of the popular movie will come to life in
Circus “Balkanski” and will tour Bulgaria reaching the spectators in all major
cities including Sofia, Plovdiv, Varna, Bourgas, Rouse, Veliko Tarnovo, and
more. 
We are
determined to present a new and innovative product for the Bulgarian artistic
environment by providing a true Broadway-like experience. The project features
a cast of 70 people who will perform in the biggest travelling circus on the
Balkans. The show will be presented in the style of the American cabaret and
performed in direct contact with the audience. The cast members are selected through
a nation-wide audition, which attracted hundreds of talented candidates. Experienced
choreographers, directors, set designers, vocal directors, orchestra and
stunts, as well as professional sound and light equipment, will all contribute
to the high quality of the project. Our ultimate goal is to create an
outstanding cultural product. 

WHAT WE NEED…
The
project’s budget is 150 000 BGN (~ $86 000). After deducting the
estimated ticket sales revenue, the show requires additional 30 000 BGN (~
$17 200) to cover part of the capital cost, i.e. costumes, set, rehearsal halls
rental, etc.
We turn to all
art lovers for support. We are determined to provide you with a unique musical
experience by introducing you to the magic of the “Moulin Rouge”! 

HOW YOU CAN HELP…
Support our
project and we will return the favor by providing you with exclusive perks:
1. Musical Enthusiast - $10 (~17.50 BGN)
You would love to see the project happen
and we would love to entertain you!
2. Moulin Rouge Addict - $30
(~52.50 BGN)
You
love the musical and are willing to contribute. We appreciate it and in
exchange will prepare for you a poster of the musical signed by the cast
members and a special branded T-shirt.
3. Can’t wait for the Show - $30
(~52.50 BGN)
Ticket.
Contribute and grant yourself a reserved seating for a performance of your
choice.
4. First to Watch - $40 (~70.00 BGN)Ticket for the premiere. Contribute and grant
yourself a reserved seating for the very premiere in April 2016 in Sofia.
5. VIP Ticket - $50 (~87.50 BGN)You will have a guaranteed VIP reserved
seating for a performance of your choice. It also includes an alcoholic
beverage.
6. Red Carpet! - $75 (~131.25 BGN)VIP ticket for the premiere! You will
have a guaranteed VIP reserved seating for the premiere in the Spring of 2016 in Sofia and an alcoholic beverage will
await you in your VIP box. If you smile at the crew, you also get a poster
signed by Satine!
7. I Reside in the Cabaret! - $100 (~175.00 BGN)Backstage pass. You will have a
guaranteed VIP reserved seating for a performance of your choice. It also
includes an alcoholic beverage and a backstage pass where you can meet the cast
and crew.
8. Spectacular, Spectacular!- $150 (~262.50 BGN)Backstage pass & afterparty. You
will have a guaranteed VIP reserved seating for a performance of your choice.
It also includes an alcoholic beverage, a backstage pass and an invitation for
the afterparty, where you can meet the cast and crew.
9.The Duke! - $200 (~350.00 BGN)All Inclusive pass. You own the place!
And will have the right to all privileges listed above. And more.

WHO WE ARE…
The main
organizers of the project are alumni of the American University in Bulgaria (AUBG)
who have been active participants in the staging of musicals since 2008. In
2010, the AUBG musical “Hairspray” became the first large-scale student
production to tour Bulgaria and excite the audience. In 2011, a new production “Moulin
Rouge” visited six of the largest cities in the country. The show received
numerous compliments and admirations not only from the thousands of spectators,
but also from representatives of the artistic circles and the media. Now, 5
years later, we are ready to realize the full potential of the project and to once
again make you a part of the magic that is Moulin Rouge – more spectacular,
more exciting and more compelling than ever!

story:
What's Halloweezy?


From a young age, Halloween held a special place in the hearts of Halloweezy creators Adam and Julie. To them, the holiday meant much more than free candy, store bought costumes, and classroom parties.

Halloween was about being your true self, expressing your inner creativity, and spending time with beloved family and friends.

As the years passed, they became increasingly involved in embracing the holiday. From the age of 12, Adam was building elaborate props to decorate his front lawn with scenes of horror. Julie was scouring thrift stores with her parents to create a one-of-a-kind ensemble and win the elementary school costume contest year after year.

During their adolescent years, watching movies about Halloween was one of Adam and Julie’s favorite pastimes. Their excitement would rise especially for a climax involving a grand ball. They watched these moments play out on screen with envy; they wanted to host the grandest ball yet. And so the seed was planted.  

Six years ago they finally decided on a whim to throw their first Halloween party. From the beginning they were devoted to creating a memorable experience for guests. As a young professional just starting out, and a college student in her second year, they spent countless hours and used every resource they had. In the name of Halloweezy, no sacrifice was too great.



With each passing year, a different aspect of Halloween is spotlighted. One year, they explored the Cleveland torso murders. Another year the event focused on the underground circus, complete with an alley of carnival games and a group of "freaks" for a live freak show. Last year, they turned an old bread factory into an asylum, with a talent show of deranged patients and decor that made several guests reluctantly ask, “is this really an abandoned asylum?”

This year, they are hosting the most unforgettable Halloweezy yet.

Officially announcing the theme for this year’s festivities:

Halloweezy: No Where.

Halloweezy: No Where will bring you to the backwoods of America, untouched by modernity. The type of place where night falls heavy causing you to desperately seek a way out. You think the surroundings are familiar but the darkness brings about new sight. There is seemingly no way out; your imagination runs while your feet plants roots. Nowhere is the place where the trees tower and fold over you, engulfing you into their void.

The desire of the creators is to continue this exciting event for years to come. Their hope is to create a community united by the traditions of all things magical and spooky. But for everyone, including Halloweezy’s creators, life continues outside of this holiday.

Adam and Julie’s jobs require attention and their personal lives are privy to some of that too. That's where you come in to this story. In order to keep making Halloweezy the best that it can be, building it bigger and better with each year, they graciously ask for you to show your support in this project, entering into its sixth year.


What We Need & What You Get



Last year they had incredible vision. They were able to accomplish so much with their own limited resources and network of support. Imagine what they can achieve with the support of all of you.

The start-up cost for a business is beyond their means. With your donations, you will be helping Halloweezy launch much quicker.

Start up costs include:

  • Registering as an LLC
  • Office materials
  • Marketing materials and resources
  • Venue Rental
  • Prop Design
  • Hiring local entertainment/artists

This year they plan to expand from their traditional live entertainment and great special effects to also include an oddity bazaar.


The Impact

This year, Adam and Julie hope to provide Cleveland with Halloweezy open to the public. Together, we can share in the traditions of Halloween and bring people to this great city.

With your help, they can provide an avenue for local artists to showcase a side of art that is very nontraditional and often under appreciated. They have hired many talented Cleveland artists including fire breathers, comedians, burlesque dancers, musicians, and sideshow performers. As long as the resources are available, they will continue to invest money into the vibrant community of art in Cleveland.


More Ways to Help


If you aren't able to donate today, please consider donating your time and resources.


Halloweezy is in need of great local artists and performers. There is also a need for committed volunteers for set up, tear down, prop building and design, and any other odd jobs as they become available. Donations of materials are always welcome. They use virtually everything to build sets, so reach out if you have items that may be of use.

Connect

Website: http://halloweezy.com/

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Halloweezy216

Twitter: https://twitter.com/halloweezyy
