story:
Aloha Doc - Prescriptions for a Surf Lifestyle

History

“Doc” Paskowitz was a true legend in the surfing community.  As chronicled in the hit movie Surfwise, Doc and his wife Juliette raised their 9 kids on an endless surf trip in a 24-foot camper van.  Doc spent his life promoting a health and surf-centric lifestyle, not just in his well-reviewed book called Surfing ad Health, but in the way he lived his life and raised his family.

When Doc passed away in November at the age of 93, he was one of the last of the original surfers from the age of Duke Kahanamoku, who brought surfing to mainland America in 1912.  Doc famously ditched his career as a Stanford-educated physician to live a lifestyle of surf and travel, thus creating the vagabond culture that is so pervasive in today’s surf world. 

Legacy

One of Doc’s last wishes was for the creation of a place where this legacy could be on display for future generations of surfers.  A place where the past and the future of surfing could come together to “talk story”, and learn of the virtues of surfing and health that Doc extolled throughout his life. 

Doc’s youngest son Joshua Ben is dedicated to fulfilling his father’s wish.  And by participating in this campaign you can be a part of it. 

Josh, with the help of his family, friends and you, is opening a surf art and lifestyle gallery called Aloha Doc – Prescriptions for a Surf Lifestyle.  When you live the Spirit of Aloha, you create positive feelings and thoughts, which are never gone. They exist in space, multiply and spread over to others.  Doc lived with the spirit of Aloha as much as anyone, and he always signed his name “Aloha, Doc”.  We can’t think of a better tribute to an amazing person than to name the gallery after this term of endearment. 

Joshua Ben Paskowitz has been drawing larger than life figures since he was a young boy in the back of the family camper.  He’s now taken to creating impressionist artistic renderings of some of the most famous scenes in surf history and paintings of the iconic places that were a part of his life journey.  Josh’s art has been featured in art shows across Southern California over the last several years to rave reviews from collectors and the media. 


Help us build an amazing space to connect the legends of surf with the next generation

Project and Goals

We have secured a space for the Aloha Doc gallery in the Los Molinos district in San Clemente, CA, not far from San Onofre State Beach where Doc and his family became a fixture in the 1970s.  We are located right across the street from the famous Clark Foam factory in the heart of “glass alley” where some of history’s most famous shapers still practice the art of hand shaping surfboards. 

Josh has been using this space as a private studio since May of 2014, but now we want to open it up to the public.  This will require some work, as the space is not retail ready.  We need to purchase fixtures, lighting, furnishings, paint, displays, and all the other stuff you need to open a retail store.  Some of the money raised will be used to curate, mount, frame and preserve all of the historic artifacts from the 93-year adventure that was Doc’s life, as well as produce products based upon Josh’s artwork and Doc’s life.  We plan to put all the money from this campaign into the gallery, so even if we don't hit our goal, by supporting this campaign, you will be helping build a home for the legacy of the surf adventure, Paskowitz style.  

We've got some amazing perks for you:

Lightening Bolt Sticker Pack - $5

4 X 6 print of Josh’s original painting "Banner Wave" suitable for framing - $15


Night Wave Art T-Shirt by Josh Ben Paskowitz - $35

High quality T-Shirt imprinted with the original Night Wave design by Joshua ben Paskowitz.  Please specify size when ordering (S/M/L/XL) 


Surfing and Health Book by Doc Paskowitz - $50

Wouldn’t it be just the thing if you could solve all your earthly problems, and even a few metaphysical woes, with one book? And, even better, if it wasn’t surrounded by some kinda religious dogma? Of course! Let Doc tell you about it himself.

Surfing and Health was written by Doc Paskowitz back in 1997. Doc, who surfed and was still active in the game of physical love until he passed at 93-years old,  advocates a basic diet, free from the crap we sling into our vessels, and simple breezy exercise. Like surfing. 

16x20 Night Wave Print - $100

Suitable for framing, a high-quality print of the original Night Wave acrylic on canvas painting by Joshua Ben Paskowitz.  

Exclusive Invitation to a Paint Nite with Josh at Aloha Doc Studio - $150

Josh will supply canvases, easels, brushes, paint, refreshments (wine!) and step-by-step instructions.  You go home with amazing memories, a one-of-a-kind painting and newfound skills.  Price includes admission for one.  Share with your friends and make it a party!

Limited Edition Print signed by Josh and Gerry Lopez - $250

Limited edition print numbered and signed by both the artist, Joshua Paskowitz and the subject, the legendary Mr. Pipeline Gerry Lopez.  Suitable for framing, earliest purchasers will be sent the lowest numbers 1-25.  

VIP invitation to grand opening of Aloha Doc Gallery - $250

Join us for the private VIP Gala Opening party of the Aloha Doc Gallery in San Clemente, CA.  This private event will be hosted by the Paskowitz family and is sure to be attended by the who's who of the surf community.  Preview new works from Josh, special guest musical performances, meet your heroes and talk story with some of the legends of the surf community. Date to be announced.  

12x9 or 16x20 commission by Joshua Ben Paskowitz - $500 or $750 

Have your favorite surf photo, scene, or Go-Pro shot (like the one above) turned into an original masterpiece in acrylic on canvas by Joshua Ben Paskowitz. This perk is extremely limited and will be painted one per month beginning in April.  Paintings will be created in the order that the perks are purchased (first come first served).  Delivery dates are dependent upon receipt of source materials. 

Join us in celebrating, preserving and sharing the adventure that was Doc Paskowitz' life for generations to come.  

Doc at the Erez crossing in Gaza, delivering 14 boards donated by Israeli shapers.

Everybody that ever met Doc said that he changed their life.  Whether it was giving free medical treatment to the underprivileged children in Mexico or bringing together Jews and Palestinians in the middle east with Surfing 4 Peace, Doc Paskowitz was one of the most remarkable people to walk the earth.  By helping us fund the Aloha Doc Gallery, you will be helping spread that special message of Aloha to new generations that didn't have the privilege of actually meeting Doc.  Please use the sharing tools to share this with your friends.  We really appreciate it.  Aloha.
story_txt:
Aloha Doc - Prescriptions for a Surf Lifestyle

History
“Doc” Paskowitz was a true legend in the surfing
community.  As chronicled in the hit
movie Surfwise, Doc and his wife Juliette raised their 9 kids on an endless
surf trip in a 24-foot camper van.  Doc spent
his life promoting a health and surf-centric lifestyle, not just in his
well-reviewed book called Surfing ad Health, but in the way he lived his life and
raised his family.
When Doc passed away in November at the age of 93, he was
one of the last of the original surfers from the age of Duke Kahanamoku, who
brought surfing to mainland America in 1912. 
Doc famously ditched his career as a Stanford-educated physician to live
a lifestyle of surf and travel, thus creating the vagabond culture that is so
pervasive in today’s surf world.  
Legacy
One of Doc’s last wishes was for the creation of a place
where this legacy could be on display for future generations of surfers.  A place where the past and the future of
surfing could come together to “talk story”, and learn of the virtues of
surfing and health that Doc extolled throughout his life.  
Doc’s youngest son Joshua Ben is dedicated to fulfilling his
father’s wish.  And by participating in
this campaign you can be a part of it. 
Josh, with the help of his family, friends and you, is
opening a surf art and lifestyle gallery called Aloha Doc – Prescriptions for a Surf Lifestyle.  When you live the Spirit of Aloha, you create
positive feelings and thoughts, which are never gone. They exist in space,
multiply and spread over to others.  Doc lived
with the spirit of Aloha as much as anyone, and he always signed his name
“Aloha, Doc”.  We can’t think of a better
tribute to an amazing person than to name the gallery after this term of
endearment.  
Joshua Ben Paskowitz has been drawing larger than life
figures since he was a young boy in the back of the family camper.  He’s
now taken to creating impressionist artistic renderings of some of the most
famous scenes in surf history and paintings of the iconic places that were a
part of his life journey.  Josh’s art has
been featured in art shows across Southern California over the last several
years to rave reviews from collectors and the media.  

Help us build an amazing space to connect the legends of surf with the next generation
Project and Goals
We have secured a space for the Aloha Doc gallery in the Los
Molinos district in San Clemente, CA, not far from San Onofre State Beach where
Doc and his family became a fixture in the 1970s.  We are located right across the street from
the famous Clark Foam factory in the heart of “glass alley” where some of
history’s most famous shapers still practice the art of hand shaping
surfboards.  
Josh has been using this space as a private studio since May
of 2014, but now we want to open it up to the public.  This will require some work, as the space is
not retail ready.  We need to purchase
fixtures, lighting, furnishings, paint, displays, and all the other stuff you
need to open a retail store.  Some of the
money raised will be used to curate, mount, frame and preserve all of the
historic artifacts from the 93-year adventure that was Doc’s life, as well as
produce products based upon Josh’s artwork and Doc’s life.  We plan to put all the money from this campaign into the gallery, so even if we don't hit our goal, by supporting this campaign, you will be helping build a home for the legacy of the surf adventure, Paskowitz style.  We've got some amazing perks for you:

Lightening Bolt Sticker Pack - $5


4 X 6 print of Josh’s original painting "Banner Wave" suitable for framing - $15





Night Wave Art T-Shirt by Josh Ben Paskowitz - $35
High quality T-Shirt imprinted with the original Night Wave design by Joshua ben Paskowitz.  Please specify size when ordering (S/M/L/XL) 


Surfing and Health Book by Doc Paskowitz - $50

Wouldn’t it be just the thing if you could solve all your earthly problems, and even a few metaphysical woes, with one book? And, even better, if it wasn’t surrounded by some kinda religious dogma? Of course! Let Doc tell you about it himself.
Surfing and Health was written by Doc Paskowitz back in 1997. Doc, who surfed and was still active in the game of physical love until he passed at 93-years old,  advocates a basic diet, free from the crap we sling into our vessels, and simple breezy exercise. Like surfing. 


16x20 Night Wave Print - $100
Suitable for framing, a high-quality print of the original Night Wave acrylic on canvas painting by Joshua Ben Paskowitz.  


Exclusive Invitation to a Paint Nite with Josh at Aloha Doc Studio - $150
Josh will supply canvases, easels, brushes, paint, refreshments (wine!) and step-by-step instructions.  You go home with amazing memories, a one-of-a-kind painting and newfound skills.  Price includes admission for one.  Share with your friends and make it a party!



Limited Edition Print signed by Josh and Gerry
Lopez - $250
Limited edition print numbered and signed by both the artist, Joshua Paskowitz and the subject, the legendary Mr. Pipeline Gerry Lopez.  Suitable for framing, earliest purchasers will be sent the lowest numbers 1-25.  



VIP invitation to grand opening of Aloha Doc Gallery - $250


Join us for the private VIP Gala Opening party of the Aloha Doc
Gallery in San Clemente, CA.  This private event will be
hosted by the Paskowitz family and is sure to be attended by the who's who of
the surf community.  Preview new works from Josh, special guest musical performances, meet your heroes and talk story with some of the legends of the surf community. Date to be announced.  



12x9 or 16x20 commission by Joshua Ben Paskowitz - $500 or $750 
Have your favorite surf photo, scene, or Go-Pro shot (like the one above) turned
into an original masterpiece in acrylic on canvas by Joshua Ben Paskowitz. This
perk is extremely limited and will be painted one per month beginning in April.  Paintings will be created in the order that
the perks are purchased (first come first served).  Delivery dates are dependent upon receipt of
source materials. 
Join us in celebrating, preserving and sharing the adventure that was Doc Paskowitz' life for generations to come.  

Doc at the Erez crossing in Gaza, delivering 14 boards donated by Israeli shapers.
Everybody that ever met Doc said that he changed their life.  Whether it was giving free medical treatment to the underprivileged children in Mexico or bringing together Jews and Palestinians in the middle east with Surfing 4 Peace, Doc Paskowitz was one of the most remarkable people to walk the earth.  By helping us fund the Aloha Doc Gallery, you will be helping spread that special message of Aloha to new generations that didn't have the privilege of actually meeting Doc.  Please use the sharing tools to share this with your friends.  We really appreciate it.  Aloha.

story:
Short Summary

A zine is a self-published, independent magazine that works to make a statement that may not have room to be spoken in mainstream media.

For my senior thesis I am designing and publishing a zine I am calling Poiema. When translated from Greek it means, "poems of God," which justifies that every life lived is meaningful regardless of race, gender, sexuality, or any other factor used to define people. This project will give a space to past and present members of Gordon College, as well as individuals from the surrounding community, who have been affect by the school's actions to share their emotions and thoughts around the ethos of the campus. 

Once the draft has been finalized I want to print and distribute as many copies as possible across campus and the local community to circulate the voices that have been unheard for too long. I hope that this zine and be a great leap forward in the changes that need to come.

The Impact

If you haven't heard of Gordon College we are a small, Christian, liberal arts college in Massachusetts. Over the past year, topics of the institutions practices and procedures towards practicing same-sex students have come under fire due to those who see a discriminatory nature within it.

The reason why I use President Lindsay's picture in the advertising is because he has become the image of Gordon College. This is not to defame him, or to try and target him with the art pieces.

As a cis-gendered gay male who plans on getting married one day, I have been at the front of the fight to change the procedural statements of the college. After participating in multiple conversations I have seen the lack of progress and, in my opinion, an unfair power dynamic. There are voices that are going unheard and this zine will bring them to light through literature, art, photography, and any other medium we can think of.

What We Need & What You Get

The project total is $1,550. A portion of this will go towards paying for an art show that will showcase all of these pieces for three days, in order to allow the surrounding community to absorb as much of the voice as possible. The venue will cost $150, due to the charity of a local group, and the entire event will be another $500. The rest of the total will go towards paying for printing costs. The goal is to publish as many copies as possibly so they can be widely distributed across campus and throughout the local community. 

All work is being submitted voluntarily with no compensation requested. Artists are briefed on the content of the zine before submitting their work so they can decide whether or not it is something that they want to get involved in. 

For everyone that donates the team is going to come up with some solid gifts to give back. Anything from a copy of the zine with a personalized thank you, to a t-shirt with the cover of the issue.

Risks & Challenges

This entire project is a risk. My school has attempted to curve the dialogues regarding sexuality, so what we are attempting to do is bring in the unspoken side of the conversation. However, by printing this zine I can leave knowing that our side of the conversation is no longer being silenced.

As of right now the team consists of just myself. I hope that the team will grow as I gather writers, designers and  other artists, but until then it is up to me to get this work done. Slowly more members will join, and possibly this group may go on to produce more issues in the future.

Other Ways You Can Help

I'm in college, so I understand what it means to not have the money to donate to everything. If you can't contribute please consider sharing this project with friends and family, or anyone you know!

If you want to go the extra mile please consider emailing about your thoughts on the lack of representation for all minorities on this campus. You can email our president, Michael Lindsay, at Michael.Lindsay@gordon.edu, or our Vice President of Student Life, Jennifer Jukanovich, at Jennifer.Jukanovich@gordon.edu.

story:
Short Summary

www.caesura.nyc

http://www.firewatchtower.com/

http://www.ohny.org/weekend/overview

http://www.harlemartsfestival.com/portfolio/feldman-haferd-knapp/

Support and celebrate outdoor public art in one of the most striking spaces in Harlem! This past Fall, the artists behind the sound & architecture installation, caesura, hosted events and this fundraiser to support the project and its preservation costs. Please help us cover the outstanding expenses for this ambitious project and give visibility and support to this unique and little-known public space.

Caesura stands 14' high and is embedded with transducers, which acts as a giant speaker and emits a composition made from recordings of historic rallies and speeches from around Harlem. It’s been an honor, an education, and a challenge to work on a piece of this scale and gravity.

Open House New York has partnered with us to offer a series of historic tours and artist talks as part of their OHNY weekend. Thank you OHNY and Angel Ayon, AIA!

Below are some photos from the Oct. 17th End of Season Events. Thank you to all who came out and also those who could not attend but are still able to donate - every bit helps!

(last photo taken from June 2015 MGPA/MMPCIA events)

-Jessica Feldman, Jerome W Haferd & K Brandt Knapp 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Caesura is a successful, major public art installation installed in a very challenging and provocative site. It has received a warm welcome from the community and it has held up against the elements. It is also a very ambitious piece: a large-scale (32’ x 7’ x 14’; steel) architectural installation with interactive sound. Our grants and commissions ultimately were not enough to cover the final costs of installation. Additionally, we need to raise funds for the continued upkeep and long-term preservation of the piece, including de-install and relocation this winter or spring. The $10,000 from this campaign will go towards recovering outstanding installation costs and financing our upcoming preservation/de-install/relocation expenses.

  • Every little bit helps! Regardless of whether we reach our goal, the funds donated for this campaign will reduce the burden of extraneous installation and preservation costs.


The Impact

More about this project:

Having passed the one-year mark since this project began, it is remarkable to have seen such an ambitious piece come to fruition. This project involved months of outreach, community meetings and discussion, archival research, design, and construction. caesura was made for, and with, the neighborhood. The piece is a place to gather and remember the history of this important Harlem site. The Acropolis is a (somewhat) secret gem, and this project represents an important step in carving out spaces for public art and other events in and around this Park, and in holding a place for Harlem’s vibrant traditions of creativity and community.

From the NYC Parks Press Release:

NYC Parks is pleased to announce the installation of caesura: a forum, a collaborative architectural and sound installation by artist Jessica Feldman and architects Jerome W Haferd & K Brandt Knapp.

cae•su•ra: a forum is inspired by Marcus Garvey Park’s iconic antebellum Mount Morris Fire Watchtower & Bell, and by Harlem’s vibrant tradition of activism and rallies. The bell is silent now, as the tower was temporarily dismantled in 2015 as the first phase for its reconstruction. Simultaneously, Harlem is undergoing dynamic change and New York City is experiencing a resurgence of public culture. caesura seeks to temporarily fill an architectural gap – and create a social space – by echoing and inverting the form and function of the absent tower. Like the bell, caesura aims to call up the neighborhood, to preserve and revitalize Harlem’s histories, and to connect newer and older community members to each other, by reactivating this site for congregation, viewing, and listening. The installation reframes history with a temporary structure and sound. A “caesura” is a break or pause, a place to catch your breath, most specifically in ancient spoken-word art.


Risks & Challenges 

We did it! The production and installation of this project was expensive, time-consuming, and challenging. We are pleased that the piece has held up well against the elements and has received positive responses from the community. Public art doesn’t maintain itself, however. caesura requires regular upkeep by the artists, and eventually will need to be professionally relocated in a way that is gentle to the park and preserves the piece. That process will be costly, hard work, and well worth it. Your donation helps keep this piece alive.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, you can still help!

·  Ask folks to get the word out about this fundraising campaign and the Oct 17th Event.

·  Use the Indiegogo share tools!

·  Volunteer to help out the day of the event. It’s going to be fun!

·  Finally, Come on the 17th!! The day of events, especially the evening reception (with DJ), will be a lot of fun in a beautiful, historic outdoor space.

story:
In recent months I've been fortunate enough to have an uptick in the amount of attention garnered for my work, with art connoisseurs and casual fans alike adulating both how my work looks, and the message that many of my pieces convey, that's why I feel that it's time to move on to the next step and display my work in a public, in a gallery show in New York.  


  

The Goal 

My goal is to raise funds to offset part of the cost of renting gallery space in Manhattan, and buying all the extra materials I'll need to prepare for the show. In thanks for your kind contribution I am offering some magnificent perks to everyone that donates.  

 

Art is one of the few things that is universal to all countries, all cultures and all religions, by supporting this campaign you'll be helping to advance something unifying and uplifting.

 

Spread the word  

Please tell others about this campaign and all the great stuff that contributors will receive. Post on social media, text, email, anything that you do to help get the word out will be greatly appreciated.  

-Brandon Thvndar Sindos

story:
Dark Moon Bright Matter

My name is Nitasha Schneider. I was born in Cheyenne, WY and raised in Grand Junction, CO. I will be 22 a week before my deadline. I currently work as a server and do odd jobs on the side to support myself. I have been traveling for roughly the last two years outside of my home town, joining the following of love and light to search for the deeper meaning of my existence. What I have found thus far, is a true appreciation for nature. Last summer, whilst hiking along the Appalachian Trail I set my intentions on becoming aware of the small things. Listening and watching to quiet my mind. Once I found my first four leaf clover hiding beneath a root in the middle of the trail, I knew I was on the right track. I started collecting these small thoughtful moments in my notebook, which was later turned into the landscape collage featured with butterfly wing mountains and robin's egg clouds (made in a grocery store parking lot, while living out of my backpack). 

My idea is to create the perfect thoughtful gift. Making daily intentions to search for the little things, perfectly preserving them and setting them in recycled wood. Each piece will take anywhere from 3-5 hours depending on the size. I am also encouraging people to send me requests for personalized pieces and small forest floor finds of their own to help inspire exploration and adventure. I have been collecting and pressing forest floor finds lately in Northern Michigan to create a prototype which I will post a video of soon. I will be moving to Oregon two weeks before my deadline ends, which gives me plenty of opportunity for more forest floor finds on the way. 

I probably won't need as much as my total goal to acquire the small amount of tools it takes to create these nature gifts. All I need is a dremel for shaping wood, resin, and recycled lumber. The collage pieces are gifts from the forest floor. Your donations will be used purely for this project, any extra money will be invested in bulk supply and creating a space. I will open an www.etsy.com store and later a personal website where anyone can contact me at anytime and personally order my hand made organic art. 

Love my idea? Share it! You don't have to contribute money to help out. 

<3 <3 <3

Sending love and light to all! 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR TIME

story:
About Plays in Mud Pottery and Kelsey Schissel

Hi!  Thank you for your interest in supporting Plays in Mud Pottery!  

I have been working hard to make a living producing one of a kind functional pottery.  Its been slow going but I have not given up hope yet!  I graduated from UNC-Asheville in 2003 and set up my pottery studio in the River Arts District and in 2005 bought a house and moved my studio to the unfinished basement.  I quickly out grew the basement and in 2008 we built a studio in the back yard.  This small (192 sf) space has been fantastic, exactly what I needed and in 2012 I was accepted as a member of the prestigious Southern Highlands Craft Guild.  

I have been participating in Fine Art and Craft shows around the area and this year branched out into wholesale and now have my work in 3 galleries around Asheville. 

My goal is to market my pottery to galleries around the nation and become a nationally recognized ceramic artist.  

I am currently working toward this goal by taking small business classes at AB tech and Haywood community colleges, meeting with mentors in the ceramic craft world including Lynn Jenkins - President of the Southern Highlands Craft Guild- and have been excepted to participate in American Made, which is a wholesale trade show.  


Will you please help me?  I have been working for years perfecting my craft and now I need your help to further my craft business.  With your help and my effort and perseverance I will move from an artist struggling to succeed  to a prosperous successful artist, nationally recognized.   
   


What Plays in Mud Needs! 


For this venture I need $10,892.00.  

That's a lot of money and here is how it breaks down.

$1,665 for the American Made wholesale trade show. Already excepted !!!   This includes the booth fee and revamping the current booth design to be gallery spec including white walls, more lighting and a fresh coat of paint. 

$3000 for another kiln - with only 1 kiln I do not have enough production space to keep up with all the orders I receive.  

$4000 for studio expansion and moving to a new space. 

$1,000 for shipping perks.  Each item has had shipping added to it and even if I don't make my goal, there will still be enough to send out your selection.  
 
$892 for Indiegogo fees.  

$335 for clay and materials to make all the perks as well as enough clay to make the 1st couple of wholesale orders.  

Even if I don't reach my end goal all the funds raised will still go toward growing Plays in Mud into a nationally recognized ceramic studio.  It may just take  a little longer to get there...

What you get in return! 


Everyone who makes a donation will have my gratitude forever.  I will be forever thankful for the opportunity you helped create.  

To thank you for your help I am offering some one of a kind pieces.  All the pieces will be decorated with a special limited addition Indiegogo inspired stamped pattern called Shooting Star.  Once the perks have been made the pattern will be retired and not used again.  The only people who will have pieces with this pattern will be the people who donated.  Once you donate you will also have the option in the future to order additional pieces with the shooting star pattern but you will be the only ones.  I will develop the pattern over the course of the campaign and you will be the 1st to see it.  I want you to see how valuable your support is and share in the passion I have for crafting a creative living.  Pots will be very carefully packed and shipped to you and if you are in the area, you are welcome to stop by and pick up your perk, so I can personally thank you.  

I will keep you informed along the way.  I will send out newsletters filled with pictures and info, letting you know how the campaign is going, when the new kiln will be delivered, what the new studio space is like and how my work is received at the wholesale show and how galleries are responding to the marketing packages I send them.  

Page of Gratitude on my website.  I will create a Page of Gratitude on my website and blog, listing each of your names and can add links to your website if provided.  


The Impact:


My life will be forever changed.   With your help and my effort and perseverance I will move from an artist struggling to succeed  to a prosperous artist faster than I can alone.  

With our combined efforts I am going to make a difference in my West Asheville community.  I believe that local is best and West Asheville is best!  I shop in West Asheville, have my hair done in West Asheville and when I need repairs around the studio or the house painted I hire people and businesses from West Asheville.  

When I move to a larger studio space it will be in West Asheville.  

Once I reach a point that I need help in the studio and its time to hire someone, I want to hire specifically from the West Asheville community and pay them a wage they can live on, at least $13.50 an hour.  This will make a difference in their quality of life allowing them to actually live and not just work to live.   Even though I may not be able to offer health insurance, at the beginning, I will offer an employee health savings plan to help with any unforeseeable costs. 

I am in the process now of setting up a mentorship program for aspiring potters in Western North Carolina.  I am going to offer 1 potter a 1 year mentorship to help them realize their goal of being an independent  studio artist.  

Risks & Challenges


What happens if I don't do very well at the American Made Wholesale show?
Well its a good thing my eggs are not all in one basket.  I am also going to be marketing to galleries before and after the American Made show.  I have made a variation of the Indiegogo video that I will be sending to galleries showcasing my work, to create wholesale accounts along the way.  You can view the gallery video from my YouTube account Plays in Mud Pottery.

What happens if I don't make my goal amount with Indiegogo?
I am still working hard to make Plays in Mud as successful as possible it may just take me a bit longer. 

What happens if I raise all the funds with Indiegogo?
Perhaps people won't view this as a challenge but I do.  Its scary embarking on this journey and what if I do raise the funds?  Then I feel that I have a responsibility to succeed even more than I do now.  I can assure you that I will spend each and every cent I raise toward the success of my business. I will work harder then I can imagine now, to succeed. 

What happens if I don't raise any money with Indiegogo?  
I will not be able to attend the American Made Wholesale show, but I will still have the videos I made for Indiegogo and I will still have my ambition, both of which will help me tremendously.  I will have learned a great deal and again it may take a lot longer than I would like but eventually I will realize my goals.

4 

Other Ways You Can Help


I am sincerely grateful for any help!!

Even if you are not able to contribute monetarily you are still able to help simply by getting the word out!    

  Please tell your friends.

  Please post my campaign on your Facebook page.

  Please share your thoughts in the comments section. 

  Please talk about this campaign.  

With your help this will be successful!          


                               Below are just some of the perks I will be offering...

                        As I make the Shooting Star pattern I will post it here!

                                         
                                                                  Wish Dish $25

                                        Bud Vase in Green 2 to 3 inches tall  $30

                                                         

                                         Bud Vase in Blue 2 to 3 inches tall $30

                                              

                                               Small Vase 3 to 4 inches tall $50


                             12oz Individual Mug $50.00 or 4 for $190

                           12 oz Signature Flower Pattern Mug Individual  $50

                                                        or 4 for $190

                                                

                                                  Medium Vase 6 to 7 inches tall $75

                                                                                
                                          

                                               Large Flower Vase 7 to 9 inches tall $150


                Another example of Large Flower Vases 7 to 9 inches tall $150

                               

                                                          Sake Set $225

                               

                              

                                           Victory Vase!!!   $2,000


                         

                                              Beautiful Grouping of Sake Sets

story:
Svanubhava

2016 Schedule

Monday, August 22nd
9.00am – Inauguration by Suguna Varadachari with N. murali (President, Music Academy) &
Priyadarshini Govind (Director, Kalakshetra)
9.15am – Performance by the students of Kalakshetra
10.15am – Carnatic Vocal by Suguna Varadachari (vocal), R. Hemalatha (violin) & B. Ganapathyraman (mrdangam)
12.15pm – Mohiniattam by Dr. Neena Prasad
1.30pm – Paraiattam by Friends Kalai Kuzhu


Tuesday, August 23rd
Special Guest – N. Gopalaswami (Chairman, Kalakshetra)
9.00am – Musical Play by Gowri Ramnarayan with Sujit, M. Vijay, K.H. Vineet, V. Sai Subramanaiam
10.30am – Bharatanatyam by Meenakshi Srinivasan
12.30pm – Namasankirtanam by Udayalur Kalyanaraman
1.30pm – Nagaswaram by Mambalam M.K.S. Siva


Wednesday, August 24th
9.00am – Hindustani Vocal by Arun Kashalkar
10.30am – Tamil Play by Chennai Kalaikuzhu – Payanam, directed by Pralayan
12.30pm – A brief insight into the documentary ‘Yaadhum’ – a film about Tamil Muslim history & identity along with commentary by filmmaker Kombai S. Anwar followed by Tamil Sufi Music by The Nagore Sufi Trio
1.45pm – Tala Vadyam by N.C. Bharadwaj (mrdangam), S. Swaminathan (khanjira), S. Sunil Kumar (Tavil), S. Krishna (ghatam), Srikrishnan (muharsing)
7.00pm – Concert by N. Ravikiran (chitraveena), Nagai R. Sriram (violin), Neyveli R. Narayanan (mrdangam), K. V. Gopalakrishnan (khanjira)

Evening Workshops (Starting at 4pm, entry by registration only)
Music Workshop by N. Vijay Siva | Dance Workshop by Bragha Bessel | Art In The Classroom Workshop by Prema Rangachary

-

About Svanubhava

Since 2008, a group of young and energetic artists and art enthusiasts (yes, that's us!) have gotten together every year to put on an Indian cultural event unlike any other.

What makes this special, you ask?

Well, to start with, we do it for the kids. OK, maybe they are not all kids, but we target ages 12-25.

So classical music and dance for kids... That's not new, you say?  Imagine this... 3 whole days, an atmosphere completely consumed by art, more than 75 of the country's leading artists, representing over 10 different art forms, presenting exclusively for 1000+ students from across 50 different schools. Wow!

And it doesn't end with the performance. They present their art forms, explain their rich heritage and point out nuances and intricacies, engaging in dialogue with these highly inquisitive and energetic students... The very students that form the future of this country, and our world.

At a time when the youth are overloaded with information, we feel it is even more essential to go the extra mile to make sure they see, hear, and fully experience the richness of the Indian performing arts... Including the lesser known forms and those that are harder to access.

Our aim is to create a lasting impression in the hearts and minds of the young, so much that they develop respect, understanding and a sensitivity to the performing arts.

-

Our Initiatives

The Svanubhava team is working actively on a number of different initiatives that all spring from the same vision.

Svanubhava: The Festival

Having started in 2008, we have continued to refine the programming and scheduling of this intense multi-day festival to try and get the greatest artists from across the country and the rarest of art forms to our students.  We have also worked with like-minded youngsters in different cities to take the festival to places like Delhi, Trichy, Bangalore, and Jaffna in Sri Lanka. More places are in the pipeline!

Svanubhava On-the-Go

With this, we have a team of young artists visiting remote and underprivileged schools, to introduce students to different forms of art. The students have the opportunity to engage and participate in the arts in an easy, intimate and familiar environment.

Svanubhava University

By popular demand, we have devised a day-long version of the festival that we can present at a college or university, exclusively for its student population. This now allows us to address a slightly different segment of the youth too.

-

Over the years, we have reached thousands of students, and several thousand more through the live festival webcast relay. We are fortunate to have had the support of many extraordinary artists, who take great pleasure in addressing our young audiences. We have also had a sincere group of supporters, who contribute year after year, without receiving any more than a small mention of their name somewhere in the corner of our website. (You'll never see a sponsorship banner at any of our festivals!)

And now we need your support:
To embrace this vision, and join in our cause. To help us bring this magnificent treasure of art to every boy and every girl, in every city. Every penny counts and will help us go a long way.

Aside from money, there are also other ways that you can contribute. We are always looking to grow our team of volunteers. We rely heavily on the generous support and services from different groups to make this festival happen. Get in touch with us at: svanubhava@gmail.com

And don't forget to check out our media gallery to get a taste of the Svanubhava magic! We have a few humble offerings in return for your contributions, but of course nothing that will come close to fully expressing our gratitude and those of the hundreds of children who will make lasting memories.

Help us to preserve & celebrate the diversity of Indian arts - Please contribute generously!

On behalf of the entire Svanubhava community, here's a big THANK YOU!

(You'll never see a sponsorship banner at any of our festivals!)And now we need your support:To embrace this vision, and join in our cause. story:
Call us dreamers, believers, art lovers, and if there's one thing to tell you about ourselves is that we wish we could fly! Don't you?

Come to think of it, we've been flying for a couple of years, flying on experiences with amazing people fighting cancer who drew us to dedicate a part of our life to their journey. A journey of strength & pain,  and one that has made us more determined to find a way to make it more about strength and less about pain for them. 

Of course there are the traditional means of help; financial, medical, research. It all remains important, but what about aiding their healing process through art? Almost everyone we've met on these experiences express their healthiest times is when they're involved in a creative project that empowers them to kick cancer in the butt, and if we have the power (which we do), to gather up local talents & design such projects, then why not be that sidekick to those heroes! 

Its is our shared belief in Art Therapy that Superhope and Kids & Art Foundation have teamed up to continue to match families touched by cancer with local talents. The Superhope experience is proudly part of Kids & Art Foundation special destination workshop this year, brought to the children at UCSF! Yay! 

 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Your love, but also your contributions whether they meet our goal or don't, you'd still be supporting us in designing top notch experiences for these children. Contributions go towards: material, rentals, talent, marketing, production of film & photos and project coordination.  

The Impact

The best part of this experience is watching the children embrace their self-made Superheroes, and witness their care-givers shed tears in awe of their child's strength. Parents seek every means to try and rid their young child from this ugly monster, and are open to such experiences that clearly boost their child's mental state, which has been proved to boost their immunity system & aid with their fight against cancer. Your belief in the power of imagination is so important for the child's livelihood and for their care-giver's hopefulness. All the Art workshops carried out by Kids & Art Foundation and by Superhope in the past to date, have witnessed great impact on the families worked with who've shared with us testimonials of their child feeling the best they've ever felt through out their treatments.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Simply, share our video :)
story_txt:
Call us dreamers, believers, art lovers, and if there's one thing to tell you about ourselves is that we wish we could fly! Don't you?
Come to think of it, we've been flying for a couple of years, flying on experiences with amazing people fighting cancer who drew us to dedicate a part of our life to their journey. A journey of strength & pain,  and one that has made us more determined to find a way to make it more about strength and less about pain for them. 
Of course there are the traditional means of help; financial, medical, research. It all remains important, but what about aiding their healing process through art? Almost everyone we've met on these experiences express their healthiest times is when they're involved in a creative project that empowers them to kick cancer in the butt, and if we have the power (which we do), to gather up local talents & design such projects, then why not be that sidekick to those heroes! 
Its is our shared belief in Art Therapy that Superhope and Kids & Art Foundation have teamed up to continue to match families touched by cancer with local talents. The Superhope experience is proudly part of Kids & Art Foundation special destination workshop this year, brought to the children at UCSF! Yay!

Your love, but also your contributions whether they meet our goal or don't, you'd still be supporting us in designing top notch experiences for these children. Contributions go towards: material, rentals, talent, marketing, production of film & photos and project coordination.  


The Impact

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Creative's Piazza aims at creating value for women(age 12-35) in the creative space by appreciating and promoting their talent, work and ideologies through advocacy and exposure. We realise that women have minimal platform to showcase their work in the creative space. This include the lack of accessible and affordable forums to discuss their creative ideology and work. Undervaluation for women's work in the creative space is a major issue as well. 

Creative Piazza is going to provide a virtual platform for women to showcase their creative work as we work our way into being the brand ambassadors in setting pace for value, appreciation and organising forums. This project will be focusing on everyone; creatives in middle class economies, the slums, rural and urban areas. We will be targeting the youth groups for most rural dwellers as an avenue to reaching them.  We need $1000 to be able to achieve that.

CP is not a non-profit organization. It will be an earned revenue as we aim at being sustainable to avoid continuous donation. We will be able to achieve this through premium content, ads by event organisers looking for creative's, organising affordable events monthly either for competitions, exposure or rather; fun Sundays and the quarterly creatives forums.. Signing up, is free for everyone. Members will be categorised in accordance to their expertise through a portfolio. Their work will be promoted through partnership with companies, organisations and individuals that are responsible for events, jobs and competitions that require creative expertise. We also aim at opening markets for various creatives, in relations to the current trends in technology.

The amount is going to be used to create a system which will be an interactive website where people can upload their works, we will have provision of samples, generate ads on social media for sign ups especially on Facebook and Twitter with Flickr, Instagram and LinkedIn and attend events to scout for creative's and sign up members to promote creative's Piazza. Our aim is 22,000 members as pioneers! Globally, we aim at having interaction with other creatives to ensure that we are not limited by culture or underexposure as art; contemporary and culture, creates a beautiful combination!

story:
Summary


Out of our love for Lake Atitlan we are raising funds to bring renowned Dutch artists Jeroen Koolhas and Dre Urhahn to produce a Color Lab with the townspeople of Santa Catarina Palopo as the first step in a much more ambitious project that will eventually result in the entire lakeside town being used as a giant canvas for a monumental piece of art.    The Color Lab will bring together community leaders to work in creating a color palette and a design that most represents the town.

We believe in the power of art as an agent for social change and in this case as an empowerment tool that will enhance a sense of pride and belonging in Santa Catarina Palopo, one of the dozens of  communities in the Lake Atitlan basin.

This workshop will mark the first step in a process that will revitalize an entire community, creating new job and small business opportunities and a creative outlet and empowerment opportunity  for the majority young population of Santa Catarina.

The Lake Atitlan basin and its inhabitants need the commitment of all of us to ensure the survival and future of this dynamic, beautiful and diverse natural resource.

What we need

We need  28,500 dollars to produce the Color Lab, which includes materials, paint, transportation, artist fees, and food and lodging for all those involved in the workshop. 

The impact

Projects by Haas & Hahn around the world have been proven and effective agents for social change.  Their impact has been dramatic in communities from Brasil to Haiti, where tangible improvements in quality of life, reductions in crime levels and a general sense of well-being have come about as a result of the community's involvement in creating large-scale art projects.   Improving quality of life, beautifying the surroundings and creating a sense of pride and ownership are at the heart of this project.  Working hand in hand with the community as it decides how it wants to be presented is also at the heart of what we envision.   

Challenges

We have established a solid alliance with the municipal leaders of Santa Catarina and are working with a diverse group of community leaders to ensure the acceptance of  the project.   Working with transparency and utmost respect for the town, the artists will facilitate processes by which the community will determine how it will best be represented by the monumental work of art to be created there.    

Thanks for your interest and support!

story:
Hello,

So as you may or may not know, in February I will commence a two-month residency at Campos de Gutierrez, an international program for artists in Medellin, Colombia. I chose this particular residency because I’ve leant that 87 indigenous ethnic groups represent only 1.5% of Colombia’s total population.

I want to learn about the land and its communities, the layers of social, historical and mythical narrative, and the techniques, as well as creative processes, that local artists have to offer. I want to collaborate with the residents on site utilising the studio and materials provided, to develop art that can roll onto further work. During the residency I will be part of a group show, press release and curatorial text, which I eagerly look forward to.

Currently, my practise displays what is found between the fictional and non-fictional space, presenting a familiar yet alien collaged land. By recycling images from second-hand books, I began to regurgitate a hyperreality in contrast with urban spaces and the technologically advanced postmodern society we now live in.

It recently dawned on me that most of the images I would assemble in my former work were taken in South America due to its harsh scenery and rich colour. This has led me to perceive Colombia as an idyllic place, with a variety of wildlife, and it is this unfamiliar nature that inspires me the most. I want to cross the ocean to conduct primary research on the Colombian landscapes. Starting in the heart of Medellin and its surrounding nature, I will endeavour to contextualise the images I have used in my previous work as well as building upon my perceptions of the country with my own experience. This will be achieved by photographing the landscapes, interacting with Colombian people and analysing my findings. This new set of information will be the inspiration for a new body of work.

In order to continue exploring and making, I’m asking for some pennies. I have been fortunate enough to talk to many artists who have taken up residencies, which is how I’ve learnt the importance of applying for these opportunities and the need to develop fundraising skills. As a developing artist I’ve learnt how vital it is to practice these skills and to start now rather than later to further my professional development.

Even if you can only give a small amount, the contribution will be greatly appreciated and put to good use. To demonstrate this, along the side of the page I am offering a number of perks, which will reward your generosity and act as an incentive for me to continue making.

If you’re interested to know more about what I do or you have any more suggestions as to how I can fund my period of time as an artist in residence, please email me via sampetherbridge@hotmail.co.uk or check out my website www.sampetherbridge.co.uk

If you interested in knowing more about the residency you can also have a look at there website www.camposdegutierrez.org

Thank you kindly for making the time to read this.

story:
• Joindre culture et agriculture, pourquoi pas? Voilà ce que RURART propose! Ainsi, sous forme d’événement saisonnier, RURART offre des ateliers POUR TOUS et des présentation d'œuvres d’artistes variés au cœur même de la ferme La Généreuse à Cookshire-Eaton, dans les Cantons de l'Est. Que ce soit dans la forêt, les champs, la grange centenaire ou les vergers, RURART a pour mission de rapprocher et sensibiliser la communauté aux milieux naturel et agricole via le médium des arts.
  • RURART à débuté en 2012 sous l'initiative d'Amélie Lemay-Choquette, artiste en danse contemporaine et art visuel et récipiendaire, en 2013, du Prix Artiste de la Relève en Estrie. Depuis, cinq événements se sont tenus en collaboration avec une quarantaine d'artistes et d'artisans d'ici et d'ailleurs. C'est grâce à la générosité des spectateurs, de la ferme et de ses artistes que RURART a pus se perpétuer. RURART grandit et ses besoins aussi.
  • C'est pourquoi, pour être en mesure d'offrir une programmation varié et de qualité à son public RURART à besoin d'un rayonnement capable d'attirer des artistes professionnels et des spectateurs en plus grand nombre. Permettant ainsi de promouvoir l'art en milieu rural et valoriser une collaboration positive entre les différentes communautés.


 1.  Une ferme animée pour VALORISER et RAPPROCHER nos communautés

  • Activités en nature pour tous, dégustation de produits locaux, ateliers immersifs pour la famille, présentations artistiques intimes, le tout dans une ambiance conviviale dont l'expérience partagée permet de tisser des liens harmonieux avec CE et CEUX qui nous entoure.

 2.  Un espace unique pour EXPLORER et CULTIVER L'ART et la CRÉATIVITÉ

  • Résidence artistique dans un milieu de vie durable, expériences collectives positives, ateliers variés de ressourcement, et présentations et échanges informelles avec le public dans un milieu vivant; la nature.

 3.  Une opportunité pour PROMOUVOIR un mode de vie sein en harmonie avec la    nature

  • Démonstration de la cohabitation harmonieuse d'un milieu de vie ou synergie entre homme, nature, aliment et habitation existe au quotidien.


  • L'objectif de socio-financement est de 10 000$ (5 000$ par édition). Cette somme peut sembler beaucoup, mais créer un espace animé et faciliter l'implication de collaborateurs sérieux est coûteux. Ci-dessous, quelques investissements à considérer: cachet des artistes/collaborateurs, matériaux pour les ateliers, location/installations, outils promotionnels,  comptabilité, etc.

  • Je souhaite dire un ÉNORME MERCI et récompenser tous les contributeurs avec un éventail de choix cadeaux passant par un accès gratuit à 1 jour à l'Expérience RURART, 1 œuvre d'art originale, et allant jusqu'à un séjour Bien-être sur la ferme La Généreuse. Il est important pour moi de souligner l'impact positif que vous avez sur le projet et combien je vous en suis reconnaissante. Qu'on le veuille ou non, ceci ne serait pas possible sans chacun et chacune d'entre vous. (Assurez-vous de prendre connaissance des différents cadeaux situés sur la page à votre droite!... toutes forme de contribution à une grande valeur pour moi!)


S'il vous plaît, aidez-moi en passant le mot à propos de L'expérience RURART! Vous pouvez le faire en parlant à votre famille, vos collègues, vos amis (tous ceux que vous connaissez, finalement) du projet, et partager la campagne Indiegogo avec eux! C'est du fond du cœur que je dis merci pour tous les "posts", appels téléphoniques, et gestes posés à l'égard de RURART. Joignez-vous et suivez-moi sur les plateformes suivantes:

Prenez connaissance et PARTAGER le site internet! www.rurart.ca

AIMEZ la page Facebook! www.facebook.com/Rurart


MERCI À TOUS DE PRENDRE PART À CETTE AVENTURE SIGNIFIANTE!
C'est simple, vous avez-là l'un de mes rêves les plus chers. Je me sens choyée d'avoir l'opportunité d'impliquer ma famille, mes amis, et mes supporteurs dans cette initiative de vie. RURART.

story:
LAST DAY SPECIAL If you order a print we will throw in a Longhouse 20th Anniversary T-shirt with your order
For two decades the Longhouse Education and Cultural Center has been dedicated to supporting Native artists and strengthening Indigenous cultures. We’ve helped thousands of Native artists from around the country and across the Pacific Rim to revitalize ancient practices, explore new media, and market their work. While always maintaining our focus on the Pacific Northwest, our work to promote indigenous arts and cultures has expanded over time into national and international arenas through residencies, exhibitions, and gatherings of Native artists.

We hope you will become part of our most exciting initiative to date: the creation of an Indigenous Arts Campus surrounding the Longhouse at The Evergreen State College in Olympia, Washington.

Imagine …

·  A complex of studios where the art-making facilities and the surrounding 7.25 acre campus are based on indigenous architectural design and cultural concepts.

·  A place where culture keepers, artists and creative people illustrate the balance of indigenous life—honoring the past while visioning into the future.

·  A place that allows artists to preserve and reinvigorate traditional practices and evolve new ones, to honor ancestors and prepare new generations. 

·  A home for a planned Master of Fine Arts in Indigenous Arts at Evergreen.

The Fiber Arts Studio for weavers is the next dedicated indigenous arts space we are building. We are fundraising to support the artists working on the structural artwork and to close the gap on fully funding the construction of the building.

The Western entrance will reflect the art and cultures of the  West Coast and Salish tribes while the Eastern entrance of the studio will reference Māori art and culture. Weavers of all cultures will be able to work with new kinds of materials, share weaving techniques with artists from around the world, and preserve and pass on important traditions and knowledge to the next generation.

The Longhouse has received a significant part of the funding from private foundations, Washington State Tribes, The Evergreen State College and individual donors.

We need your help to keep the magic alive.  Could you support the magic of Native arts with your contribution to the “Weaving a New Future” fundraising campaign? 

If you would like to donate but feel uncomfortable using your credit card on line, an option would be to use a MasterCard or Visa gift card to make the transaction. That way you won't miss out on the array of great perks.

All contributions to this campaign to support the Fiber Arts Studio and artists will be made to The Evergreen State College Foundation on behalf of the Longhouse. Contributions are tax-deductible to the extent allowable by law. As a token of appreciation for your gift, you may select from a variety of perks, determined by your level of contribution. Thanks for supporting indigenous arts!

Every contribution, no matter the size, is a welcome gift that will help our vision become a reality. If you cannot contribute to the Weaving A New Future campaign, your support in getting the word out about our fundraising campaign would be a great help. Please share with your friends and your networks and everyone you know who supports indigenous arts!

CONTRIBUTOR PERKS

LAST DAY SPECIAL: Order a Print as your perk and we will throw in a Longhouse 20th Anniversary T-shirt to your order or cap. We have L, XL and 2X shirts in limited quantities.



You can also view the perks in the gallery. The link to the gallery is right above the video.

$250  Prints by Nytom (Makah)

Gorgeous prints by Nytom, Makah (John Goodwin) that feature his signature innovative style. Giclée. Choose from one of 4 print titles. Only 2 available of each and then they are gone!  "Beech Keeper" 2016 21.5"w x 22.25h"  , "Four Wolf Brothers" 2009  20"w x 20" h, or "Listening to My Inner Spirit" 2016 17"w x 18"h,  and "Wolf Brothers" 2016  20" x 20".

"Listening to My Inner Spirit" by John Goodwin, Makah (measures 17"w x 18"h

"Beech Keepers" by John Goodwin, Makah (measures 21.5"w x 22.25"h)

"Four Wolf Brothers" by John Goodwin, Makah (measures 20" x 20")

"Wolf Brothers" by John Goodwin, Makah (measures 20" x 20")

$10 I Support the Fiber Arts Studio window cling type sticker

3" x 5" electrostatic window cling e sticker for your car. Adhesive free! The Fiber Arts Studio logo is a close up of the collaborative Maori/Salish panel created in 2013 for the new Fiber Arts Studio.



$25 Twana Designs T-shirts NEW PERK!

Double Thunderbird (front)  Also available with the design on the back of the shirt

m, l, xl 2xl in black, red, gray or white

Minimalist Thunderbird t-shirt m, l (black only) xl and 2xl

in gray, black, red or white


$30 Mini clay salmon fish pins


$40 perk mini-drum and alder drumstick
By Laura Grabhorn (Tlingit) Choose from two sets of designs,  Abstracted Chilkat or rattle top basket lid design on a 2" round rawhide drum. Perfect hanging from your rear-view mirror or on a pendent.


$50 Clay Salmon Ornament by Erin Genia and Heather Genia (Sisseton Wahpeton Oyate) These unique hand-made clay salmon ornaments are individually hand-decorated. Each salmon boasts rich textures, beautiful glazes and glass beads. Measuring 6" x 3" an ornament would look perfect on your wall. One of only 15 made.


$100 "Pacific Connections" Relief Print by Alex Swiftwater McCarty (Makah)

6" x 9" linocut hand printed edition of 30
Alex is one of the artists who is working on the Fiber Arts Studio. He has collaborated with Lyonel Grant on certain pieces for the Maori entrance as well as the Salish Entrance.


$100 "Perpetual Motion" Relief Print by Alex Swiftwater McCarty (Makah)

10" x 12" linocut hand printed edition 30


$125 "Loon" or "Sockeye"  Serigraph Print- Dennis Allen (Skokomish) 

prints generously donated by The Legacy LTD

 Loon 11" w x 12.25"h edition of 300


 Sockeye serigraph 13"w x 11"h edition of 280


$200 Eagle Within Moon Manuel Salazar (Cowichan 1st Nations)

serigraph, edition of 129 16"w x 17"h  Generously donated by  The Legacy LTD

$200 Origin of Water by Stan Greene (Semiahmoo Band, 1st Nations)

prints generously donated by The Legacy LTD

Serigraph edition of 156  21” w x 15” h


$250 Wolf Brothers by Shaun Peterson (Puyallup)

prints generously donated by The Legacy LTD

Serigraph edition of 100  22” w x 22” h

$150 Red Cedar Dance Paddle -John E. Smith (Skokomish)

This 47" x 5" wide red cedar dance paddle is perfect for display on your wall or on a mantle. The design is Thunderbird inside the Longhouse Logo.


$400

Thunderbird Arrives 100% New Zealand Wool Blanket (20 available)

These are the last 20 blankets of the 1st edition produced by 8th Generation, the company owned and operated by artist Louie Gong (Nooksack), and designed in collaboration with the Longhouse staff for the 20th Anniversary

Fits on a Queen size bed



$500 Painted Yellow Cedar Canoe Paddles featuring the designs Bear With Salmon (left) by John Edward Smith (Skokomish). Eagle and Salmon (center) by Taylor Krise (Squaxin Island). Thunderbird (right) by Alex McCarty (Skokomish).

LAST DAY SPECIAL If you order a print we will throw in a Longhouse 20th Anniversary T-shirt with your orderFor two decades the Longhouse Education and Cultural Center has
been dedicated to supporting Native artists and strengthening Indigenous cultures.
We’ve helped thousands of Native artists from
around the country and across the Pacific Rim to revitalize ancient practices,
explore new media, and market their work. While always maintaining our focus on
the Pacific Northwest, our work to promote indigenous arts and cultures has expanded
over time into national and international arenas through residencies,
exhibitions, and gatherings of Native artists. 
We
hope you will become part of our most exciting initiative to date: the creation
of an Indigenous Arts Campus surrounding the Longhouse at The Evergreen
State College in Olympia, Washington.
Imagine …
· 
A complex of studios where the art-making facilities and the surrounding 7.25
acre campus are based on indigenous architectural design and cultural concepts.
· 
A place where culture
keepers, artists and creative people illustrate the balance of indigenous life—honoring
the past while visioning into the future. 
· 
A place that allows artists to preserve and reinvigorate
traditional practices and evolve new ones, to honor ancestors and prepare new
generations.  
· 
A home for a planned Master of Fine Arts in Indigenous Arts at
Evergreen.

story:
Short Summary

 My name is Paul Jago and I am an artist. I have always created designs to relieve my own stresses and enjoying the creative process. With looking after my brother who passed away from a life-long illness, this was a savior for me and I want to share this book for people to lose themselves in.

 This book will give me the funding to create the designs to help some non-profit societies. Canuck Place,which helps families who are going through children's illnesses in their final stages. They need support, and they need an outlet that can give them a brief respite from the daily stresses facing the loss of a young one. 

My designs take people back to the 70's when this style was popular as all enjoyed the coloring of posters of fantasy and design. I am looking at CreateSpace, Amazon, and retail for sales and distribution,so I can finish Book 2 for Canuck Place, that have already been given designs for the families to color.


What We Need & What You Get

 This funding will allow me to get the quality of paper to make this book the success it will be! It will also give  a head start on book #2 for Canuck Place, which is more labour intensive, following their guidelines.

 Hmmm, perks. How about a new Design of the Month Club! Having a new creation delivered online to you for a year? Or, Have an idea? Family fantasy? Favourite vehicle? Pet? We will work together to create a unique design just for you! Maybe your business?

 If the funding was to fall short, well, I have been communicating with several printers and have developed a good, better, best scenario. 

The designs are ready. This would be the major hurdle but I've already  cleared that! 

The Impact

  • Put your electronics down, turn off your TV. Relax. Lose yourself for awhile.
  • Family and friends can enjoy a stress free get-together any play with the variety of designs!
  • Help me support the non profits that need this release.

Risks & Challenges

  • With my previous management experience in retail and a new business self employment course under my belt, I feel ready for the challenges and obstacles remaining in front of me to achieve my goal. I have done my homework, have my mentors in place, now is the time. 
  • I am looking forward to getting out there and promoting my book with determination and enthusiasm!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Maybe you can't contribute financially, but you can help promote my book! 
  • Simply Spread The Word! Let me know what you've done and a design can be yours!
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Hey everyone, what we're doing here is bringing the artwork of Keith Burgess (follow the link if you are unfamiliar with his more famous work) to the physical realm. Everything is ready virtually and we want to bring high quality prints of his to the convention circuit. These are all full body pinup style portraits and they're just as creative as they are adult in nature.

Make sure to check out the gallery to see most of the art, you may have noticed that quite a few are head shots, and that is because we're not a 100% what we can show on this site yet. Also, google Keith Burgess, he's on Wikipedia and IMDb. Here are links to his Twitter and Facebook which showcase a ton of his black and white art.

Keith Burgess' Twitter

The Madness of Keith Burgess


What we will do (with the help)                

  1. 25 individual prints in the following dimensions 12x19 creating 100 of each will come to a total of 2,975.00
  2. 25 individual prints in the following dimensions 8x10 creating 50 of each will come to a total of 350.00
  3. Self printing and conversion of my book "So You're Lovers A Zombie"(this graphic novel will be explained down there) 345.87
  4. 100 5x7 mini sketchbooks at a total cost of 242.00
  5. Logo printed bags for The Madness of Keith Burgess, 1000 black single side color logo plastic bags for retail 326.00
  6. 100 copies of my Adult Coloring Book, 24 pages of wrong that you can have a go at color for yourself in whatever style you like, total cost 112.14
  7. 8' FT portable black trade show booth display with carrying case 228.99

And to push our luck

  1. 144 T-shirts and shirt dresses, the dresses are one size fits all and the shirts will start at XL and some will go as high as 10X, these will be different designs and select pin-up images. This will total 1,342.56
  2. 200 pairs of yoga pants in black ranging in sizes medium, large, and extra large at 4.38 a pair for a total of 876.00/ 6.42 per pair for printing to come to my second total of 1284.00
  3. 200 pair of Lycra low rise shorts in black ranging in sizes medium, large, extra large at 3.41 a pair to total 682.00/ 3.12 per pair for printing to come to my second total of 624.00
  4. Trademark of clothing brand 356.00
  5. And lastly, Mustek 11x17 flatbed scanner 239.89 (the guy seriously walks himself down to a copy store to scan up his artwork.


 What YOU get

And we're not asking for some hand outs or to get anything for free, support an artist, there are benefits. We're not just stopping with this list, you have something you want that's not here? leave us a comment, tell us what you want and we'll negotiate.

      The Thank You-$1 

Every little bit counts and even taking the time to give a single dollar is huge to me, so with this you have my utmost gratitude and you will be listed on my art page as someone that stepped up and helped make my dream a reality. 

 The Thank You-2-$5

This perk gives you a much appreciated thank you as well as an 8x10 art print of any image you request, age restrictions do apply to this one but there will be images for everyone.

  A Pocket full of Yum!-$10

Now this perk gives you a 12x19 pin-up print of any image or a copy of my sketchbook or coloring book. Most of my pin-up are on the 18+ side but I still will have something for everyone.

    The Thank You-4-$20

 Okay now with this perk you have an option of getting a copy of my book "So You're Lover's A Zombie" or a t-shirt of your choice.

   Necronomican-$40 

This perk I'm excited about as it's a special edition of my zombie love book with a little twist, it's covered in human flesh! Not really but it looks like it which is seriously awesome. This one is also signed.

The Combo-5-$30

This perk is exactly what it says a combo, you can pick from the previous perks to create this one as long as it adds up to 30.00.

Pin-up Buttercup-$50

A personalized collection of five of my art prints or work with me to create five originals of your own in black and white signed.

Cool World-$75

This one gets a black and white pinup of your features with a little magic twist.(become art)

Cool World Ultimate edition-$100

A full color pinup version of yourself, print and digital copy.

Good lord!-$100

Choose any combination of perks that amount to 100.00 and then let's brainstorm and add a little extra of the magical to it!



What makes you think you will make it?

 "I'm going to use the pop culture convention scene to sell and get the word out. I set up and ran convention booths for Manga Entertainment for just under a decade and I will apply the knowledge of the convention demographic and traits to pick the best possible events for exposure and most positive results. And with being able to hit different markets it allows me to promote my items at a grass roots level alongside my online attempts. If I'm able to spark interest, that's a win and possible sale at a later date."-Keith Burgess

What was that thing about Zombies?

Here is the first part of my campaign, my book entitled, "So Your Lover's A Zombie: A Guide to Happy and Safe Intimate Relationships with The Living Dead"! And yes, it is a mouthful, but a funny one. We've all learned how to survive the zombie apocalypse, but what do you do after? A loved has turned and you're not quite ready to let go, what do you, how do you continue the relationship. Will she still look good in that thong? These are questions I hope my book will answer for you. So when the apocalypse comes and passes, you'll know how to keep the love alive, mostly. Now my second part is a bit more normal pin-up art. If you're not familiar with the style, it's creating beautiful and at most times, sensual, but in my case, twisted and definitely funny. I started drawing actually to get rid of depression and nightmares and it didn't help either. But from that, I draw inspiration and drive to make this dream a reality and something that can't be taken away from me. Now I've tried to make come true before but I can't do it alone. So I'm asking for help to bring my Madness to life and maybe it can be a distraction and a bit of fun for you as well.


Who is this guy again?


About Keith Burgess

Kieth Burgess' IMDb page

"Thanks for taking a moment to check out my profile. My name is Keith Burgess, and welcome to my Madness. Like many people here I have a dream of making something I love become reality for me. Now, I've had many dreams in my lifetime, for example, I'm a huge fan of Japanese animation. I wanted to be a part of that industry and I did just that. I first became the fan relations person for Manga Entertainment, and then I was given the opportunity to stretch my voice skills.  I gave voice to my favorite video game character "Akuma" from Street Fighter Alpha. From there, I went on to voice several other characters from more anime to even a couple of video games. My life was on track and my next dream was becoming a reality. Being a father and having a family of my own. This one didn't work out as planned and in order to be a part of my son's life, I walked away from three possible careers. And I would do it again in a heartbeat. It's not how I planned or even imagined my introduction to fatherhood would go. But it is what it is, and every minute I have with my son is precious to me. For the last eight years, I've kept my head down and my fingers to the grindstone all so I can be close to my son. Over that time a skill I used to cope has become my new dream. Drawing and character design, as well as writing, has become a passion of mine. So much so, that I've written my first book and started creating pin-up art of characters from my imagination. They're disturbing, funny, and definitely a little out there. Which I think we all need at one time or another in order to deal with the world around us. And that's what this campaign is about. Making the madness of the world around us something we can use to escape. And when things suck, maybe bring a smile to our faces or a momentary escape from the suck."-Keith


Now I know these days it's not easy to help others out especially in their ventures of creativity as it's maybe not world changing or maybe even seen as socially uplifting, but sometimes a dream coming true can give others hope. So even if you are unable to contribute maybe you can inspire hope, that anything is possible and even when you can't do it on your own there's always hope that you'll get a helping hand. So please if you can't contribute spread the word, and if you can help in other ways let me know and thanks for taking the time to check out my madness.
