And with being able to hit different markets it allows me to promote my items at a grass roots level alongside my online attempts. If I'm able to spark interest, that's a win and possible sale at a later date."-Keith Burgess




What was that thing about Zombies?
Here is the first part of my campaign, my book entitled, "So Your Lover's A Zombie: A Guide to Happy and Safe Intimate Relationships with The Living Dead"! And yes, it is a mouthful, but a funny one. We've all learned how to survive the zombie apocalypse, but what do you do after? A loved has turned and you're not quite ready to let go, what do you, how do you continue the relationship. Will she still look good in that thong? These are questions I hope my book will answer for you. So when the apocalypse comes and passes, you'll know how to keep the love alive, mostly. Now my second part is a bit more normal pin-up art. If you're not familiar with the style, it's creating beautiful and at most times, sensual, but in my case, twisted and definitely funny. I started drawing actually to get rid of depression and nightmares and it didn't help either. But from that, I draw inspiration and drive to make this dream a reality and something that can't be taken away from me. Now I've tried to make come true before but I can't do it alone. So I'm asking for help to bring my Madness to life and maybe it can be a distraction and a bit of fun for you as well.




 Who is this guy again?



About Keith Burgess

Kieth Burgess' IMDb page

"Thanks for taking a moment to check out my profile. My name is Keith Burgess, and welcome to my Madness. Like many people here I have a dream of making something I love become reality for me. Now, I've had many dreams in my lifetime, for example, I'm a huge fan of Japanese animation. I wanted to be a part of that industry and I did just that. I first became the fan relations person for Manga Entertainment, and then I was given the opportunity to stretch my voice skills.  I gave voice to my favorite video game character "Akuma" from Street Fighter Alpha. From there, I went on to voice several other characters from more anime to even a couple of video games. My life was on track and my next dream was becoming a reality. Being a father and having a family of my own. This one didn't work out as planned and in order to be a part of my son's life, I walked away from three possible careers. And I would do it again in a heartbeat. It's not how I planned or even imagined my introduction to fatherhood would go. But it is what it is, and every minute I have with my son is precious to me. For the last eight years, I've kept my head down and my fingers to the grindstone all so I can be close to my son. Over that time a skill I used to cope has become my new dream. Drawing and character design, as well as writing, has become a passion of mine. So much so, that I've written my first book and started creating pin-up art of characters from my imagination. They're disturbing, funny, and definitely a little out there. Which I think we all need at one time or another in order to deal with the world around us. And that's what this campaign is about. Making the madness of the world around us something we can use to escape. And when things suck, maybe bring a smile to our faces or a momentary escape from the suck."-Keith





Now I know these days it's not easy to help others out especially in their ventures of creativity as it's maybe not world changing or maybe even seen as socially uplifting, but sometimes a dream coming true can give others hope. So even if you are unable to contribute maybe you can inspire hope, that anything is possible and even when you can't do it on your own there's always hope that you'll get a helping hand. So please if you can't contribute spread the word, and if you can help in other ways let me know and thanks for taking the time to check out my madness.

story:
Hi !, we are David and Angela.  First of all, we want you to know who we are!!!

We are a couple of artists who travel by hitchhiking.  We use this inspiring way of traveling as a creative process (while we are on the road, David takes pictures and Ángela makes drawings): We want to share with you the magic places and people we find on the way!
This project is very important for us because it embodies our passion for traveling and for making art: Autostop Postals brings together the excitement of being picked up by a car/motorcycle/truck, the magic of sharing with new people, and the wonder of making art with all the stories of the road.

Also! we want to show you that there is a solidary world, that there are people who dare to pick us up in their cars regardless of geographical or political boundaries.

AND!... How nice to have those memories in a collectible series of postcards!


Some images of how we have done the project:


WE BOTH REPORTING OUR TRIPS IN SOCIAL NETWORKS:



ANGELA EDITING HER DRAWINGS:



DAVID TAKING PHOTOS DURING THE TRIPS:



The Poscards:

Autostop Postcards - Chapter Colombia is a box of 25 cards (15 photographs and 10 illustrations) about trips we have done in Hitchhiking through Colombia.   For now, we are going to make the nicest box of postals of our country, but our dream is to have a version for each of the countries that we travel by Hitchhiking !!!

Each of the postals will be 5.5 in  x 4 in printed in high density propalcote paper.  The 25 postcards will be packed in a box with a nice design.







What we need?

For the first chapter of the project, "Autostop Postcards - Chapter Colombia" we need, US $ 6000, which will be destined for Postcards printing in high quality propalcote paper, for box design and production of them, for special shipment boxes... AND! for gifts we will send to those who support us!

You can get variety of items such as: the box of postcards, prints in different sizes of photographs and illustrations (including the originals!), stickers, and T-shirts.

It is so important you know!

If we do not achieve the total amount we are asking for (BUT WE HOPE SO!), we are going to find other ways to make this dream a reality.

IT IS OUR PASSION AND WE ARE WILLING TO SEEK THE MEANS TO DO SO!!!

If you wonder why we are making shipments until August 2016, it is because we need  time to rise the money, then for printing, box designing, for packaging.  And after all this, we are going to start sending Autostop Postcards around the world.


Prototypes:

(These are digital prototypes, the ones we will make when we raised the money will be very similar or better)




          



Perks:

______________________________________________________________________________

_____________________________________________________________________________

_____________________________________________________________________________

_____________________________________________________________________________

____________________________________________________________________________

____________________________________________________________________________

____________________________________________________________________________

____________________________________________________________________________


AUTOSTOP POSTALS IS AN ADVENTURE WITH LOTS OF DISCIPLINE AND INSPIRATION!

                                                               SUPPORT US!

story:
Short Summary

Nowadays life is hard. It seems as there were some rules which forces you to be successful, happy, have a lot of friends, a lover, good job…

We often spend too much time while thinking about our appearance, other people’s opinions, we try to be loved by others.

But are we honest with ourselves?

Christine (26 ) is working as flower seller and lives with her friend Ignas. Their daily routine is quite boring: home, work, home, work. Christine believes, that the most important thing in life is to make a good career and to find a proper husband. But everything is still standing in the stagnation. Christine decides to take care of her life.

What is she going to do?

Will Christine manage to bring things to the right places?

We are going to find out the answer at the very end of the project.

Every single drama looks like the end of the world, but after some time, it starts to look funny. That’s exactly why we want to tell Christina’s story in the funny way. And that is WHY we need Your help to manage it.

Every single donation is the most important for us!


What We Need & What You Get

Here is the plan how we are going to use Your money:

-Transportation costs

-Food for the cast and crew

-Production design

-  Wardrobe

We have partly donated:

-  Equipment

For every single donation we have a very special prize!

People are working for free just because they love and are passionate about cinema!

CAST

Kristina - Egle Anceviciute


Ignas - Aidas Barkauskas


CREW

Director - Ieva Sakalyte


Cinematographer - Martynas Norvaisas

Writer - Irena Kuneviciute

Producer - Gertruda Gulbinaite

Set Design - Gytis Uogintas

Costume Design - Ugne Smalskyte

Sound Designer - Artiomas Penkevicius

Other Ways You Can Help
If you just can't contribute, but you still want to help us - remember the power of sharing. Every single person in the world is very important to us and our compaign. We are going to go through big hurdles. Please, be the one who lets us learn and keep on loving film - art.

story:
The first part is the magnet that you can use to display different things. 

     The second part is the spot that allows you to hang the magnet anywhere!

                       

I decided to make MagnaSpot when I purchased my new stainless steel refrigerator and realized that I couldn’t put magnets on it. As I was making MagnaSpot, I realized that they could work on other surfaces too. So, instead of having to use tape (which always seemed to rip or leave a sticky residue on my pictures/posters/walls) or push pins (that leave holes in walls and the items they are holding), I could just use MagnaSpots! With this realization, I knew it was a product that others could benefit from too!


1.  Remove clear cellophane lining that is covering the black suction side of the MagnaSpot

2.  Press and Rub the black suction side of the MagnaSpot onto a smooth surface to activate the suction

3.  Hang a note, etc. by attaching the magnets we provided or hang your own magnet


1.  Remove any magnet, note, etc. that is on the MagnaSpot

2.  Peel the MagnaSpot off of the surface, like you would a sticker

3. Replace the clear liner to preserve the microscopic suction cells for future use



When you are finished with your MagnaSpot in one place, you can easily move it to another! 


MagnaSpots come in Red, White, Blue, and Yellow! Once the campaign ends, you will be able to choose which color you would like to receive. You can also get a mixed combination of the colors! 

MagnaSpots will work on most surfaces like:


Each MagnaSpot comes with a super-strong rare-earth magnet. These magnets are enclosed in a unique, clear, disc-shaped housing designed NOT to be a choking hazard for children and to make the magnets easy to separate. 

However, if you prefer a low-profile magnet without the housing, we have an add-on perk for that. Purchase one of the MagnaSpot options and the "Low-Profile Magnet Add-On." 


MagnaSpots have 5 layers 

One side is made of microscopic suction cells to stick to virtually any surface without leaving behind residue.

The other side is made of magnetic receptive material, making it perfect to use with magnets you already have or the magnet that comes with each MagnaSpot.


Risks & Challenges

We have done a lot of research and made many prototypes. Our final design is ready. We have material suppliers lined up, so the Indiegogo funding will help us make the purchase of the materials to make the MagnaSpot and to make the magnet housing. We will also use the funding for production costs, to design retail packaging, to enhance our website, and start our e-commerce platform.

We understand how important it is that you receive the products you support in a timely manner. We have already had one timely delivered, fully funded project  on Indiegogo, so we understand how to fulfill perks in an efficient and timely manner.

story:
I’m Lindsay Peyton, an oil painter who has been granted a rare opportunity to try something new. 

I was recently honored to be selected as an artist-in-residence at artEAST gallery in Issaquah, WA for July through September. I will be building an installation piece for the gallery -- something i have never done before and will need a lot of help to face up to this challenge.

I'm trying to make one of my paintings come to life. 

My piece for artEAST, entitled “Life, Examined,” will be an homage to a science lab – with a bit of magic and whimsy mixed in.

Science and art have a lot in common. Both are used for probing deeper into mystery. They both involve hypothesis and process, questioning and experimenting. And, you have to repeat the process over and over in the search for greater truth.

I need funding to help build this laboratory -- and to create experiments that will be conducted to mirror the artistic and scientific process of examining life.



During the residency, I will use the lab to examine love letters, photos, and pieces of nostalgia using paraphernalia such as microscopes, test tubes and dissection trays. Guests are invited to enter the lab and start their own explorations into memory and emotion. 

Your donations will be key to helping me build this installation. 

What I Need and What You Get

To fund the installation, we will need $3,500. This will cover the costs of constructing the lab, science equipment and art supplies -- as well as labor costs for collaborating artists. 

  • Artist and set-designing whiz Justin Dunford will fly out to help me with this project. Funding will help cover the cost of his trip and reimburse him for his time. 
  • Materials to build the lab will be costly -- even if we use reclaimed stuff. Also the props required for the lab will be covered by funds raised in this campaign.
  • Any additional funds raised but not needed for this project will be donated to a nonprofit organization.
Your gift will help me -- and I have a few fun ways to thank you! If you donate, you will be recognized throughout the course of the exhibition. Also, there are a number of gift options. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help.

If you can't donate, you can still help spread the world about this campaign. 

And if you have some unusual science stuff floating around -- feel free to send it my way. Message me for more information.

story:
To whom it may concern,

In the past eight years I decided to use my art talent to survive. I moved across the river Nile but one aspect of my life has remained constant; my passion and love for Art, which I use to change my and preferably the world. For me, to be a multi media artist is to be alive. I have tried other ways to both make a living and to find happiness, but I now know that there is no alternative. Whether or not I chose this life or it chose me is irrelevant - it is clear to me that I must continue my work.

I initiated my annual Europe art journey in 2011 with the aim to create an album of art painting each year, travel and stay with friends in the neighborhood where I could showcase and conduct free art talks about my compositions and my origin. And while being on the road I want to raise money for my Art community foundation in Uganda by selling the exhibited art.

I have worked diligently over the past six months in studio producing new material on the theme "The After War" to showcase and explain to why there is a massive flow of refugees now. It is now time to take the painting collection to the next level and hit the road. It has always been a dream of mine to tour in support of my original creations, to exhibit in a new gallery in a different city each week across Europe.

I am writing you because I need your help! I am launching a crowdfunding campaign just a month before my travels and it will last until April 1st. The purpose of this campaign is to raise financial support from everyone who feels connected with my topic and series of painting about migration, refugee, homophobia and segregation as characters of war. I am looking for friends and supporters whom help me pay for the flight to Europe. My deadline is almost there and I only saved money for food since most of it has been invested in the production costs of my work. 

I plan to depart from Uganda on the 17th April and for now I have Amsterdam, Cologne. Mannheim, Jena, Malmo, Copenhagen, Stockholm, Oslo, Bergen and Hamburg on the calendar and I am eagerly working on confirmation in more Cities (and hopefully come to your city if you invite me with my exhibition!). 

I have designed some great handmade perks for YOU my friends, fans and supporters to receive while supporting my mission. So now is your chance to support the cause and get your hands on some super rare limited edition items that have only been created for this purpose and will never be duplicated! Once these items are gone, thats it! 

Check it out and spread the word! 

Painting title: At the south gate Size 74x59cm, acrylics on canvas, artist Destreet. 

Donors to my fundraiser will receive a number of handmade items from Uganda by Destreet.

Thank you for taking the time to read this and I hope I inspired you and that you are seriously considering to contribute to my project.

Sincerely,

Kabati Ayub A.K.A Destreet

Founder destreet art foundation

Artists and artist director at National Street Gallery Uganda

story:
HALLO!

So, if your reading this you may have already been spammed by the zine campaign, heard me ramble about fonts or jump giddy at the idea!

Basically, it is pretty much finished; putting it together has been amazing and, as I suspected, it has made me really happy to see everyone’s wonderful contributions, the world has been really positive and y’all blessed with great talents (in my opinion).

I feel pretty strongly that this would be a great thing to have at Warwick so that a greater no. of students can get a look at peoples creative talents in a place where we don’t have a great deal of creative degrees. And, part of this is getting it printed because it’s great to hold things, fuck the internet, love paper- or something like that. I do!

Unfortunately money is a thing and being in colour and pretty makes things fairly expensive to print- like £3-4 each. Small numbers are pretty unfeasible/ more means cheaper. Also, being a twat, means most deadlines were missed for milking any funds from the university (partly because term 3 is not classed as real alive time in this place)- not that this will stop me trying!! While I am sure your aware I would love to print many and give them to you all, I don’t have an overdraft so this is not possible. The target is ridiculous, but basically if we get the ball moving I can do the rest.

Essentially, IF YOU WOULD LIKE ONE YOU NEED TO GIVE MONEY NOW AND YOU WILL GET ONE.

Make dreams come true!

If you don’t know what the hell I have been talking about basically I have put together a small magazine showcasing the work of Warwick University Students poetry, illustrations, pictures, ramblings etc...and it’s decent.

Listening to myself write is making me feel ill now so I am going to stop.

Thank you to everyone that made it poss so far, gave encouragement etc, OK, I am going to stop, now.

…please donate something or something for something!

it is pretty much finished; putting it together has been amazing and, as I
suspected, it has made me really happy to see everyone’s wonderful
contributions, the world has been really positive and y’all blessed with great
talents (in my opinion).
I feel
pretty strongly that this would be a great thing to have at Warwick so that a
greater no. of students can get a look at peoples creative talents in a place
where we don’t have a great deal of creative degrees. And, part of this is
getting it printed because it’s great to hold things, fuck the internet, love
paper- or something like that. I do!
Unfortunately
money is a thing and being in colour and pretty makes things fairly expensive
to print- like £3-4 each. Small numbers are pretty unfeasible/ more means cheaper.
Also, being a twat, means most deadlines were missed for milking any funds from
the university (partly because term 3 is not classed as real alive time in this
place)- not that this will stop me trying!! While I am sure your aware I would
love to print many and give them to you all, I don’t have an overdraft so this
is not possible. The target is ridiculous, but basically if we get the ball
moving I can do the rest.
Essentially,
IF YOU WOULD LIKE ONE YOU NEED TO GIVE MONEY NOW AND YOU WILL GET ONE.
Make dreams
come true!
If you don’t
know what the hell I have been talking about basically I have put together a
small magazine showcasing the work of Warwick University Students poetry,
illustrations, pictures, ramblings etc...and it’s decent.
Listening
to myself write is making me feel ill now so I am going to stop.
Thank you
to everyone that made it poss so far, gave encouragement etc, OK, I am
going to stop, now.…please
donate something or something for something!

story:
Para activar los subtitulos en el video, haz clic en el botón "CC"

Creative, mindful, and slightly irreverent

Dear problem bearer:

This project was conceived as a tool to help you detach from what troubles you. The main idea is to have fun, calm the fuck down, and look at life’s events from a new perspective. You see, when life gets tough, the endless chatter inside our minds just makes it worse. We go through the same thing, over and over, and in the end we are so attached to our problems that we start to act as if we are the problems. This is never true: we are not our problems, and none of our problems is permanent.

By acknowledging the transient nature of everything, we gain perspective. When we look at our problems from a different angle, new ideas arise and we are able to see the many ways in which we can accomplish a solution. Through these pages, you can place your problem in different scenarios, break it into smaller pieces and realize that nothing is as unbearable as it may seem at first glance.

By focusing on the problem we stop avoiding what is bothering us (avoidance is another form of attachment: by not acknowledging what troubles us, we are unable to let it go) and understand how it works, where it comes from, how it affects us and how to truly let it go, either by finding a solution (whenever possible) or by just letting it pass. It is sort of a meditation that involves your creativity in many different ways: by thinking, drawing, sketching, coloring, mind mapping and cursing when necessary.

The book can be used for many different purposes: you can work on personal problems and habits, emotional issues or work-related situations, money problems and creative blocks. The only thing that you need to have is a problem. And we all have them once in a while.

Use the book however you want: go through each exercise for one problem, finish one and go to bed, add color wherever you want, change the order, start from the middle or the end, give it as a present… the options are endless.

Shit happens, all the time and to everybody. Just don’t let it pile up. 

Creativo, atento y un poco irreverente. 

Querida persona en problemas:

Este libro fue imaginado como uno herramienta para ayudarte a desapegarte de lo que te preocupa. La idea es que te divertas, te calmes, y mires tus problemas desde una perspectiva nueva. Cuando la vida se pone pesada, el constante parloteo de nuestra mente sólo la hace parecer peor. Le damos vueltas a las cosas, uno y otra vez. Nos apegamos tanto a los problemas que comenzamos a actuar como si el problema fuéramos nosotros. Y eso nunca es cierto: podemos causar nuestros problemas, pero no somos el problema, y además nada es permanente.  

Al asumir la naturaleza transitoria de todo, logramos ver las cosas desde otra perspectiva. Al ver nuestros problemas desde distintos ángulos, nuevas ideas salen a la luz y comenzamos a ver de qué manera podemos solucionarlos. A través de estas páginas puedes poner tu situación en diferentes escenarios; dividirla en partes más pequeñas y darte cuenta de que nada es tan insoportable como parece. 

Te invito a concentrarte en el problema y no evitarlo (la negación es otra forma de apego). Aprende cómo funciona, de dónde viene, cómo te afecta y cómo puedes dejarlo ir. Es como una meditación que involucra tu creatividad de muchas formas: al pensar, colorear, dibujar, hacer mapas mentales y esquemas y quejarte y decir algunas malas palabras si es necesario.

Puedes usar el libro de muchas maneras y para muchos propósitos: trabaja en tus hábitos y problemas emocionales; aborda situaciones de tu trabajo y dinero, o ponle fin a un bloqueo creativo. Lo único que necesitas tener es un problema y esos abundan para todos. 

Usa el libro como mejor te parezca: completa un ejercicio a la vez o termina una serie completa. Disfruta de colorear los mandalas para calmarte. Comienza en el principio o el final o dáselo como regalo a un amigo... las opciones son muchas. 

La mierda sucede, lo importante es no dejar que se acumule. 


About funding

The money that we raise with this campaign will be used to cover for printing and design expenses, and to continue developing creative, mindful and slightly irreverent products.

Sobre los fondos

El dinero recaudado con esta campaña se utilizará para cubrir los gastos de impresión y diseño y para seguir desarrollando productos atentos, creativos y un poco irreverentes. 

Take a look inside / Algunas imagenes del interior:

story:
The Project

The artist Piero Fantastichini is the creator of a project aimed at building a monumental art work built with the support of children in elementary and middle schools. The project consists of the construction of a cone of 40 feet, covered with 2000 base-reliefs (16 cm x 16 cm). 

The children, all residents from Fiuggi, an Italian town near Rome known for its thermal waters, will create the outer layer of the Cone, working on pigments, enamels and fiberglass. The Cone, once completed, will be displayed permanently in Fiuggi. Kids coming from diverse cultural, ethnic and social environments will all have the opportunity to work together and be part of a team working toward the same goal: the construction of a monumental sculpture that will symbolize light and remain their own forever.  

The project will be developed in two stages: we've already finished the first one, which involved a workshop made up of 500 students from primary and middle schools, who already have created 500 bas-relieves. Each one will be placed on the surface of the Cone. 

       

       

When these kids grow up, they will have the chance to share the experience of this accomplishment with their own children, and in that way spread the purest expression of the spirit of their community.

 

The second stage is even more grand. It will involve all the citizens of Fiuggi who wish to participate. My father will personally co-ordinate the work of the entire Fiuggi community, who will be tasked with the creation of the additional 1500 bas-relieves that will form the skin of the Cone.  

 

The Cone will be also equipped with an elaborate system of water pumps, capable of pushing masses of recyclable water on top of the monument and from there spill over the entire surface of the sculpture. The water flow will create a music composition specially conceived for the Cone.

Piero Fantastichini is fully committed to seeing this project completed, but we cannot do this without your support. We need your support to proceed with the second stage. Any amount you can contrìbute will be helpful to achieve our goal.  

In the end, this project presents a unique opportunity for people to actively integrate into the social fabric of a community, and overcome cultural barriers, differences and mistrust. This project will prove that art has the power to break down boundaries and reconnect the broken threads of a town, a region, and a nation. We hope we can count on you.


What We Need & What You Get 

The amount we set as our goal will help us to start with the second stage of the project and to complete the construction of the sculpture. We have to organize the next workshops where all the adults from the community will help the children to proceed with the building of the Cone. We need to purchase the materials: the steel structure, tons of resin and fiber glasses, colors and enamels, optical fibers to cover the inner ceiling, the hydraulic system that will activate the music, nad of course we need to cover the expenses of the labor to assemble all these elements together. 

The crowdfunding is a crucial stage of the process, it will help us to consolidate the budget we need to build the Cone and to help the children to accomplish their dream.     
     

Perks

T-shirt


Print A4


Brooch

Sticker


Postcard


Desktop Wallpaper


Fabric Bag


Digital Painting 25x50cm retouched and signed by artist


Digital Painting 50x100 retouched and signed by artist


Cone Sculpture 16cm


Cone Sculpture 30cm


The Impact on the community and children

For its participatory nature, the cone embodies the cultural identity of the place where it is made and becomes the most immediate symbol of the community that created it, which is recognised in a work able to pass on its values to future generations. Its monumental size make it a point of contact between plastic art and architecture with the objective of becoming a reference point, immediately inside the territory – a centre of attraction able to draw the attention of tourists and visitors, creating an inducement in terms of place of work and wealth, like other works that characterise architecture and contemporary art.

The project is unique, an extraordinary event that can revitalize the function of artistic experiment within civil society and lends itself to becoming a model educational/didactic /creative, exportable to other cities in Italy and abroad. Within the work accessible to visitors there will unfold an exhibition space where there will be evidence of the technical dimension and the communicative properties of the sculpture: digital applications that will make the fruition of the work extremely dynamic and the perceptual experience through projections, sounds, explosions of light. In this way the interior of the cone becomes a real electronic connection destined to become a kind of antenna receiving and transmitting information from each part of the world and able to relate in real time, the visitors of the other cones made on other sites on the planet. In this way the project welcomes and raises instances in the Global Village Square, the experiment conceived by Derrick de Kerckhove, one of the world experts in systems and technology for connected communication and intelligence who oversaw the recent exhibitions of Piero Fantastichini: a square for a Global Village through permanent video interconnection between the cities of the world.


Co-working art: A net of sculptures and workshops arounf the world

We set ourselves up on a very difficult task, but we believe that with the help of other people who will join our efforts we'll achieve our goal. We are constantly working to involve new subjects in our project, and we ask you to spread the word in order to get more attention to our cause. 

This is just the first art work we are going to build with the help of an entire community: more projects are on the way, our dream is to build other sculptures around the world, sharing our vision with new communities worldwide. We called our project co-working art, we deeply believe that art has to reacquire  its role as avanguard outpost within a community: the place where the citizens reactivate their creative instincts and share an experience aimed at the construction of a monumental work that will become the tangible symbol of an event that is unprecedented in the history of recent art. 

We believe children and art need to be reconnected, the practise of art is the key to break down cultural barriers and social differencies to unify knowledge, talents and experiences. 

                     


The artist

Piero Fantastichini is one of the most visionary Italian artists.

In his long career he has always experimented new materials and the latest technologies, combined with the influence of European art in which he was trained. Born in the heart of Baroque Rome, he grows eagerly studying the paintings of Italian masters and the shapes of the Capitoline buildings.

He studied at the College of the Cistercians of Casamari Friars. It's during this period that he began to paint and to compete for the first time with the freehand drawing and collage techniques. From 1961 to 1967 he attended the Art School of Frosinone, where he is a student of Maestro Piero Guccione.

After completing his studies, he starts traveling in Europe between 1967 and 1969, and he gets in contact with the avant-garde art in Amsterdam, London and Paris. He decides to devote his life to research and artistic creation. In this period he works on a series of drawings and oil paintings characterized by a personal touch signed by a detailed tract and light backgrounds, consolidating a personal reinterpretation of classical and baroque art. These works were exhibited for the first time in Fiuggi and then to Canaletto Gallery in London.

In 1994 he holds a major solo exhibition at the Schwarzenberg Palace in Prague, where he presented some monumental sculptures, among which the Horse of Piero and Iconi, in addition to the increased production of paintings of previous years including The Christ and The Battle.

In 1995 he moves to the south of France,settling down in a small village, Bonson, and then in Nice, where he opens his atelier. In this period he begins digital experimentation, which leads him to explore new territories of artistic expression and communication, earning the attention of critics. In this period he meets the communication expert Derrick De Kerckhove and he cooperates with Universities, research institutes and enterprises to develop interactive works projects. He's invited to participate in festivals and media art workshops.

In 2007 he realizes the scenography of Mozart's Magic Flute, 800m2 of canvas designed at pc and then painted; the opera goes on stage at the Grimaldi Forum in Montecarlo.

In 2008 He returns to Rome for a personal exhibition at the National Museum of Castel Sant'Angelo, where he exhibits paintings, sculptures, drawings and electronic interactive works.

The production of the last years is oriented to to investigate the relations between art, technology and architecture, documented by a series of exhibitions in Italy and abroad, and culminated in the works The Great Wall of Stars, Monument to chaos, a livable sculpture, and in the project Source of light.


Other Ways You Can Help 

If you can't contribute with donations to this campaign don't worry. We would really appreciate your help to  get the word out and make some noise about our project. We are looking for new cities and councils interested in activating workshops and building an art work (a Cone, a Pyramid, a Tower, any iconic symbol of the identity of the city) that would bring the community back together. 

You can use the Indiegogo tolls to share this campaign, or link it to your facebook profile or the other social media tools.

Video Production: Jacopo Fantastichini & Francesco Favale

Music: Fabrizio Bondi

story:
Be A Part of The Runaways Team!


The Story

The Runaways tells the story of James and Kellee - two teenagers whose love for one another has carried them through the nightmares of growing up in abusive households.  James is aging out of the group home and the plan is for him and Kellee to run away together, but the night before they are supposed to run away, Kellee finds her mother beaten unconscious and begins to have second thoughts about leaving her.  What follows is a series of events that leads to a decision that will change all of their lives forever.

Tax Break

The Runaways is fiscally sponsored by From the Heart Productions enabling us to have a 501©3 tax status. From The Heart Productions funds films that are unique and make a contribution to society.  They fully support our film and highly recommend our production team for our skills and our dedication.

Visual Themes, Symbolism, and Thematic Placement


The Runaways is designed to heavily rely on symbols, sounds, and editing to control the emotional pacing of the film:  a montage of boiling water representing emotional overflow, two hands held together in blood represent a bond forged in shared trauma, a simple picture that describes an entire relationship.  These are some of the symbolic devices I use within the film.  Cinematically, characters will be represented by camera placement.  As Kellee’s decision becomes clearer, she becomes positioned center frame.  Her step-father, Dave, will always be seen in a low angle placement.  Kellee’s mother, Eileen, will have a skin tone compounded with bruises at various stages of healing. 

Why We Are Making The Runaways

Domestic abuse is something that affects everyone in some shape or form. I’m sure you know at least one person who has been a victim or abuser of domestic violence. I, too am no exception to this. The irony about domestic violence is that people are betrayed and hurt by those that they trust and love the most. I wanted to do something different and focus on empowerment. I didn’t want to glorify domestic violence without conveying strength. Because that is at the core of domestic violence advocacy.

In The Runaways the bond between James and Kellee is what allows them to carry on. These character portrayals are important to see.  Love in the face of adversity.  Support despite overwhelming odds. Personal sacrifice with a cost. We plan to take that idea into The Runaways – to break the mainstream discourse and stereotypes that sometimes follows victims of domestic violence. That they are weak, cowardly, and deserving of their punishment.  We understand that this subject matter is difficult, diverse, and off-putting.  It is our hope to expand the discussion about awareness of domestic violence with our film. 

Additional Sponsors

The Runaways is supported by the following Organizations. 

Domestic Violence Wears Many Tags


Break The Cycle 

Creative Edge Studio Collaborative

Our Team

Dewey Ortiz Jr.

Writer/Director

Dewey’s interest in film started after watching Spike Lee’s Malcom X and having a conversation with his family about it. Seven years later, while watching the film Fight Club during his senior year of high school, Dewey began to understand fully the power of film. He realized that movies could entertain, as well as serve as a medium to inspire change -- and his interest in filmmaking was thus solidified.

Dewey attended Howard University’s Graduate School of Film to sharpen his skills in film analysis, production and screenwriting, earning a Master of Fine Arts in Film. Along with Kendall Givens-Little, Dewey co-wrote the script for Comeuppance in 2011 and directed the film in 2012. Comeuppance was shown at numerous film festivals, including the Roxbury International Film Festival and the Action on Film International Film Festival.

In 2015 Dewey created and produced Survivor Stories a 4-part docuseries that is currently on YouTube and has gained over 4000 views.

Dewey wrote The Runaways in 2013 and will helm the film as director and co-producer.

Tia Goodson

Producer

Tia Michele Goodson received her Bachelors of Arts degree from Howard University. In 2010, after studying documentary film at The George Washington University, she began her career in film production.

Tia has worked on numerous narrative projects, but documentary is still near and dear to her heart. She is presently developing one set in Rio de Janeiro. Tia has worked on several feature films, commercials, TV shows, short films, live events and music videos for local and mainstream artists. She is featured in the documentary DMV Truth: Indie Film Artists, which was nominated for Best Documentary and Director at the Hot Media International Film Festival in 2013.

She has worked with clients as varied and distinguished as NFL Films, The Disney Channel, Adidas, Nike, Fox, the Presidential Inauguration, MLB and M&T Bank. She is most proud of her work as the Second Assistant Director on the film LUV, shot in Baltimore in 2011 and directed by fellow Baltimore native Sheldon Candis. LUV went to numerous film festivals, including Sundance.

Tia served as producer on the short film Comeuppance, which was nominated for Best Short at the San Francisco Black Film Festival in 2014 and various awards at other film festivals. She is excited about teaming up once again with DK Filmworks and producing The Runaways.

Angelica Hill

Associate Producer

Angelica is on a mission to assist DK Filmworks with coordinating local support for The Runaways. She loves assisting with the various outreach initiatives that could range from fundraising to on-set support. Angelica has both educational and real life experience related to all levels of media production and embraces opportunities to serve growing organizations while fostering her passion for multimedia production. In her free time, she is a freelance photographer and coordinator!

Risk Vs. Reward

There is always a risk supporting independent filmmaking.  And there is no proven successful guide to filmmaking.  However you are investing in a film that is a important story that addresses domestic abuse with has never been more prevalent.  You are also investing in a filmmaker and team that have two successful crowdfunding campaigns under their belt, and two successful films.  Comeuppance (2014) and Survivor Stories Docu-Series (2015).
story_txt:
Be A Part of The Runaways Team!

The Story
 
The Runaways tells the story of James and Kellee - two
teenagers whose love for one another has carried them through the nightmares of
growing up in abusive households.  James is aging out of the group home and the
plan is for him and Kellee to run away together, but the night before they are
supposed to run away, Kellee finds her mother
beaten unconscious and begins to have second thoughts about leaving her.  What follows is a series of events that
leads to a decision that will change all of their lives forever. 

Tax Break




The
Runaways is fiscally sponsored by From the Heart Productions enabling us to
have a 501©3 tax status. From The Heart Productions funds films that are unique
and make a contribution to society.  They fully support our film and
highly recommend our production team for our skills and our dedication.



Visual Themes, Symbolism, and Thematic Placement








The
Runaways is designed to heavily rely on symbols, sounds, and editing to control
the emotional pacing of the film:  a
montage of boiling water representing emotional overflow, two hands held
together in blood represent a bond forged in shared trauma, a simple picture
that describes an entire relationship.  These
are some of the symbolic devices I use within the film.  Cinematically, characters will be represented
by camera placement.  As Kellee’s
decision becomes clearer, she becomes positioned center frame.  Her step-father, Dave, will always be seen in
a low angle placement.  Kellee’s mother,
Eileen, will have a skin tone compounded with bruises at various stages of
healing.  
Why We Are Making The Runaways
 
Domestic abuse is something that affects everyone in some
shape or form. I’m sure you know at least one person who
has been a victim or abuser of domestic violence. I, too am
no exception to this. The irony about domestic violence is that people are
betrayed and hurt by those that they trust and love the most. I wanted to do
something different and focus on empowerment. I didn’t want to glorify
domestic violence without conveying strength. Because that is at the core of
domestic violence advocacy. 
In The Runaways the bond
between James and Kellee is what allows them to carry on. These character
portrayals are important to see.  Love in
the face of adversity.  Support despite
overwhelming odds. Personal sacrifice with a cost. We plan to take that idea
into The Runaways – to break the mainstream discourse and stereotypes that
sometimes follows victims of domestic violence. That they are weak, cowardly,
and deserving of their punishment.  We
understand that this subject matter is difficult, diverse, and
off-putting.  It is our hope to expand
the discussion about awareness of domestic violence with our film.  
  Additional Sponsors

The Runaways is supported by the following
Organizations.  



Domestic Violence
Wears Many Tags 




Break The Cycle  



Creative Edge Studio Collaborative

Tia Michele Goodson received her Bachelors of Arts degree
from Howard University. In 2010, after studying documentary film at The George
Washington University, she began her career in film production.
Tia has worked on numerous narrative projects, but
documentary is still near and dear to her heart. She is presently developing one set
in Rio de Janeiro. Tia has worked on several feature films, commercials, TV
shows, short films, live events and music videos for local and mainstream
artists. She is featured in the documentary DMV Truth: Indie Film Artists,
which was nominated for Best Documentary and Director at the Hot Media
International Film Festival in 2013.
She has worked with clients as varied and distinguished as
NFL Films, The Disney Channel, Adidas, Nike, Fox, the Presidential
Inauguration, MLB and M&T Bank. She is most proud of her work as the Second
Assistant Director on the film LUV, shot in Baltimore in 2011 and directed by
fellow Baltimore native Sheldon Candis. LUV went to numerous film festivals,
including Sundance.
Tia served as producer on the short film Comeuppance, which

free time, she is a freelance photographer and coordinator!
  Risk Vs. Reward
 

There is always a risk supporting independent filmmaking.  And there is no proven successful guide to
filmmaking.  However you are investing in a film that is a
important story that addresses domestic abuse with has never been more
prevalent.  You are also investing in a
filmmaker and team that have two successful crowdfunding campaigns under their
belt, and two successful films. 
Comeuppance (2014) and Survivor Stories Docu-Series (2015).

story:
Creating and sharing beauty is a passion and deep calling that has taken many forms in my life.  Over the last several years, photography has become a natural medium that seamlessly flows with my daily life as a mother.  Taking photos of the beauty around me brings me great joy.  After sharing my photos prolifically on social media for a long time, I am ready to share my images and work in more tangible ways- through portrait sessions, commissioned work, larger prints, framed pieces, teaching classes, exhibitions, and expanding my website to include a photography blog and active shop.  I am ready and I need support from people like you!

WHY INDIEGOGO?

Simply, because it works! Crowdfunding has become a popular and viable way to raise money and successfully create projects.  In today's world, it is really important for entrepreneurial artists like me without major funding or sponsors, to be able to rely on the support of people like you to start my business through pre-sales and patronage. YOU are my sponsor. With your support, I have the freedom to lay the foundation for a successful business.  As Indiegogo supporters, you will have access to prints of my work, receive periodic updates and, most importantly, be an ESSENTIAL part of the creation of my business.

MAKING OF MOTHER MOUNTAIN PHOTOGRAPHY

The biggest priority for me in growing my business is purchasing a new camera.  I've been making amazing images with iPhone cameras for years, and it's time to upgrade.  In order to get a quality camera and photo editing program, I am hoping to raise $2500.  You might notice though, that my goal is $8000.  The additional $5500 will go toward purchasing a tent and tables for vending, stocking up on frames, cards, and prints to exhibit and sell, and working with a top-notch marketing and branding company, Dream Inspired Design(DID).  DID will work closely with me over the span of 3-4 months to create a website home that welcomes visitors and helps me express and circulate my offerings. They will support me in synthesizing my vision, brand message and visual expression so that they are aligned and so my ideal customers and partner organizations are drawn to me. 

In an effort to give back to the beautiful mountains and valley I photograph, I will be giving 1% of each donation to Aspen Valley Land Trust, a local non profit working to permanently preserve open lands for agriculture, wildlife habitat, scenic enjoyment and recreation in the greater Roaring Fork and Colorado River valleys. 

I want to share with you my plan and vision:

$2500

Reaching this amount will allow me to purchase a professional camera and lens to take photos that I can turn into high quality, large prints.  The iPhone cameras I have been using for years, have allowed me to create beautiful images, but limit my printing size because of the low resolution.  A professional camera will open up so many doors for me in terms of image and print quality.  Additionally, if this amount is raised, I will be able to purchase Adobe Lightroom for editing my photos on my computer.

$6500

Hitting these numbers will pay for the camera, as described above, PLUS 4 months of one-on-one work with Dream Inspired Design to create a powerful website and brand expression.

$8000

This is my goal!  If I reach this level, I'll be able to have a solid foundation for creating my business with the camera, website, and branding described above, PLUS funds to purchase a tent & tables for vending, as well as materials for printing and framing my work.  How beautiful would that be?!

******

I hope you are feeling as excited and inspired about this as I am, I would really love to be able to bring my images and work to the world in the best way possible and to do that I need your help.

THE REWARDS

I hope you will take a moment to look over the sweet packages I have put together.

magnets

mini prints

cards

framed prints

1% of all contributions donated to Aspen Valley Land Trust

I have 30 days to reach this $8000 goal, so I appreciate anything you can do to spread the word, whether it's reposting on FACEBOOK, creating a post on INSTAGRAM, sending an EMAIL to your friends and family, mentioning it in your BLOG, or telling a neighbor. I'm so grateful for any help in getting the word out. Thank you from the bottom of my heart for sharing!

With love,

Katherine 

www.katherinedessertphotography.com

www.instagram.com/katherinedessert

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

It is vulnerable to reach out and ask for help. I truly believe in this project and am ready to share my images and photography with my community and world. Thank you for helping me! There is always a process to starting a business and I may encounter setbacks.  With a solid foundation and a strong support team (YOU ALL!), I feel confident I can overcome any challenges that come my way.

story:
This will be the first ever Art Book that I've ever published!

I'm collecting up all of my favorite drawings, sketches, paintings, and illustrations that I've done in my entire creative career, so far, and putting them together in a single collection for your viewing and owning pleasure!

Some of the Book Specs are:

  • Approximately 8"x10.5"
  • Shooting for a Minimum of 70, Full Color Interior Pages.
  • Approximately 1/4 inch thick.

Since this is going to be an IndieGoGo exclusive print-run, I'll be signing each and every book sold. Maybe it will be worth a bunch of money someday, who knows!?

How Exclusive is it?

Once this campaign is totally fulfilled, this exact Art Book will NEVER be re-printed again.

Elements, such as the cover art, were created especially for this print-run and will never be re-used as they appear in this book. Some of the more personal touches, such as the commentary that I've added to almost every page, will also never be reproduced in another print run. 

Even if I were to include some of the artwork featured in this book in another collection at another time, the commentary and format would be different. Making this particular Art Book extra special. If you miss out on this campaign, you've missed out on this book.

I'll be numbering and signing all of the books before shipping, so you'll be extra sure that you've got something special.

The Goal

My primary goal, with this campaign, is to get about 25 of these exclusive Art Books into the hands of people who will enjoy them! The secondary goal is to make sure I can keep my website up and running for another year & fund the development and promotion of my comic book project, TROLLSMASHER.

If, by some random miracle, I end up having an overly successful campaign I would like to use the extra fund to support other indie creators and their projects. I like helping support people in similar positions to myself because it makes me feel good about myself. Call me selfish.

Risks & Challenges

With any campaign of this nature, there are risks involved and challenges to be overcome.

Risks:

  • There is a chance that something goes wrong with the print order, or formatting - which would cause delays.
  • There is a risk that I have done the math wrong, and I end up losing money on this endeavor.

Challenges:

  • This is my first major crowdfunding endeavor, I'm not sure that I know what I'm doing.
  • Campaigns like this depend on promo and marketing to succeed, I suck at that.

You'll notice that "The book might not happen" is not on the list of risks. That is because the majority of content that will be featured in the book is already completed work in my archive. That means that all that needs to be done in order for something to be able to go to print and be sent out to backers is for the images to be formatted correctly for the printers. Meaning, even if there is a risk of delay, there is no risk that fulfillment won't occur. In fact, any potential delays aren't at risk of being more than a few weeks - we aren't talking months here.

That stands, even if I end up realizing I have goofed the math and have to pay out of pocket for some of this. I'm learning here - but I won't be letting my supporters suffer because of that.

Pages in Progress

I've already begun formatting the pages to be ready for print. I'm hoping to keep on top of it all and get this book jam-packed with as much of my artwork as possible.

Other Ways You Can Support the Art Book!

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help!

Here's how:

  • Use the Social Share buttons on this Campaign page to Spread the word, FAR AND WIDE, about the Art Book!
  • Make sure you're following Leanore on social media to stay updated on other ways to help!

story:
All the new changes to Chip and Terra would take the entire experience to a whole new level of interactivity and enchantment. The many burners who told us about their amazing and wonderful experiences on B.Y.T.E. last burn will be elated to see how those experiences will be enhanced this year through a stroke of whimsy and a touch of love.

Here's our prioritized wish list of all our dream upgrades that will require a small fortune to be able to accomplish. 

Getting the piece there is top priority and this is one of the biggest costs. If you’ve ever tried to rent transportation to the playa, you’ve encountered a disdain some of these companies harbor for Burning Man that allows them to gouge their normal rental fees, so we must secure enough funds for the worst case scenario.

We will need to rent this 15’ box truck for close to 3weeks, since the piece will be coming from our storage in Napa Valley California, while also accounting for build and strike days.

Chip and Terra's virgin year in deep playa had them side by side as they soaked up and analyzed the whole experience for the very first time.

This year, they will be piggy back as they fully embrace the freedom and radical self expression of Burning Man, exuding a playfulness and unbridled immersion.

Chip and Terra, like a butterfly, will break out of their cocoon and evolve into new colorful and expressive fur coats, embracing the radical self expression of veteran burners. 

This year, in addition to our mirrored disco eyes, we are looking to line their fur with net lighting to illuminate their coats in a variety of different colors and patterns.

After the frustrating complications using generators on the playa last year we will be switching to Solar. Not only is Solar clean, renewable energy, but it also further embraces our technological concept. 

Underneath Chip and Terra will be cozy hangouts for lovable burners. 

Terra's belly will be lined with vibrant fur, illuminated by a heart shaped disco ball, for a comfy trip in deep playa.

Chip's belly will offer an artificial hanging garden of colorful leaves, vines and flowers, as well as a cargo net bed, made of power cords, for lazy days out of the beating afternoon sun. At night, the garden will be lit up with multi-colored ambient light.

For Chip's eyes this year, we’ve discovered that, if you nest the mirrored lenses, the effect of the laser beams bouncing around inside produces a mesmerizing universe of light. For that reason, we will be getting Chip larger mirrored lenses to place on top of his existing eyes to give us that awesome solar system light show.

In addition to Chip and Terra’s voices when activated by our Ai vision kit, these speakers will allow the them to play some ambient and foot loose beats in between. We've compiled thoughtful playlists that should ultimately enhance the experience of the livable spaces underneath as well as the danceable spaces up top.

Last year we equipped Chip with an AIY vision kit, allowing him to see and respond to objects and emotional cues. This year, in addition to seeing and speaking, we would like to take it a step further by giving him the ability to hear, as well.

We noticed last year that, while Chip and Terra were the coziest chill out spots, their back's could’ve been even a tad softer. This year we will underlay the fur with cushy carpet padding, making sure your sunsets are the coziest and most magical!

Along with their Ai, we are looking for more fun ways for Chip and Terra to interact with fellow burners. This audio transducer, in conjunction with a haptic-tactile response pad, will allow Chip to vibrate or “purr” when he’s pet in his favorite spots.

The steel cutout BYTE placard helps spectators or participants understand the concept and the various ways in which they may interact with the installation. At night, the stenciled story will be backlit.

After touring BYTE around this year, our hardware is going to need some updating and replacing. In addition, having Terra piggy back Chip is going to take a little more engineering to make sure they’re fun and safe.

Our intention last year was to make one ponder the possibility of a world where robots are not necessarily our enemies or slaves but rather our friends and, to do this, we created giant friendly and furry robots for people to play with. The impact was beyond our expectations.

This year we would like to continue the premise of a potentially peaceful co-existence between human kind and technology by adding a playfulness and whimsy to Chip and Terra that will have your heart instantly flutter with love.

While there are many challenges we face this year, our team has proven to make the seemingly impossible possible last year. Here are the major challenges we've already started tackling.

  • Fur Lighting
    • Lighting the fur will require some methodical research into lighting options that will be bright enough to shine through the fur, tough enough to withstand the crowds and programmable to bring the fun! We've already found some extremely promising solutions, including programmable net and panel lighting.
  • Solar Power
    • The playa can be unforgiving and we will have to be cognizant of the dust cover and sun exposure. We will have a maintenance crew on shifts to dust the panels and, if the sun cover is ineffective, turn on our backup generator.
  • Build Team and Crew
    • This year is an "off" year for a handful of our dedicated crew as they deal with their default world lives, so finding a crew able to take off the time needed to build, maintain and strike will be challenging but we've already begun adding to our family!

We know it's incredibly difficult to let go of your hard earned money, even if it gets ya a cool new necklace, so here are some other ways you may help us if you're psyched about our project but car insurance is a bigger priority.  Either way, we appreciate you and send good vibes your way!

  • Follow us on Instagram @CampByteThis
  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign to anyone who may be interested.
  • Share our campaign on any of your social media accounts with love.

And that's all there is to it.

Heaps of free love and good vibes,

The B.Y.T.E. Team
story_txt:
All the new changes to Chip and Terra would take the entire experience to a whole new level of interactivity and enchantment. The many burners who told us about their amazing and wonderful experiences on B.Y.T.E. last burn will be elated to see how those experiences will be enhanced this year through a stroke of whimsy and a touch of love.
Here's our prioritized wish list of all our dream upgrades that will require a small fortune to be able to accomplish. 

Getting the piece there is top priority and this is one of the biggest costs. If you’ve ever tried to rent transportation to the playa, you’ve encountered a disdain some of these companies harbor for Burning Man that allows them to gouge their normal rental fees, so we must secure enough funds for the worst case scenario.
We will need to rent this 15’ box truck for close to 3weeks, since the piece will be coming from our storage in Napa Valley California, while also accounting for build and strike days.

Chip and Terra's virgin year in deep playa had them side by side as they soaked up and analyzed the whole experience for the very first time.
This year, they will be piggy back as they fully embrace the freedom and radical self expression of Burning Man, exuding a playfulness and unbridled immersion.
Chip and Terra, like a butterfly, will break out of their cocoon and evolve into new colorful and expressive fur coats, embracing the radical self expression of veteran burners. 



This year, in addition to our mirrored disco eyes, we are looking to line their fur with net lighting to illuminate their coats in a variety of different colors and patterns.

After the frustrating complications using generators on the playa last year we will be switching to Solar. Not only is Solar clean, renewable energy, but it also further embraces our technological concept. 

Underneath Chip and Terra will be cozy hangouts for lovable burners. 
Terra's belly will be lined with vibrant fur, illuminated by a heart shaped disco ball, for a comfy trip in deep playa.
Chip's belly will offer an artificial hanging garden of colorful leaves, vines and flowers, as well as a cargo net bed, made of power cords, for lazy days out of the beating afternoon sun. At night, the garden will be lit up with multi-colored ambient light.

For Chip's eyes this year, we’ve discovered that, if you nest the mirrored lenses, the effect of the laser beams bouncing around inside produces a mesmerizing universe of light. For that reason, we will be getting Chip larger mirrored lenses to place on top of his existing eyes to give us that awesome solar system light show.
In addition to Chip and Terra’s voices when activated by our Ai vision kit, these speakers will allow the them to play some ambient and foot loose beats in between. We've compiled thoughtful playlists that should ultimately enhance the experience of the livable spaces underneath as well as the danceable spaces up top.

Last year we equipped Chip with an AIY vision kit, allowing him to see and respond to objects and emotional cues. This year, in addition to seeing and speaking, we would like to take it a step further by giving him the ability to hear, as well.

We noticed last year that, while Chip and Terra were the coziest chill out spots, their back's could’ve been even a tad softer. This year we will underlay the fur with cushy carpet padding, making sure your sunsets are the coziest and most magical!
Along with their Ai, we are looking for more fun ways for Chip and Terra to interact with fellow burners. This audio transducer, in conjunction with a haptic-tactile response pad, will allow Chip to vibrate or “purr” when he’s pet in his favorite spots.

The steel cutout BYTE placard helps spectators or participants understand the concept and the various ways in which they may interact with the installation. At night, the stenciled story will be backlit.
After touring BYTE around this year, our hardware is going to need some updating and replacing. In addition, having Terra piggy back Chip is going to take a little more engineering to make sure they’re fun and safe.


Our intention last year was to make one ponder the possibility of a world where robots are not necessarily our enemies or slaves but rather our friends and, to do this, we created giant friendly and furry robots for people to play with. The impact was beyond our expectations.
This year we would like to continue the premise of a potentially peaceful co-existence between human kind and technology by adding a playfulness and whimsy to Chip and Terra that will have your heart instantly flutter with love.


While there are many challenges we face this year, our team has proven to make the seemingly impossible possible last year. Here are the major challenges we've already started tackling.

Fur LightingLighting the fur will require some methodical research into lighting options that will be bright enough to shine through the fur, tough enough to withstand the crowds and programmable to bring the fun! We've already found some extremely promising solutions, including programmable net and panel lighting.

Solar PowerThe playa can be unforgiving and we will have to be cognizant of the dust cover and sun exposure. We will have a maintenance crew on shifts to dust the panels and, if the sun cover is ineffective, turn on our backup generator.

Build Team and CrewThis year is an "off" year for a handful of our dedicated crew as they deal with their default world lives, so finding a crew able to take off the time needed to build, maintain and strike will be challenging but we've already begun adding to our family!




We know it's incredibly difficult to let go of your hard earned money, even if it gets ya a cool new necklace, so here are some other ways you may help us if you're psyched about our project but car insurance is a bigger priority.  Either way, we appreciate you and send good vibes your way!

Follow us on Instagram @CampByteThis

Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign to anyone who may be interested.
Share our campaign on any of your social media accounts with love.

And that's all there is to it.Heaps of free love and good vibes,The B.Y.T.E. Team

story:
My name is Ant and I'm an artist who is passionate about creating political and controversial art. This is what I specialize in, however, I also do pop art style paintings too. I believe I have something for everyone, and that art is powerful. 



I do what I do, not only to deliver a message and create something meaningful - but I want to get a reaction out of what I illustrate. Any reaction is a good reaction.  
I have hustled hard and made what some people call a hobby - my business. Art even got me off the streets 6 years ago when I was homeless. I don't believe in feeling sorry for myself in a situation like that, so I used my creativity to pick myself back up. 

I am not only an artist but a salesman, and that is what I have been doing the past few years, going out into the world and selling my art to people from all over. But I believe that this business is about to get bigger, and that's where you come in. 

I plan to have my first major solo exhibition in New York next spring 2020 for just over a week, and I need your help and investment to make it happen. The show is called The First Amendment Exhibition because I believe in free speech ESPECIALLY through creativity. 
The exhibition will involve all kinds of paintings and installations that may shock the audience, and due to the political nature of many of my paintings - 2020 next year is a perfect time to showcase to the public. I think you know why... 

"Art should comfort the disturbed and disturb the comfortable." - Cesar A. Cruz
 

I need roughly $6000 to put on my 10-day exhibition in New York. 



A rough breakdown of expenses: 
Manhattan venue - $3300 
Marketing and promotion -$850 
Merch - $1400
Security - $200
Miscellaneous (decor, refreshments, music) - $250


To say thank you for your kind contributions to this project, I have a variety of perks available. You can choose from a range of collectible postcards, prints and t-shirts, or a custom painting for a generous investment. As I have said before, I have something for everyone. 



But the biggest perk of all - is that you have enabled this exhibition and project to come to life! And for that I will be forever grateful. I create for YOU, for the world. 
I will update all of you along the way with this campaign and journey of planning the show. 
For those of you able to make it to New York next spring for this exhibition, I look forward to seeing you. 
 

I know some people may not be able to contribute and invest, however you definitely can help by getting the word out and making some noise about this campaign. 
Sharing this campaign (using the Indiegogo share tool) would mean a lot and be a great help in making this exhibition happen. Thanks! 

 

Follow me on social media: @ant_the_artist

story:
A portal leading to divine order

 

OVERVIEW

ETZNAB is a sound-reactive lighingt installation, In which the space is arranged in the same way as many archeological sites of the Mesoamerican primitive cultures, such as Maya, Kiva, Mexican, Caliguey, Huichól, Otomí, etc.

The principal totem in the center, with the other four elements that are distributed in a circle & aligned in the directions of the compass (N, S, E, W).  will be constructed with reflective mirror panels, which will make it a non-invasive installation integrated with the landscape of the desert.

Ceremony

Lighting & Sound interactive area. A closer view of the elements in the world within ourselves   

More images on https://www.instagram.com/etznab_installation/​

 

SOUND ART

The unique audio design complements the experience of the Installation. The soundtrack exclusively created by VAA along with close friends from the music label internationally Known: Produce Ambient, Drone, Noise, Chill & Experimental music. Deadbeat, Oni-Ki, Isaac Soto, Matanza, Quixosis, Mondragon, Jiony, Undo, Un Reve, Huaira and more.

International Musicians such as  Matanza (Chi), Quixosis (Ecu), Oni-Ki (It-Ger), UNDO (Esp) & Huaira (Ecu) to name a few  among Mexican musicians like Roderic, Mendrix, Jiony , Isaac Soto , LEN from VAA family are invited to make this soundtrack possible . 

The piece will be interacting through the day with the astral cycle of the cosmos, inviting the viewer to connect with the music, lights and art for a personal an comunal unforgivable experience.

Soundtrack from VAA artists —

https://vaariosartistas.bandcamp.com/

The special feature of our light installation, has the ability to react to the sound from an external source. Whether it is vocals of a visitor singing in the space, sounds of acoustic instruments or an audio stream from an art car. ETZNAB becomes a conflux of all the elements of its environment, merged with each other into a single harmony.

SOUND TAKEOVER

The Black Rock citizens will be invited to attend the ceremonies at 4 different hours during the days of Burning Man at each cardinal point — to greet one of the elements:

6am . East . Air - 12pm . North . Earth . - 6pm . West . Water - 12am . South . Fire

Special Burning Man sound set schedule TBA. Follow us on Facebook & Instagram !

In addition to the scheduled sound sets, we're preparing a special gift for the Burning Man community.  We want to endow to the burners cruising through the playa on their Art Car a unique opportunity to conduct their own ceremony inside The Temple of Mirrors,  that can be reactive exclusively to the sound from an art car.

*Please, support our campaign with a donation and make sure to contact us in advance to arrange your private ceremony at ETZNAB.*

 

WHO IS BEHIND THIS PROJECT?

Concept : Jorge Bof I Camilo Quimbayo I Marco Arredondo
Executive Producer : Jorge Bof
Design: Marco Arredondo I Proyecto Gam 
Manufacture : Proyecto Gam 
Lighting Design : Filmi I Joan Zuriguel 
Documentation & Film : Filmi
Soundtrack: VAA

 

LINKS

  • http://etznab.mx
  • https://proyectogam.com
  • http://www.fil-mi.com

EMAIL us if you have any questions hola@etznab.mx

https://www.vice.com/amp/es_latam/article/6vede9/escucha-el-primer-compilado-de-vaa-el-sello-de-jiony

 

Fulfilling Our Plan 

Your collaboration will help us conclude with the drawings, develop layouts to built the main structures, manufacture & assemble the art installation, ensure safety, develop the programming of lighting & the sound on its highest quality. Also you will be supporting with transportation from Mexico City to Black Rock Desert in the US and back.

 

ETZNAB PROJECT COSTS  

Full scale project goals 20,000 to 30,000 USD

Farther More, actualizing this project will not only bring the latin community of artist into the international arena but will also expand & teach other communities about our cultures.
