story:
Let's Fix Social Media

My name is Howard. I am an Atlanta, Georgia based entrepreneur and the founder of TRXBE. TRXBE is social media app that connects people based on shared interests. We are focused on building an engaging product that users will love.

Over the past few years I have been thinking a lot about social media and how it is tearing at the fabric of civil society. Issues related to abusive algorithms, the proliferation of fake news and conspiracy theories, hate speech, political divisiveness, thought bubbles, foreign interference in U.S elections, privacy concerns, and aggressive advertising have become difficult to ignore. I believe that tech-companies such as Facebook and Twitter are largely responsible for the elevated discord that now permeates our digital-global-village. I think we need to do better.

 

TRXBE's Mission

TRXBE's mission is to remediate the negative aspects of social media. As we build the TRXBE app, everything we do is viewed thru this lens.

 

About The TRXBE App

On TRXBE, you create and maintain lists in categories such as your favorite movies, albums, books, bands, and television shows. Once you populates your lists, TRXBE functions like a social search engine. Show me people; age (25-35), gender (male), location (<10 miles from 30303), that likes movies (Shawshank Redemption, Forrest Gump, Best In Show) AND bands (The Clash, Elvis Costello, Beastie Boys). TRXBE makes is possible for anyone, no matter who you are or where you go, to find your TRXBE.

 

How is TRXBE Different?

The following are some ways that TRXBE differs from other social media apps:

Our Business Model - We think social media was ruined when it tied its wagon to an advertising based business model. This caused social media companies to switch their focus from connecting individuals to connecting people with marketers - who want to sell us things or influence our opinions. TRXBE will pursue a different business model - one that enhances our user experience and does not provide tools to 3rd parties that they can use to weaponize our platform.

No Business Accounts - TRXBE is for individuals and will not host business accounts.

No Political Ads - TRXBE will not host political Ads.

3rd Party Ads - The only 3rd party ads you see in your newsfeed are ones you opt-in to.

The People You Need To Know - On TRXBE, you can only find and connect with people who share your interests. That is why we say, "Facebook is for the people you know. TRXBE is for the people you need to know."

 

Accomplishments Made To Date

Concept - The concept and business plan for TRXBE have been conceived and documented.

Branding - We have created a visual identity for TRXBE.

Design - We have designed the TRXBE app's screens, functions, and interactions.

Functional Prototypes - We have created and revised numerous interactive prototypes. 

Visibility & Marketing - TRXBE is building our audience by creating and distributing content via our website and old-school social media platforms.

  • Website - https://trxbe.io
  • Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/trxbe.io
  • Instagram - https://www.instagram.com/trxbe.io
  • Twitter - https://https://twitter.com/trxbeapp
  • Medium - https://https://trxbeapp.medium.com

 

How You Can Help?

We hope you will support our mission by contributing to TRXBE's crowdfunding campaign. Building an app requires capital for development and marketing expenses. Creating the first iteration of the TRXBE app will require $70,000. Funds raised in excess of $70,000 will be allocated towards launching the app and acquiring our first users. 

 

What's In It For You

Our goal for this crowdfunding campaign is to create a win-win situation for TRXBE as well as our supporters. If our campaign is successful, TRXBE will receive the funding we need to finish and launch our app. In return, we want to make sure our supporters are truly rewarded. We have accomplished this by offering perks that are highly collectible, insanely cool, and available exclusively via TRXBE's Indiegogo fundraising effort.

 

Help Us Spread The Word

The success of TRXBE's crowdfunding campaign depends on getting the word out to as many people as possible. Here are some ways you can support our efforts to build a better and less toxic future for social media.

  • Join Our Mailing List - Go to our website at https://trxbe.io and sign-up for our email mailing list.
  • Follow Us On Social Media - Like and follow TRXBE on old-school-social-media.
  • Tell Your Friends - Tell your friends about TRXBE's crowdfunding effort by sharing the link https://igg.me/at/trxbe

 

Thank You For Your Support

Our campaign has some really cool rewards. We hope that you find something to love. You get art, a t-shirt, or some decorative magnets. We get funded and fix social media. Thank you for your support.

story:
ABOUT US

At GlobalGeniuses, we are developing an innovative digital art manager that provides users in the art space with resources and tools to help them personally and independently manage and market their artwork and facilitate the exposure needed through various collaboration opportunities between artists' art collectors, art enthusiasts, and more.

GlobalGeniuses’ goal is to provide a space where artists can increase their opportunities through networking, actively sell or rent their artwork, and showcase their artwork globally through the platform’s designed Live Virtual Exhibition tool.

The platform will provide a matchmaking feature that will enable users to connect with exactly the type of collaborators, tools, and resources they seek.

The platform also seeks to engage, nurture, and empower emerging artists. GlobalGeniuses will also use its services to develop young talent, so Art becomes an option for a full-time career, not a path creative people have to put on hold due to the limited opportunities in the industry.

What We Need & Why

In Phase 1 of Development, we are raising 7,000€ to build and market a Virtual Live Exhibition feature, where artists can show their work -- and art enthusiasts can view it from the comfort of their personal spaces.

By January 2022, we plan to have over 10,000 subscribed members, and by July 2023, we hope to have 400,000 subscribed members for artists, art enthusiasts, and art collectors!

ABOUT THE FOUNDER

GlobalGeniuses is the brainchild of Rangtiem Hoomkwap. She is a mother of two beautiful boys and an engineer with an undying passion for art and creativity. When she was younger, she reached a crossroads in her life. Go to music school and express her art, or go the traditional career route?

She reluctantly chose to follow a career in engineering and gave up on her dream of being an artist due to a lack of exposure, funding, and support in the art industries. Sadly, this is a common story amongst artists worldwide. Only a few manage to pursue art as their career.

New and veteran artists alike struggle with the same barriers such as high gallery commissions, insufficient/lack of connections in the art space, getting their artwork in front of a global audience, and struggle to market themselves to art collectors, businesses, or art enthusiasts.

This got her thinking...What if there was a platform that was intuitive, easy to use and focused solely on making genuine connections and collaborations between artists and those in the business of art? She was dreaming of a digital art management hub that helps manage artists careers efficiently, effectively, and creatively.

Fast forward to 2020… she took her big idea and figured out a way to do just that! With the platform’s innovative and unique matchmaking process, GlobalGeniuses connects you with users around the world. Resulting in career and business boosting collaborations.

There are so many ways to help!

  • Donate today to help up-coming artists gain exposure globally!
  • Join our growing network of artists, art enthusiasts, and art collectors at www.globalgeniuses.art
  • Give us a like on social media, You can find us on Instagram @Global.Geniuses or on Facebook @GlobalGeniuses.
  • Share this campaign with friends, family, and colleagues!
story_txt:
ABOUT US
At GlobalGeniuses, we are developing an innovative digital art manager that provides users in the art space with resources and tools to help them personally and independently manage and market their artwork and facilitate the exposure needed through various collaboration opportunities between artists' art collectors, art enthusiasts, and more.
GlobalGeniuses’ goal is to provide a space where artists can increase their opportunities through networking, actively sell or rent their artwork, and showcase their artwork globally through the platform’s designed Live Virtual Exhibition tool.
The platform will provide a matchmaking feature that will enable users to connect with exactly the type of collaborators, tools, and resources they seek.
The platform also seeks to engage, nurture, and empower emerging artists. GlobalGeniuses will also use its services to develop young talent, so Art becomes an option for a full-time career, not a path creative people have to put on hold due to the limited opportunities in the industry.

What We Need & Why
In Phase 1 of Development, we are raising 7,000€ to build and market a Virtual Live Exhibition feature, where artists can show their work -- and art enthusiasts can view it from the comfort of their personal spaces.
By January 2022, we plan to have over 10,000 subscribed members, and by July 2023, we hope to have 400,000 subscribed members for artists, art enthusiasts, and art collectors!

This got her thinking...What if there was a platform that was intuitive, easy to use and focused solely on making genuine connections and collaborations between artists and those in the business of art? She was dreaming of a digital art management hub that helps manage artists careers efficiently, effectively, and creatively.
Fast forward to 2020… she took her big idea and figured out a way to do just that! With the platform’s innovative and unique matchmaking process, GlobalGeniuses connects you with users around the world. Resulting in career and business boosting collaborations.

There are so many ways to help!

Donate today to help up-coming artists gain exposure globally!
Join our growing network of artists, art enthusiasts, and art collectors at www.globalgeniuses.art

Give us a like on social media, You can find us on Instagram @Global.Geniuses or on Facebook @GlobalGeniuses.
Share this campaign with friends, family, and colleagues!

story:
Boogiezone Forever: The end is actually the beginning...

 

INTRODUCING EPICENTER ARTS + ENTERTAINMENT 

For 20 years, Boogiezone has supported others in discovering their passion for the arts. We have served as a platform for communication and a way for artists to inspire one another across the globe. Boogiezone is a movement and an idea that has grown and evolved into a multitude of opportunities that have allowed and encouraged thousands upon thousands of dancers to pursue their dreams in an unapologetic and powerful way. Boogiezone indeed bridges dreams to reality.

Eager to emerge with resilience from the pandemic, we are ready to respond to our true calling — to go beyond dance, and provide a space into the intergalactic matrix of all artistic mediums. That is why we are transforming into the all-new Epicenter Arts + Entertainment. THE STARS ARE ALIGNED. We invite you to immerse yourself in our galaxy, a one-of-a-kind, interactive creative arts playground.

Guided by our collaborative spirit and artistic roots, Boogiezone will remain the beating heart of our creative sanctuary that has given us the vitality needed up until now to withstand the pandemic. Our vision is to continue down the path of opening our doors to all creatives established by Boogiezone in hopes of stimulating the mind, body, and spirit while reaching artistic potential through creative exchange. The new Epicenter universe is a synergistic journey of all we will offer: rehearsal space, photography and video, styling, hair & make up, performance arts and more. 

 

WHO AM I

My name is Elm Pizarro, I am 47 years old, born in Seattle and currently living in Long Beach California. I am an artist in every sense of the word. A designer, a dancer, choreographer, director, producer, educator, innovator, entrepreneur, and creator. Ultimately, I am driven by my passion for community building and my love for dance. I left a stable career in architecture to pursue an endeavor I felt as would be most impactful. No regrets. Since 2001, I have worked relentlessly to serve my purpose in helping others bridge their dreams to reality by creating a virtual and physical platform of inspiration known globally as “Boogiezone!”
 

BOOGIEZONE'S PASSIONATE JOURNEY SO FAR

For many years we have struggled to operate our 14K sq. ft. building in old town Torrance, CA with little to no resources other than our love for the dance community, countless caring volunteers, and a ton of perseverance.

All that glitters, is not gold. Our 1920’s building is in poor condition and is in need of some massive repair. Upgrading to full A/C from no A/C in January of 2020, we still have major electrical concerns and plumbing issues in this old building we call home. We don't deserve the staff we have who frequently clean up floods, snake the drains and flip breaker switches! And although looks aren't everything, after 12 years of calling this space home, its still a bit of a sore spot that we never had a sign that bears our name on the front. 

Culminating in March of 2018, we endured several unfortunate circumstances (tax issues and fraud) that made our studios journey exponentially more difficult. We never missed a rent payment until this happened to us and five months later in August 2018 we received a formal 3-day notice to either pay $30,000 of missing/late payments owed to the building owner or be forced to vacate our studio home. Jolted by the fear of losing our space we humbled ourselves and asked for help from our dance network.

Thanks to our wonderful, supportive and creative community worldwide, we experienced a very eye opening thing - we were REMINDED of how much we were loved. We reached our goal and the best lesson this circumstance could ever teach us. From that point on we were dedicated to the beauty of the business and worked collectively like a little village. We recommitted ourselves to never giving up and sought the help of expert advisors/professionals. We were blessed to have another opportunity to understand how important it was to properly sustain and run a business in order to thrive for our dancers and ultimately our purpose. Thank you once more global Boogiezone community for showing us that we mattered. It’s because of you we are at another critical junction in our history of a brand!


THE END IS ALSO THE BEGINNING

From January to March 2020 we experienced rapid growth, and transformed our struggling business into a wonderful system of teachers, staff, partners and students. We were a family, and loved everything about where we were heading. Financially, we were at our most stable and growing comfortably. It finally felt like we were gaining ground on ourselves.

This period was short lived when the Covid-19 pandemic shut downs began in March 2020. As you know - the entire world came to a grinding halt and so did all of the physical energy swirling around us. Just when we thought we were making progress, our new way of doing things was out the door. We were sad to see so many of our community friends who owned creative facilities and dance studios shut down one by one. We understood how this could happen and it has been gut wrenching to witness. Not even a fundraiser or a PPP loan could save us! The pandemic and the inevitable financial burden that would ensue would have been way too much for any business to bear, and for those who were logical and smart made the difficult decision to close and count their losses as a blessing. It was so challenging to see how the pandemic affected our community - we were at a crossroads. Should we fight to stay open once more? At what cost?

Today June 12, 2021, we have been physically shut down for over an entire year. We remain optimistic and grateful - our community is still here encouraging us! As difficult as it was to continue on in the face of the adversities of the pandemic - we do see the light at the end of the tunnel. A miraculous rainbow one!

So much has transpired in this time of emptiness and clearing. Our space has been able to rest, and our team has been able to reset our intention with a renewed unwavering spirit. We are still here, working to keep the dream alive!

 

THE PROPOSED TRANSFORMATION

 

Help us to sustain and strengthen our beautiful platform that is Boogiezone and help us to evolve it into its next great version in order to secure it for future generations to come! We need your help to make Epicenter Arts + Entertainment a reality and launch our dreams into the next galaxy. 

Boogiezone Utopia currently rents a 14K sq. ft. studio in Torrance, CA. We'd like to buy out the building and expand it to include an additional 9K sq. ft. of space to offer more creative opportunities and spaces to have individuals expand their creative horizons. 


OUR GOALS

1. $111,000: The biggest and most immediate need we have is to pay backed rent/fees on our building. Our goal is to purchase the entire building and we need this first goal so that we can remain in contention for acquiring the building.

2. $400.000: We are looking for start up capital/seed money to help us hire personnel and equipment and establish the infrastructure of Epicenter.

This will allow us to gain access to tools and technology that will eventually lead us to even more sustainable resources and venture capital. We believe this will guide us towards finding the right investors or enable them to find us easier. We need assistance with building a marketing campaign that will help transmit and send our message to the world loud and clear.

3. $5.75 Million: This will help us purchase the 23K sq. ft. building (of which we currently occupy 14K sq. ft.) and the 1-acre parcel of land (and parking lot) that our amazing building lives on.

We are in a prime re-development area of old town Torrance situated in the South Bay of Los Angeles, and are so excited to help create a new vision for the city now that Toyota has relocated. We need more arts and opportunity to share it, and what more perfect place than exit 34!

4. $11 Million: We have designed and created the most EPIC vision for the CENTER, and have only the best and brightest collaborators in a multitude of disciplines already on board to help bring this dream to fruition. This includes our costs for a complete overhaul of the building, reconstruction and everything in it needed to launch Epicenter. 

 

CONTRIBUTOR GIFTS

Contributors who support the Epicenter vision are eligible for:

Selenite // Strength + Support = $0 - $99 (Good Vibes)
Rose Quartz // Love = $100 (Epicenter T-Shirt)
Turquoise // Healing = $250 (One Week All Access Class Pass at Epicenter)
Tigers Eye // Harmonizing = $500 (Engraved Recognition on Contributors Plaque on Display in Gallery)
Jasper // Empowering = $1000 (Staircase Step Dedication "Community Climb")
Moonstone // Inner Growth & New Beginnings = $5000+ (Room Dedication)
Aqua Aura Quartz // Prosperity, Wealth, and Success = (Percentage Share - Contact Us)

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

We are always looking for volunteers and contributors to arts projects and education. If you can't donate financially, consider reaching out to donate your time and resources to our cause! 

Please share this information with potential contributors and help us spread the word about Epicenter and what we are trying to do here! For more information on how you can help, visit our website as epicenterarts.com or check out our social: @EpicenterArts

story:
We want to bring the crafts of Mexico to the world through the most spectacular beings: Our pets!

Handmade by Oaxaca and Puebla artisan communities. Each collar needs approximately 3 meters of omega thread and 1 to 8 days of work.

What makes Bacanito's collars unique? 

1. There is no two similar Bacanito's collars because each design is unique.

2. Your pet's information engraved by laser on the buckle of its collar to avoid lost tag plates and to protect your pet's ears: The constant ringing of the traditional tags can damage their ears. 

How to know which size is my pet? 

To be 100% sure of the size of your pet, measure its neck.

Big Collar 

For a neck from 15,7 to 22,8 inches. 

Breed references: Labrador, Pitbull, Shepherds, San Bernardo, Great Danes.

Medium Collar 

For a neck from 11,8 to 15,7 inches. 

Breed references: Schnauzer, Beagle, Pug.

Small Collar 

For a neck from 8.6 to 11 inches. 

Breed references: Chihuahua, Yorkies, Mini schnauzer, puppies, cats. 

How do I acquire these products?

1. Back this Project: Select the reward tier you would like to pledge on the right side of this page. 

As you can see, each size has a different cost, so there are infinite possibilities of combinations. For example: 2 small collars+1 big; 3 mediums + 1 small, etc, etc.

We don´t want to bore you with so many perks, so please select any contribution and then we will give you a link in which you will be able to exchange your contribution for your product(s). If you want more products, you will be able to pay us there the difference or if you want less, we will be able to refund you the difference as well. =) 

2. Payment: Enter your payment information. 

3. Design and shipping information: Don´t worry about that yet! At the end of the campaign we will send you a link where you will select the design of your products, the laser engraving information and give us your shipping information.

Why are we on Indiegogo?

At Bacanito we are convinced this is the best way to make our handcrafted products travel the world and allow our communities to empower. We will invest the money to open more artisan communities, buy raw material, and develop new products. 

Mexican, 33 years old. Her main passion has always been animals, so she decides to leave the corporate world to impulse Bacanito: An ecommerce and educational platform that seeks to promote a healthy, adventurous and cultural lifestyle in people with their pets. She is also an independent rescuer and volunteer on different organisations.

What else is she doing?

Taking a certification on canine behaviourist on the British College of Canine Studies. Member of Backstreet Dogs: Foundation that rescues dogs in Mexico and works with Canadian foundations to send dogs to Canada for adoption through flight parents. Devising a next project of therapeutic pets to help people through the multiple benefits that a dog or a cat gives us.

Risks & Challenges

Our collars and leashes are handmade, this means that each piece takes between 1 and 8 days (depending on size) to be woven, so we are not a mass production company. 
At the moment we are working with 6 communities on the states of Oaxaca, Puebla and Chiapas.  
We will be opening more communities according to the demand, but for the moment our capacity is 100 pieces per size each month. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don´t have a pet or can´t contribute but you liked our campaign, you can help us a lot:

Get the word out and make some noise of our project, especially to your friends with pets and craft lovers. Thank you!!! =) 

PRESS KIT

INSTAGRAM

story:
¿Qué es esto?

Okay, so What's this?

 

¡Bienvenidos a nuestra campaña!

¿Recuerdas haber hecho animaciones de hombrecitos de palos en tus cuadernos cuando estabas aburrido en clase? Nuestro proyecto es precisamente eso: una serie de seis flipbooks animados para pequeños y grandes. Los libros cuentan la historia de como un pequeño niño llamado Walter se encuentra con una vieja bota que ha viajado por todo el mundo afectando diferentes ecosistemas, y los animales que en ellos habitan. Todo termina con una tierna moraleja sobre las segundas oportunidades. 

El producto está casi listo para ser impreso, pero necesitamos obtener los fondos necesarios para cubrir los gastos de impresión. 

 

Welcome to our Campaign!

Do you remember ever doing a stick figure animation on the corner of your notebook while you were bored in class? Well, this project is precisely that: A series of six animted flipbooks for young and old alike. The books tell the story of how a small child named Walter encounters an old travelling boot that has been around the world affecting ecosystems and the animals that live in them. Everything ends with a sweet moral about second chances. 

 

The product is almost ready to be printed, but we need to obtain the necessary funding that the expensive printing process requires. 

¿Quienes Somos?

Who are you girls again?

  • Somos dos animadoras egresadas de la Universidad Veritas (Costa Rica) en 2016. Una de nosotras es hondureña, la otra es venezolana. Nos unen muchas cosas muy obvias en primera instancia, como el gusto por las películas animadas y la ilustración. Pero quizás nuestra característica más determinante fue el tener el valor de dejarlo todo atrás en nuestros respectivos países con la esperanza de cumplir nuestro sueño de contar historias y cambiar vidas a través de la animación. 
  • We're two animators graduated from Veritas University in Costa Rica (2016). One of us is honduran, the other one, venezuelan. We're united by many things, some of them are pretty obvious at first glance, like the love of animated films and illustration. But probably the most determining characteristic that bonds us is having had the guts to leave everything behind in our home countries to pursue the dream of chaning lives through animated stories. 
 

¿Qué necesitamos? ¿Qué obtienes tú a cambio?

What do we need? What's in this for YOU? 

Nosotras sólo queremos que los flipbooks sean una realidad. Así de sencillo. El simple hecho de ver la sonrisa en la cara de un niño que está genuinamente sorprendido por los flipbooks no tendría precio. Si aportas a nuestra campaña, no sólamente tendrás la oportunidad de tener tus propios flipbooks, sino que también le estarías obsequiando un paquete a un niño en un área marginal. Le haremos llegar como donación nuestros flipbooks a diferentes escuelas, bibliotecas, guarderías, y entidades de ayuda social sin fines de lucro, en Honduras, Costa Rica, y Venezuela. Por cada paquete de seis flipbooks que pre-ordenes, una escuela o guardería también recibirá su paquete. 

We just want the flipbooks to become a reality. Just the dream of seeing  child's smile when flipping the pages of our books is already something that you can't put a price tag on. If you contribute to our cause, you're not only purchasing your own flipbooks, but you'd also be guaranteeing that children of low income will have access to their own flipbooks as well. We're contacting different schools, non-profit organizations that aid children, libraries and daycares to make them a donation of our product for each six-flipbook-package you perk. 

 


  

¿Qué pasa si no logramos cumplir la meta?

What happens if we don't reach the goal?

¡No te preocupes! Los libros se imprimirán sí o sí, pero si no logramos cumplir la meta, nos llevará un poco más de tiempo conseguir los fondos necesarios para su impresión. Si sólo logramos recaudar un porcentaje, aún así será una gran contribución para el proyecto. 

Don't worry! The flipbooks will see the light of day either way, but if we don't meet our goal, it'll take us way more time to obtain the necessary funding for their printing. If we only obtain a percentage, that percentage will still be crucial for the funding of the project. 

Otras formas de ayudar...

Other Ways of Helping

 

Algunos de ustedes no podrán colaborar, pero aun así su apoyo es fundamental. Déjanos un comentario en la campaña para aumentar su popularidad y así ayudar a que otras personas la puedan ver. ¡También puedes compartir el enlace a la campaña en redes sociales! 

We understand that not all of you might collaborate, but still, your support is fundamental. Leave us a comment on the campaign to boost its popularity and don't forget to share the link in social media!
story_txt:
¿Qué es esto?
Okay, so What's this?
 ¡Bienvenidos a nuestra campaña!
¿Recuerdas haber hecho animaciones de hombrecitos de palos en tus cuadernos cuando estabas aburrido en clase? Nuestro proyecto es precisamente eso: una serie de seis flipbooks animados para pequeños y grandes. Los libros cuentan la historia de como un pequeño niño llamado Walter se encuentra con una vieja bota que ha viajado por todo el mundo afectando diferentes ecosistemas, y los animales que en ellos habitan. Todo termina con una tierna moraleja sobre las segundas oportunidades. 
El producto está casi listo para ser impreso, pero necesitamos obtener los fondos necesarios para cubrir los gastos de impresión. 
 
Welcome to our Campaign!  Do you remember ever doing a stick figure animation on the corner of your notebook while you were bored in class? Well, this project is precisely that: A series of six animted flipbooks for young and old alike. The books tell the story of how a small child named Walter encounters an old travelling boot that has been around the world affecting ecosystems and the animals that live in them. Everything ends with a sweet moral about second chances.  
The product is almost ready to be printed, but we need to obtain the necessary funding that the expensive printing process requires. 
¿Quienes Somos?
Who are you girls again?


Somos dos animadoras egresadas de la Universidad Veritas (Costa Rica) en 2016. Una de nosotras es hondureña, la otra es venezolana. Nos unen muchas cosas muy obvias en primera instancia, como el gusto por las películas animadas y la ilustración. Pero quizás nuestra característica más determinante fue el tener el valor de dejarlo todo atrás en nuestros respectivos países con la esperanza de cumplir nuestro sueño de contar historias y cambiar vidas a través de la animación.

story:
Why I am doing this

I have been taking pictures almost all my life, ever since my mother put a camera in my hands when I was a young child. My dream has been to become a professional art photographer. Now, I am coming to the end of my MA in photography at Westminster University and I want to launch myself. This is my first solo exhibition, my first opportunity to bring my art to public attention beyond the university. I need your help to make this a reality. I need your helping hand to reach out to an audience so that I can begin to establish myself in the identity that has always called to me.

What I need

Photographic exhibitions do not come cheap. The biggest cost is the venue. Doomed Gallery offers great value for money, but even so half of the budget is needed for the space and for refreshments at the opening. Next comes the printing and mounting of the photographs; and the creation of publicity materials and a limited print run of a beautiful catalogue of the mask pictures.

The photographic projects

The question of identity spans central concerns from understanding our own nature to gaining insights into the malleability of social identity. 

Unplaced

One series of pictures, Unplaced, is a meditation on how one's identity is not fixed for all time but twists and turns over the years of a lifetime. We look for a place inside ourselves that is our true identity, but it seems always to elude us.

Unfaced

The other series, Unfaced, is an analysis of the power of masks to animate a borrowed identity. We are who we are, but we can also be somebody else for a while, and masks possess an uncanny power to bring to life a character, or an aspect of the environment, or a condition of nature. 

The opening show

The private view will take place on the 8th of September at the Doomed Gallery, (Dalston, London, UK).
For more of my portfolio, see londowl.com.

story:
Our Initiative

FROM EAST TO WEST WITH LOVE is a 9 month project which has emerged from a growing cultural sector response to Eastern and Central European migrations and their implications for cultural policy, particularly in cities.

Through this intervention we seek to transform the exhibition space The Glass Box into an intersection of East and West, where the audience can experience and engage with the realities (both current and potential) of this interconnection. The two sides strive to highlight their identities in a current political climate of flux and uncertainty. The reality of a huge East-West demographic coming together will certainly remain, if not grow more apparent. 

FETWWL will be used as a platform for one-off events, discussion groups, film screenings as well as an open forum. Our open call for film created in collaboration with Kalejdoskop East-West has received over 80 international video submissions. The selected 15 will be screened on 27th September at Herbert Art Gallery & Museum. Whereas on the 6th October, the open forum will create opportunities for the local cultural community to learn and engage with the current changes in culture and the opportunities that Eastern and Western European mobility provides for the cultural and creative industries.


Why Coventry? 

The migrational influx of communities from Eastern and Central Europe into the city of Coventry requires cultural representation, along with mechanisms allowing for integration with other local communities which already exist within a city that understands itself through its cultural diversity. This two-week project will act as a vehicle for dialogue and networking across all cultures on the subject of the reality of cultural diversity, breaking through the apathy and scepticism following the political decline of ‘multiculturalism’. Communication between the East and West will take on many different strands encapsulating all areas of society. Within current political affairs it has become important to reflect on the connections and support mechanisms between countries and cultures across Europe. But there remains a huge amount of confusion and a lack of strategic action on the part of cultural and civil society actors. Who is doing what? Is it enough, and what could we do given the fragmented and embattled state of contemporary Europe?


Our Special Guest

Pawel Hajncel is one of the most radical, subversive and uncompromising artists in Poland. His public interventions were often the cause of national debates, as well as debates on social media. In his performances he comments on political, religious and social affairs.  During his performance in Coventry titled Patriotism for sale, he will respond to the attitude of Poles working and living in the UK. 


The Impact

With the rise in the numbers of Eastern European artists living and practising in the City, the region and across England, it is important that they are represented and that a public cognisance of that representation will be experienced in an open, creative and non-threatening way. This will allow for frank exchange and for the younger generation to consider a future of cultural possibilities through cultural exchange, interconnection and cultural relations. How can we work together and combine resources? How can Eastern European artists serve to increase our knowledge and understanding of contemporary culture across the Continent? The positive assertion of difference will change the self-understanding and portrayal of such communities in the city.

 Through the project we aim to:

  • Attract a range of audiences in order to release migrant artistic communities from a sense of segregation.
  • Challenge national cultural policy frameworks through an artistic intervention of cultural diversity in a European context.
  • Engage artists, students and local communities, with a new dialogue between Eastern and Western Europe, using contemporary issues, concepts and thinking.
  • Promote the expression of cultural diversity (2005 UNESCO Convention) in a post-multicultural political discourse of culture, and do so through creative, experimental and transnational practice.

With Coventry’s bid for The City of Culture 2021, we feel it is important that we mark city’s European arts and communities on the map!
 #Coventry2021 #ThisIsCoventry #EastWest


What You're Funding: 

  • Performance costs of our special guest Pawel Hajncel (flight tickets, materials, cement mixer [!] etc.) as well as other exhibition materials
  • The costs of the exhibition (tools, fixtures, refreshments etc.)
  • Travel expenses and fees for guest speakers
  • Printing: flyers & posters
  • A post project guide/toolkit 
The project has been awarded a small arts grant from Coventry City Council and Coventry University. However, in order do be able to deliver the project as fully proposed as well as to develop it further, we need this one last extra push! 


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please share the word and let our campaign be heard!
  • Like us on Facebook and invite others to like our page.
  • Join us at our free events and celebrate the East-West Europe dialogue.


Perks

Why not choose one of our perks as an exchange for your donation? Our participating artists including Pawel Hajncel, Anna Katarzyna Dmejko, Cristina Illie, Emilia Moniszko and Matthew Springer have donated their art works to help us raise the funds for the project. 
Please visit the Gallery tab at the top of this page to see all the works.


Project Authors
The project is directed and managed by Emilia Moniszko, Polish born visual artist and social entrepreneur who is working and living in Coventry. The co-direcor, Rob Hamp is a Stratford based author, artist and constructor.

Artists Involved

Ada Raczka
Adam Knight
Andrea Hannon
Anna Katarzyna Domejko
Arijana Lekić-Fridrih
Cristina Illie
Duygu Nazli Akova
Emiliano Zucchini
Eri Kassnel
Francois Kotenze 
Gilsuk Ko
Issa Issa
Jacek Doroszczenko
Kate Hawkins
Juliette Liautaud
Milan Zulic
Matthew Springer
Mohsen Zare
Olga Guse
Patt & Willy
Pawel Hajncel
Sandrine Deumier
Stephan Gross


Guest Speakers

Roma Piotrowska 
Paulina Palian
More TBC




Thank you for all your support!

story:
We are Plant Me Here. We are constantly changing, constantly growing, constantly experimenting. We make gross, weird, gripping, funny, tragic art in as many ways as we can think of with as many people as we can find. This summer we need your help to make a Fringe experience that no one will forget.  

Who We Are 

Plant Me Here is a collective of artists changing the way art gets created, consumed, and supported through collaborative, experimental, genre-defying performance. You might have seen us playing ukulele in front of a TV in the Walnut Street subway station, or hosting a haunted house in the back of a U-Haul. You might have seen us in an abandoned warehouse, or on top of the Reading Viaduct, or at a Christmas fair in beachwear. You might have seen our performances in venues throughout the city, be it at a bar, a park, a dance space, an art gallery, or a theater. Maybe you heard about us through one of the 100+ artists we’ve worked with over the course of our making. Maybe you found our page on Instagram and are still trying to figure out what the heck we’re doing. 

We’re proud to be creating work that inspires, confounds, disgusts, delights, and moves. We have been making together since our founding in 2014 as a part of Emma Arrick’s Artist Residency at BRAT Productions, and have a vibrant, diverse, prolific portfolio to show for it: we’ve taken 15 live performances to over 30 venues in Philadelphia and New York. Showings of our work have been classified as immersive experience, dance theatre, long distant spectacle performance, installed public performance, mobile installation, staged poetry, performance art, and our favorite: interdisciplinary noise musical. 

We’ve worked through 4 phases of Plant Me Here, each with wildly different content, forms, audiences, guest artists, and missions. For our 5th and most ambitious phase yet, we’re travelling throughout the Mid-Atlantic to shoot The House at the End of the World, a silent film live scored by our ensemble that will premiere in the 2016 Philadelphia Fringe Festival at Cinemug Cafe.  

The film, curated and directed by Emma Arrick, features Susanne Collins, Gracie Martin, Tess Kunik, Tory Trama and Dan Rosen. Generated collaboratively by our ensemble, in concert with an original collection of poetry by Jason Rosenberg, it will feature cinematography by ensemble members Tess, Emma, and Dan and longtime collaborator Robert Curry of Zimbo films.

Where YOU Come In!

We need your help to get this gigantic project off the ground! All funds raised will go directly towards the expenses associated with this project. Conservatively, we estimate $5,000 in costs including:

  • Travel and Lodging: We will be filming in the Greater Baltimore and Philadelphia regions over the course of the next 2 months, and will need to pay for things like van rentals, gas, motel rooms, and bus tickets.

  • Costume and Props: A crucial part of our vision of the world of our film.

  • Fringe Fees: Registration, Insurance, ect.

  • Publicity: Promotional print materials like postcards and posters, as well as compensation for the artists who design them.

  • Artists' Fees: We believe in fairly compensating the people who make our art; the work of our ensemble, our featured collaborators, and to those who provide administrative and logistical support.

  • Space Rental: From our Fringe venue to the spaces we shoot in.

  • Equipment Rental: We’ll need fancy stuff like contact microphones, soundboards, lighting, and speakers.

Any amount of money or attention you could give to this campaign would go towards helping us continue to develop ways of making and promoting bold, recklessly innovative art; art that builds communities and challenges tradition; art with an aesthetic that is strengthened with every new collaboration; art that addresses the changing landscape of producing live performance

Why You Should Give 
We are an ongoing experiment in collaboration, guided by our open-studio devising process. We believe how we make is just as important as what we make, and the best way to answer a question is with as many voices as possible. At the start of each new project, we have a series of open-studio rehearsals, where we work with artists across all disciplines to generate content that informs our final product, and ensures that each new phase of our work has a new flux of ideas through which to draw inspiration. These artists are then invested in our work in a meaningful, concrete way, and reach out to their networks to tell others about their experience, creating an interactive loop with our audiences that provokes involvement and excitement. We’re unaware of any other group utilizing a model quite like this to make their work, and we believe it has the potential to change the way art is made, seen, and supported.

Want More Info?  

We are literally all over the dang internet. 

Check us out on FACEBOOK , VIMEO, SOUNDCLOUD, and INSTAGRAM (@plantmehere). 

Follow this show's hashtag, #PMHendoftheworld for more updates on our campaign and our work!
 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, but feel inclined to get involved, the most important thing you can do is share this page with your network and let them know how excited you are about what we're doing! 

If you'd like a more hands-on role, or are interested in signing up for our next open-studio, please contact us at emmaarrick@gmail.com

At the start of each new project, we have a series of open-studio rehearsals, where we work with artists across all disciplines to generate content that informs our final product, and ensures that each new phase of our work has a new flux of ideas through which to draw inspiration. These artists are then invested in our work in a meaningful, concrete way, and reach out to their networks to tell others about their experience, creating an interactive loop with our audiences that provokes involvement and excitement. We’re unaware of any other group utilizing a model quite like this to make their work, and we believe it has the potential to change the way art is made, seen, and supported.


Want More Info?   We are literally all over the dang internet. 
Check us out on FACEBOOK , VIMEO, SOUNDCLOUD, and INSTAGRAM (@plantmehere). 
Follow this show's hashtag, #PMHendoftheworld for more updates on our campaign and our work!  
    Other Ways You Can Help 
If you can't donate, but feel inclined to get involved, the most important thing you can do is share this page with your network and let them know how excited you are about what we're doing! 

If you'd like a more hands-on role, or are interested in signing up for our next open-studio, please contact us at emmaarrick@gmail.com

story:
PART 2...

Two years ago, "I.AM.ART" was born. With your support, which I am forever grateful for, I was able to put on an artistic exhibition I was proud to share with everyone. I'm very passionate about art, so I couldn't have been happier. The feedback was motivating and inspiring. Since October 2, 2014, two years, trials and...life, to say the least, have occured. However daunting, trials tends to be the perfect recipe for new artistic material.

The canvases are prepared. The ideas are in motion. This time, we are focusing on the movement along with the visual arts aspect. What is the movement? With so much happening in the world, art (and the arts) is the one thing that universally moves us positively, creating a sense of peace and comfort at the end of the day. We, in fact, are all human manifestations of art in some way. Art is emotion. Emotion can be translated into/defined by color! Thus WE ARE and daily create ART.

True success comes from the mind and heart. From people who believe in the absolute ability that something great can be achieved, even if it seems impossible. Using this platform, I will bring to life the whirlwind of artistic ideas in my mind and share them with the world through art exhibitions and some really cool collaborations that are in the works. Art is meant to be shared. It's the physical completion of a vision, clearing the pathway to  move forward to the next idea.

Most ideas remain ideas because of two factors; fear and expense. I'm overcoming fear, a day and a canvas at a time. I invite you join me on this artistic journey. The money donated will be appreciated tremendously. The results of your support will be evident in the quality of events and exhibits. I hope to be in your city soon. Thank you in advance for helping me to reach this goal and bring my dreams to life. This is the beginning.

-Roderick Orlando

story:
Introduction 

In 2003, excited with my new born child I decided to leave my banking career and pursue a more fulfilling and socially beneficial venture. So I became a partner in AK Comics; creators of the first Middle Eastern Superheroes and original comic books.  Despite the financial and political risks (due to being based in Cairo, Egypt and eventually having to immigrate because of the pressures) I never looked back, and continued to write and publish till this day. Nothing is more rewarding to me.  

Snormfly was a short story I wrote a few years ago, like the dozens of other stories and concepts I developed it sat idly in a folder on my computer until September of last year (2015) when I went to Burning Man. There I was introduced to the wonderful world and art of Android Jones and got to meet the man himself. He is a very talented and socially responsible visionary, like myself, driven to create art to enlighten and entertain. I'm eternally grateful for his cooperation (and his amazing team) for taking the time out of busy schedule to create custom art for this story, for without him this  wonderful story would have never seen the light of day. Thank you my dear friend!

"In my practice I have visited realms where the imagination ends, and the terrifying beauty of infinity unfolds over and over again."  Android Jones

About Snormfly

Snormfly is best described as a contemporary take on the Dr. Suess novels; its child-like yet sophisticated, playful yet deals with important issues and concepts, a light read that will (hopefully) have a strong impact on the reader encouraging them to think, contemplate and reflect on the state of humanity today and our future.   

I wrote this story with my young children (8 and 6 years old at the time) in mind and have since read it with them on several occasions and we found it to be a compelling and stimulating family activity. While this book is a wonderful read for anyone, it is ideal for young families with an idealistic and optimistic views who want to challenge their children to something more than the average children's books. Those new-age spiritual and concerned parents, those vegetarians and vegans, yoga moms and recycling dads, those artsy free-spirited folks will enjoy this book the most.  

Funding

Like my  previous projects (See_Jinn Warriors on Kicktstater.com) Snormfly is self-funded up to this point, so your contributions will go into completing the design of the book, publishing and printing costs, distribution and (hopefully) recap some of the investment in the art and my time - we all need to make money to live.   

The way I'm treating this is less like fund-raising and more like pre-sales orders. My goal is to pre-sell 1000 books at $12/copy (cover price is $15) with *FREE shipping in North America. So you may order just one book, two or four (get one free) or increments of four there after. Books make GREAT gifts (especially when signed like these), you may want to donate them to your local library, hospital, orphanage, school, anyone/organization in your community or any where in the world. You can donate them in person or I can ship them directly and provide you proof of shipping which can be used for a tax deduction (given it was sent to a known charitable organization).

You really can't go wrong when with investing in us, writers and artists, thus being a part of the process that brings art and books to life, and of course, giving the gift of reading to someone.

Thank you and best reagrds from

Marwan El Nashar and the publishing team

Android Jones and the art team          

* Some conditions may apply

story:
Who we are

Max and Rubi, the team behind Ursus Fine Art, have traveled the world and now make their home in Spain. Working from photos—his own, and Rubi's—Max creates wonderfully detailed images in pen and ink and watercolor. In addition to city views and landscapes, our favorite subjects include nature and wildlife. We also enjoy doing commissions, such as "house portraits" of the places you call home.

Where will the money go?

The funds that we raise will meet our needs in these categories:

Moving expenses     We need to move Ursus Fine Art into a studio in the Madrid area. These funds will go toward realtor fees, a security deposit for the space, and moving truck rental.

Transitional operating expenses     In order to focus on creating more work and growing the business, we would like to raise three months' operating expenses—the resulting peace of mind will permit us to really stretch ourselves.

Studio furnishings     We'll be setting up the new studio with easy to clean work surfaces and dedicated storage solutions—but nothing fancy here! (Think "big blue box" store.)

Equipment     We need to upgrade our camera equipment to professional level; we'd also like to purchase our own printer—one that uses archival inks and accepts a wider variety of media. (Currently, we create our prints through an outside vendor.) Being able to print in the studio will mean lower costs and greater creativity for us.

Supplies     An art studio like Ursus goes through a lot of material—paper, paint, pens... We would like to have a comfortable level of supplies on hand as we grow.

Extras     Any additional money raised will go toward travel to wonderful places near and far. Naturally, we'll share our discoveries with you.

The Impact

Your contribution, no matter the amount, moves us closer to our goal of creating a viable art business and making our dreams a reality.

Risks & Challenges

It won't be easy to make our way in the art world, and at the same time, we feel strongly that the world needs more artists and dreamers. The Ursus Fine Art team is made up of equal parts creative vision (Max) and real-world sales and marketing savvy (Rubi)—we believe that is a winning combination.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that it isn't always possible to make a financial contribution to a campaign like this one. Happily, there are more ways to help each other than there are stars in the sky. Here are a few suggestions that will really make a difference to our success.

First, and most importantly, please share our campaign—via email, on social media, or in any of the good, old-fashioned ways—with your friends and family. 

In addition, please like and follow our Facebook page and/or favorite our Etsy shop (UrsusFineArt). We'll announce new images, share special offers for our supporters, and update you on our progress.

We are so grateful for your support!

story:
Read and Grow! The Dream Garden Mural

Tiles and Technology!

“Up in the garden, I stand and plan—my hand full of seeds and my hands full of dreams.”

This is the opening line of Kate Messner’s story that will appear in the mural - great inspiration for our community. The mural pictures a garden scene with critters in the dirt, sunflowers with metal gears as their heads, the sun, clouds, sky, trees, books, and animals. The names of local children’s book authors will also be in the mural as leaves on a tree. 

The mural features exciting interactive elements such as 3D printed marble raindrops that will circulate the perimeter of the mural powered by solar energy to represent the rain cycle. A marble machine design team comprised of robotics students, teachers and technical experts is now working on the marble portion of the mural. This spring, YOU will have an opportunity to make tiles for the mural at the Library through a series of community tile making workshops led by Sue Young.

All mural design and construction will take place on the third floor of the Plattsburgh Public Library, a soon-to-be community maker space, which will officially open in conjunction with the mural unveiling in July 2017.  We will install this 18 feet by 10 feet mural on the outside wall of the Plattsburgh Public Library, which faces the YMCA on Brinkerhoff Street. This marks the beginning of the Plattsburgh Arts Corridor.

Muralist Sue Young also designed the Mountain Lake Mandala mural and the mural on the Clinton County Government Building. Kate Messner is an award-winning children’s book author with a national reputation who lives right here in Plattsburgh. 

This is an ambitious project and Outside Art needs your help!

Finish up 2016 by helping Plattsburgh become its best self. Support public art in your community! Any amount will help.

story:
About this Project: 

 

My name is Kirsten, and I love to create. I fell in love with ceramics in high school and continued studying it at Utah State along with Environmental Studies. In the years since I have graduated I have run around in different ski shops, offices, classrooms, and gardens, but I have always felt complete and grounded when I return to studio spaces that smell like clay. 

I decided to do this campaign as a way to challenge myself. I wanted to create a goal that felt just out of my reach, but something I know I can put my head down and achieve. I have had countless friends, family, and strangers express how much they would love for me to create something for them, and I in turn would love to undergo that process, but too often we seem to never get around to actually making it happen. With this campaign comes accountability from both parties and the drive to create beautiful things for beautiful people.  ​

 

 What You Get:

A wise woman once told me that commissions were the best way to get moving in the studio. My goal of raising 3,000 in commissions in one week will help offer me allowance to continue working freely in my studio throughout the summer and take significant steps towards walking though life as a potter.

I have arranged a line of items that can be commissioned and their prices. My goal is to have everything completed and delivered by the end of June. Work will be produced in the order it is requested so get in fast if you want a quicker turn around! 

 

I work in both white and red clay. If you have a preference please specify. Nothing is more fun that having the artistic freedom to create what I want, but if you have some specifications on what you would like please email me and lets work out the perfect piece for you! Thank you for your support in this journey. I am insanely excited to get started! 

 

** Shipping**

Please note the listed cost does not include shipping. I am hoping to deliver most of the orders in person, they can also be picked up from my studio space in Sugarhouse. As for out of state orders, I will be able to calculate shipping costs once the product is made. Sorry if this is inconvenient! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I so greatly appreciate your time and if you're reading this, that you got this far! If placing an order isn't right for you at this time, please take a minute to share this with friends and family, the more the merrier! Thank you so much for your love and support!
